The real plants are beneficial in absorbing nitrates, phosphates, and controling algae growth, but if you have a tank full of real plants you would have to add fertilizer, special substrate, co2 injection etc. Having fake plants in the background and a few real plants in the mid and foreground means less plant maintainance.

I think it's interesting how the photo shows THREE bird perches. That is what I thought I was getting. Evidently you're only getting ONE for a fairly substantial price. Honestly, I *feel* misled. If a seller's product PHOTO shows 3 items, YOU SHOULD GET 3. If only ONE perch comes with the order ONLY SHOW ONE. I tried looking at the item listing on Amazon again after I received only one perch. Some links show one perch, some show 3. Of course, perhaps the seller is illustrating the three lovely colors the perches are available in. If there are sellers out there who do not understand that showing 3 perches in the description can make customers think they are buying 3 for the price - this is for you:IF YOU SHOW A PICTURE OF 3 ITEMS IN YOUR ADD, SOME CUSTOMERS WILL THINK THEY ARE GETTING 3. You've been notified. Now, show ONE perch ANY photos related to the product if that's all you intend to ship to them.I had a similar experience recently ordering through Amazon. The photo showed one collectable item. I ordered it (at a fairly steep price, by the way), and a much different version arrived. The seller explained the the *title* of the add said it was the other version. I sent it back. I buy a great many things from Amazon. I think it's a great business and I applaud their success. HOWEVER, if they keep *not noticing* this kind of thing happening to customers, I'll start taking my business elsewhere.Both of these orders where with smaller businesses with amazon "storefronts" - not from Amazon themselves.As far as the item itself (as long as you understand you're only getting one for the price). It's excellent. I have 3 parakeets and they like to get on it, sharpen their beaks, and nibble at it. So, the product is very nice - just what I had hoped for. Now I just need to get a few more - and I WON'T be ordering them here.

The Litter Robot with the bubble window is quite an amazing product - works exactly as it is stated BUT my smallest cat, one of three, is so fascinated by the moving globe that she keeps stepping on it to see what is going on inside - therefore the robot will stop and YOU have to be there to reset it - the machine stops until it is reset by you, otherwise you will have a litter box upside down with no litter in it for the next cat. I have to resort to not leaving it on automatic, I have to turn it off when it cycles to the end and then during the afternoon, and once before retiring I hit the button to cycle it and then leave it off for the entire night. This is NOT a malfunction of the machine, it is my CAT. The other two cats could care less about the globe turning and use it with no problem whatsoever. I give this product 5 stars because it eliminates scooping litter ever again. I do not mind just having to shut it on and off a few times a day for that luxury. Customer service was extremely helpful as well because our first unit malfunctioned but they immediately sent another to replace it. again a 5 star outstanding product!

I brought this collar for my Pitbull I didn't read the bottom line that states add 2 to 3 inches because the company measures their collars differently than every company I've brought from in the past. Overall a great collar I don't have to worry about my Pit breaking his collar when he pulls on it while I'm walking him. I recommend this Collar with anyone who has big dogs or insanely strong dog like Pitbulls or Rotts.

I had one of the original dog doors from before this company changed hands, it was solid grey, with no window. They were robust, and still work beautifully.I bought another one for a dog house, brown with plexiglass inner door, a few years ago, and it wasn't as good as the original grey one. Lighter weight, and didn't seem to seal as well.This is my third one - building a dog door for my patio slider. The basics are still there - but much more flimsy then the brown one. I'll use it, but its just sad that the quality isn't what it used to be. I'd pay more for better quality.

This is a fantastic product if you have a rowdy dog that pulls you when you walk it. You put it on your dog and it will listen to you immediately. They don't like to be pulled by their face and will learn how to listen to you with this gentle leader.

The gemstones that appear to be red glass are actually clear glass gemstones painted red. The description doesn't make this information clear. The photo of the item looks like 100% red glass gemstones but this is not the case.

Our 7 mo. Golden Retriever puppy instantly loved this toy, jamming her nose into the plush tree holes to get at the squeaky critters and carry them around a bit. Though we adored seeing her happy and supervised her closely, I think this toy has one considerable flaw- it seems poorly constructed. The concept is great, but the object just didn't hold up for the recommended play. Just by playing at our feet for a few minutes at a time, she popped a hole in the bottom, ripped the thread holding the felt leaves and seams holding the tree trunk together, and yanked out loose stuffing. She also easily ripped off the weakly adhered fur on the animal tails. We use and love interactive toys, but even for a supervised toy, it didn't stay intact for even a few days. She's had the iQube too, which was a bit sturdier. I wish this company would make a better product for the good concepts they have.

Okay, I read dang near every review before I made this purchase.My thoughts...This is a great buy if you are looking for a cheaper substitute compared to the tougher stackable containers in the store. But with that said, it is not without its flaws. First I must say that I saw a lot of reviews saying that this container couldn't fit a 40lb bag of dog food. That is false. Because it can. I put a 15lb bag of Wellness puppy mixed with a 15lb bag of BlueBuffalo puppy small kibble in the container, and I could have fit more than 10 lbs more. I think it all has to do with the size and density of the kibble that determines how much space it takes up in the container. If you got a 40lb bag of large light weight kibble, then you may find it hard to fit the entire bag, but if you got small breed or puppy size kibble and its a rich and heavy mix, then you will find it easy to fit more than 40lbs.But on to the flaw... the plastic, although sturdy isn't the strongest. It does get a air tight seal, but when I got my container, it was cracked. it was stacked on during shipping and the container was not tough enough to have a heavy load on top. Amazon replaced it immediately and paid return shipping, but still I'm disappointed with the quality of the plastic. But for 25 bucks, could you really expect it to be any better? Probably not. Other than it not being stackable or the strongest material, it gets the job done. I'm satisfied.

This filter was fantastic while it worked. Rinsed the filters every now and then, and I could not have a better filter. However, we had a power outage for less then ten mtinutes, and it quit working after I had it only six months. It never turned on again after that. I cleaned every part of that filtration system. Big disappointment. When it works, its great, just dont count on long term.

My cat doesn't hate the taste of this toothpaste. In fact I think he might actually like it if I wasn't jamming a foreign object in his mouth while he tasted it. The finger cap is totally useless. It's huge and impossible to use on a cat. The brush is the perfect size for a tiny feline mouth, however the bristles are way too stiff. I'm lucky enough to have a cat that won't struggle/fight during his brushing so I can be a little more gentle than if I was trying to juggle holding him down and brushing his teeth at the same time.Construction of the product is high quality, kitty will be having his teeth brushed for quite some time with this one.

My dogs are obsessed with these. First I bought the wrong ball - don't be confused with the treat ball where you put small treats inside. I nearly died when I realized that i needed to buy TWO balls that were more than TWENTY DOLLARS EACH!! (thinking: "these had BETTER be good")My dogs are 11 lbs each and I got the medium ball. I think that's the right size. I gave them each a ball with a treat in both sides. After two days gone to work (22hrs in total) they've eaten the treats. So I have to spend at LEAST $7 per dog to utilize these balls for 2 days out of the week.Hmmm...this is like a smoking addiction or something.If you need for shorter periods of time; i.e. while you watch a movie, dinner, gone for coupla hours, GREAT toy. I do have to be careful because my two dogs will fight over one ball when another is sitting a few feet away. I guess they REALLY like them.Good luck.

I've been giving this to my Green Naped Lorikeets occasionally over the years, as a substitute for Lory Life Nectar. Mainly as a change of pace, or when Lory Life is out of stock.They seem to be quite fond of the taste. The problem is, it doesn't dissolve properly. We always end up with a bunch of uneaten mush on the bottom of the bowl.I'm glad this product exists, but I wish they would improve it.
The picture looks better than what you actually get...... none of my cats will use them cause the covering does not lock tight against the steps

I purchased this jacket for my female yellow labrador retriever. We tried it out this week while we were experiencing unseasonably cold rains. The jacket covered her well, but it became soaked by the rain, has no moisture repellency. The problem was that the jacket took 24 hours to dry out. This was not a downpour of a rain, but more like steady showers. I am convinced that this will be a problem when snow fall is a factor. I would not buy this jacket again and I would not recommend it for others.
Very happy with the API FW/SW PHOSPHATE TEST KIT. It is so important to test for phosphates to head off algae issues. The kit arrived on time and works well.

I have been using this brand of bulb for about a year now. Throughout the year no bulb has lasted more than a month. This bulb is cheap, but in the long run you do not save money. I have 4 terrariums I need these bulbs for so I am slowly upgrading for a better brand. For the time being it is convenient.

HiI searched and researched all kinds of gates and finally decided on the Richell after reading the many good reviews. I cannot tell you enough how happy and satisfied I am with this product. It is not only gorgeous looking but the quality is 100% excellent and it is supper sturdy. Just exactly what I was looking for. I bought two of them and managed to connect them together. My only complain is that there is no door so you have to step over them to get to the other side. I bought the 27" high ones so it makes it harder to go over them. Still I give them a 9 1/2 rating out of 10 or an A-. I do not regret one bit expending the extra money for a quality product.

So I have 3 dogs that all love to sleep in the bed with me... 2 jack russells and a boxer.... yea... it was getting pretty crowded with Roxanne, my boxer growing so fast. so i started my research and it brought me to this bed here... i read and read and compared and just came to the conclusion that this was the bed for them... well i just received it a few days ago and the bed is awesome! at first roxanne didn't take too much interest in it... but she did what she was told and stayed in her bed... she ended up sneaking back into my bed in the morning... so of course i let her... i kno it's more of just wanting to be by my side more than anything... but as soon as she got up samson, one of my jack russells, jumped right into her bagel bed and knocked out! the only thing now is that they don't want to share... so i'm going to end up ordering another 2 beds for them. so each one of my dogs have their own little bed... i ordered the XL thinking they would all just cuddle together cause that thing is huge... but it's more than big enough for roxanne, and i'll be ordering the mediums for my other 2 doggies. i read the reviews about the whole washing them thing... i think i like that there isn't a cover and u have to wash the whole thing. i mean it's not like if the dog smell is just in the cover... it's in the whole bed... so it just makes sense to wash the whole thing... i'm just saying. but again this doggie bed... AWESOME!! so worth my money!!

Ordered this bed after reviewing several brands. The dog bed arrived when expected, but we ended up returning it. We have a big lab-mix indoor dog and we found the medium -sized bed too small. Although the bed seemed well-made, with a nice thick pad that was quite soft and comfortable, the heating element in the pad seemed to generate very little, if any heat. The mild vibrating function of the bed appeared to work well. I tried to order the next size up on the same bed, but at the time it was not available and I noticed was considerably higher in price when it would be available. If your dog is over 70 lbs I would suggest the large size, hopefully the bigger size has a heating pad that generates more heat.

Bought this stuff after my dog ate something and vomited heavily on my carpet. I followed the directions exactly but the vomit smell was still overwhelming. I re-treated and the smell was still there. I ended up re-treating again and again till I went through the whole bottle on one spot. Even after using the whole bottle the smell was still there. I would not buy this again.
great product. cuts your kitty litter work in half but they're a bit pricey. buy the liners and get some extra uses out of each receptacle.

I purchased this crate for my newly adopted greyhound. I thought the price was very good, and looked forward to receiving it and setting it up prior to his arrival. When the shipment arrived, the box was literally battered to death. The heavy duty copper staples were pulled out of the corners in some instances and, as I am sure you can surmise, some of the bars on the crate were now bent and took quite a bit of work to get them where they would lock into place as needed. The door locks still will not line up unless I push down on the top each time I put him in there. This manufacturer needs to seriously re-evaluate how they package such a heavy item for shipping. At the minimum, a much heavier grade cardboard and how about some corner supports to keep those from giving way during shipment? I literally could tear the cardboard apart with my hands. Not sturdy at all!

Both my dogs had a bad case of goopy eyes and I gave this product a shot. The entire system takes a while to complete and it's not easy it remember what step to do next. I saw some improvement while doing the system but it was not a cure. Next time I think I'll save the time and effort and just keep flushing thier eyes with warm distilled water.

I have a middle-aged female brittany with moderate separation anxiety. I've moved into my parent's house for a few months and I have to lock her in the basement while I am at work. Soon after I moved in, my dad (who works from home) reported that she barks for about THREE hours while I am gone. My vet recommended the spray collar.At first it worked PERFECTLY. She stopped barking after about 4 barks. But after about a month the spray thing stopped working and leaked citronella all over her one day! However, I called the company and they set a new one a few weeks later at no cost (They gave us new extra spray and a new battery too!).The second collar worked well for about two more months. But just recently, things have changed. She now barks occasionally while locked in the basement (but not nearly as much). Then, when she hears me get home from work and when she sees me...she gets so excited that she lets loose! She barks up a storm, letting the collar spray her (and me as she tries to lick my face...). She has also figured out that the collar is the source of her troubles. I take it off when I come home (to let her out) and the minute she hears it "click!" off, she barks louder and more frantically than ever! I'm just hoping she doesn't figure out how to take it off herself. I wouldn't put it past her!So, all in all, it has helped out for when I'm away from home quite a bit, but I get a shower of citronella when I come home...

1) Leave a massively strong smell. If it's irritating me as a human, I can only imagine how bad it must be for super-smell cats. My cat was whining a bit an hour after using these wipes, and the only thing that could be wrong is the smell.2) Didn't really remove any dirt. Totally misses the undercoat.3) Leaves a residue. My cat didn't feel soft but felt sort of greasy.I ended up giving my cat a nice bath to get the smell and grime off him. Lots of dirt went down the drain and my cat ended up super soft, and a lighter shade of grey.

Over the last 15 years I have tried every brand of carbon out there. From Marinlan to the generic brands even some of the store brands that you buy from Petco or Petsmart.Does this work? Oh yeah quite well in fact. BUT so does the cheap stuff. I have bought 3lb bags of generic carbon from a seller here on Amazon and that stuff works just as well.The difference? On this product they break it all into tiny little bits compared to the cheap stuff is usually in pellet form.personally I have considered even grinding or blending (in a blender) the cheap stuff to see if you can achieve the same consistency as the more prepared stuff from this company or Marineland. Not that I can or can not prove ot really makes any difference.Personally I am going back to the cheap stuff. I clean my filter every two months and replace the carbon then and like I said can't see any difference. At least not one worth paying 5x as much for .
it works really wellu can put it on when dog is damp still from bathworx against 'skeeters, fleas, tickskeeps her from scratching and from biting off the fur on her buttlasts a monthworth the money

My cats haven't been really into this. I think part of the problem is that it threatens to topple over whenever they climb on it. I got the little seat that attaches to the top, and that helps, but overall it just sits in the corner and they don't really mess with it. It's an expensive toy that simply gets no use. I think it could be a lot sturdier - I don't blame them for not climbing on it, I'd be afraid of it falling, too.

I think this is due to my rabbit's personality, but my rabbit just ignores it. As for the product itself, it is just as pictured and if a rabbit happens to like it, I think it'll be a great ball to chew and play with.

Purchased the Littermaid LME9000 automatic cleaning litter box because our old one died after about 5 years. Our two cats are on the larger side so I figured I's give them more room in their bathroom by getting the bigger box. It works great except that it's underpowered. For whatever reason, when one of the cats uses the litter box the other has to do the same about 5 minutes later. The LME9000 isn't always strong enough to take the waste out of the box from two cats at the same time so I end up having to clean it manually.
i guess these done what they were suppose to, not sure. my rabbits ate them. one rabbit still has his and uses it for his bathroom

This is truly an amazing product! I was not sure if it would really work on my little pure white Maltese, but whalaa! After a week or so we could notice a major difference in her. I was also concerned because she was only a puppy (3 months) and I was not sure how the powder would work on dry food - both worries were for nothing! Works great!
The bark collar I received has really curbed Max's excessive silly barking at things he thinks he hears. He catches himself before he barks now. I think it's great. Sally from WI

I own two cats and have two litter boxes--one Clevercat and one front-entry. One cat tends to leap out of the Clevercat and scatter litter everywhere, so it doesn't really work when he uses it. The other stops on top of the lid of the Clevercat on her way out, which reduces her litter scatter. Bottom line: you won't be able to tell how your cat will react until it uses the box. I'd say it's very slightly better than a front-entry box, but not good enough to purchase another.
Seems like a fine cat toy, but unlike the picture, you only get one of these toys, and for the current price of $8 that's a little steep. Next time, I'll just go to Petco.
our local animal shelter needed this product and this is the lowest price I have found thus far. I will continueto buy this product periodically for our shelter.

First off...ive seen these...my favorite restaurant has these all over the place..i was looking at one last night and was shocked to see how THIN this thing is..its thinner than my plasma tv ! How can the poor fish live and thrive in a enviroment like this?first off...a fish aquarium is a natural habitat for the fish..not some art deco piece...as i was having my dinner i was watching one fish literally gasp for air because the "TANK" is so thin.. this is not the way to treat fish! you want to do the right thing with fish? give them room to thrive and breath...my gold oranda had a nice 10 gallon aquarium all to himself..and he loves it..i could just watch him for hours swimming all over the place..i wouldnt dream of putting him into a frame tank...this idea is ludacris.....and another thing i have to point out..water has mass..and it gets heavy..how can you even think to hang something like this on the wall? its bound to crash to the floor killing the poor fish...a friend of mine has one of these wall tanks and he was saying he has 4 fish die on him in a month..hmm i wonder why?bottom line..if you want to have fish and enjoy them get a real aquarium tank..and not this "torture tank for fish" .. . you fish will thank you for it if you are stupid enough to buy this kind of tank you DONT DESERVE TO HAVE FISH period...my friend works at petsmart and he was telling me they have some of these tanks on clearence and they dont even sell .. it makes you wonder..these are a accident waiting to happen.

It's a great concept, but I found it difficult to make. The putty stuck to the dog's paw, and it was more challenging than anticipated. At the end, the ornament does not look great, but the memory will be there. I would still buy another one, but my expectations would be lower.

I am going back to picking them up at the store, Wal-mart has the ones my bird likes anyways. He still made his way through these, I felt bad about the smell, but he didn't. lol. Anyways I would recommend these only if you live somewhere exclusive and you can't get any locally then these are a steal. I usually pay 5$ just for one that's about the size of these plus half of the other one from walfart.
I would love it if it worked. Still trying but so far, Action Air Treasure Chest & diver has no action except a few bubles!

My dog, who has a sensitive stomach, tolerates this product well and really likes it. In consistency it is like soft pepperoni sausage, which makes it more convenient to handle than canned food under some circumstances. For example, I can cut a slice of it and send it with my dog to dog care in a plastic bag, whereas sending canned food can be a problem if I want to give him a portion less than a whole can.The roll is shelf stable for a period of time, but once opened must be refrigerated, and if you are not going to use it for a while, should be frozen. This is a large roll which will take up space in the fridge. I put a plastic grocery bag over the open end and held it on with rubber bands.Three stars because of the ingredients. The ingredients are listed differently on the roll than they are on this or any other website that I've found. The first three listed ingredients are: lamb lungs, wheat flour, and sugar. Many dogs are allergic to wheat, so this is not a great choice; and I can't imagine why there should be sugar in anything claiming to be a dog food. Maybe in a dog treat.
My dog loves these hedgehogs. He has one for inside and outside. They aren't as durable as I'd like them to be but that's ok as long as he's happy

We've had this ball for all of two months; however, it should have been replaced a month ago. The cap falls off ALL THE TIME--at least twice each evening that our Syrian hamster is running in it. Luckily, we have hardwood floors, so we can hear when the cap comes loose and can catch him before he runs too far. I wouldn't recommend this brand--buy a different one.
My pigs hated the harness, it seemed cruel to keep it on. Guinea pigs are fragile, harnesses are meant for larger, stronger animals, not little guinea pigs.

I purchased this toy for my 7-month-old Border Collie and had it sent on to me in New Zealand by a friend in the US. Unfortunately, this means I'd need to jump through hoops (and big shipping expense) to return it or it would be on its way back.The packaging arrived in perfect condition but on opening the box I noticed that one of the squirrels had stuffing poking out of its head. On closer inspection it was obvious that the stitching hasn't been done properly. Two of the squirrels have holes and need to be sewn up before my puppy can play with it.I bought the Jumbo size in the hope that my dog would get plenty of playtime with the toy and its very disappointing that the quality is so poor. Thankfully, I noticed these before my dog got to play with the toy as I doubt she would have been able to resist pulling the stuffing out!

Unfortunately, i didn't look at any reviews before buying this product. Like others said, the range is not near six to ten feet, more like a few inches. My dog didn't even act like she heard anything either, it is worthless. I'm hoping I can return it.

I bought this product because my dog won't stop barking when tied up outside. When I first put it on her, she would bark and immediately get sprayed in the face. While it definitely helped her stop barking (at first), she quickly learned that if she barked enough, the collar would quickly empty and then she could continue to bark her little heart out. It was a pain to keep running outside to refill the collar as it doesn't hold enough spray at one time. She also went through 1 can of spray in 2 days. Another drawback, the dog smells after wearing the collar. I think the collar would work for the less determined dog but for us it was a fail. It may work if you are willing to keep refilling the collar every 10 minutes for a few days. It is a good place to start for those who don't want to use the shock collar like ourselves.

My power chewer beagle destroys toys as fast as I can buy them. This one tends to have a longer life span than most. I bought 4 -- 2 have survived. He also destroyed a couple at the doggie day camp he attends. However, the casualties were around for a good 4 to 6 weeks. While I wish my beagle would not be able to destroy these kongs, it's an improvement. He used to chew on the screen doors, air conditioning unit, and dig tunnels to China. Yes -- we have a call in to Cesar Milan.

Looking for a way to save space in my feed room these seemed like the perfect solution. I had some reservations but after reading other reviews I purchased two storage units. I use them for 50 pound bags of horse feed and I defy someone to get 100 pounds in one. It is difficult to empty the feed bag into the front of the storage unit as you have to keep pushing the feed toward the back to make room for the rest of the bag. I don't find them particularly rugged either as the bottom one has collapsed a little on one corner after only a couple of months use. I appreciate their space saving feature but probably would not purchase another.

Bought this to use for dog food. It is big enough to hold the big bags of dog food from costco. Has a big opening so filling it with food is quick and easy. Also, it is well built and easy to open and close the lid. My four year old love to help feed the dogs because she can open and close it all by herself.

Normally I would consider salmon snacks to be for cats, but my dog loved these little treats! These are actual dried scraps of salmon, not processed treats of crushed salmon by-product. The only reason I give this product four stars rather than five is that they smell kind of, well, fishy.

It's a kennel. Four chain-link walls and a little door. Certainly strong enough to contain my dachshund - at least as long as we keep it on concrete; if we put it on anything unpaved he'd have himself dug out by lunchtime.The Good Stuff: The instructions depict the door on one of the short sides of the structure. It was surprisingly easy to move it to one of the long sides. Assembly is reasonably uncomplicated, but it helps if you've had some chain-link experience prior to attempting it.The Bad Stuff: REALLY cheap chain link - as I said before, strong enough for a mini dachshund, but I'd be concerned if I had a real manly-man type of dog. The corners of the door are rounded off, which leaves *just* a big enough gap that a small dog like ours could squeeze out if he tried hard enough, so we have to put concrete blocks in front of each of the two lower corners of the door. Also, you'll need at least two people, preferably three, to put it up. Trust me on this.The best thing of all about this kennel was that it cost virtually nothing to ship. I was originally planning to buy it from Home Depot, which sells the same product ten dollars cheaper - but they wanted $180 to ship it. Yes, that's right - one hundred eighty dollars, more than two thirds the cost of the kennel itself. I paid about ten dollars more for the kennel here on Amazon, and they shipped it to me for something like $4.99. Such a deal.
I was confused by the wording of the advertisement. Be aware that size 1/4 indicates the number of the comb. It really trims the hair to 11/16".

I was very happy to find this item at Amazon. The pet shops around here (north of Boston) don't seemto be able get them lately. This is my dog's favorite chew treat. The flossies I received were on thethin side. The ones at the pet shop from the same company were more substantial. I hope in the futurethey are more substantial.

I found this machine to be ineffective. It both gave my cat more food than I had scheduled for and allowed for her to "steal" much more. My 8 pound cat weighed in at 12 pounds after 6 months on this feeder. I am dispensing her food now and she has lost most of the weight. Good product idea, bad execution.
Broke within 10 minutes of use. Very expensive and doesn't work. My cats are not hard players, yet our blind cat broke it immediately

Just did a review for the woven mat because I make sure I have them both at all times. This gives our rabbit hours of fun while the kids are at school. I asked our local pet store to have them in their store but at the price they're selling them here at Amazon and the free shipping, she said I'm really better off ordering them at this website.
Be warned: We just opened a box of six doses and all were empty or near empty. Lot No. F41751. Will never order this item online again.

I bought it as a "filler" for a pet order and wasn't disappointed when it picked up very little fur. The Furminator works much better (and costs 20x as much). My beagle seems to like the glove, but I think he's just in it for the tickles as no hair is released.

This was a very good purchase. It shipped quickly, was a snap to assemble and is definitely of adequate quality - particularly when compared to all of the other fancy or expensive options out there. We started out with a smaller crate made of PVC parts, nylon fabric and black mesh. However, two weeks after he was with us, we ordered this crate and our new 4 month-old Boston Terrier puppy loves it!! We put a very plush fuzzy cushion in it and his big blanket. The price is definitely a plus since we will only use it his first year or so until he is fully trained. He seemed to immediately enjoy the visibility of it and the kids can still pet him when he is in it. Definitely worthwhile.

I purchased due to all the hype. However, compared to a similar styled brush (less than half the price) purchased at a local pet store, there was absolutely no difference in performance. So... I am going to chalk this one up to plain hype. It works - and it works well, but it gets 3/5 stars due to obscene price without any improvement. Buy it if the price won't hurt your pocketbook, but if it will, look for a brush with closely spaced, short metal bristles, and you will be fine.
My cat loves the Kitty Mat and it is made well and is nice looking.Great service and delivery!

I use it on my 80 lb doberman and it works great. It's long enough to let him run while I catch up to him and sturdy enough for me to hold him steady. Had one previously and he bit it for a few months before it fully broke. Trying to keep him from doing the same to this one.

Product was completely ineffective. Dogs were intrigued by the sound. Seemed to consider the sofa I put it on a "giant squeak toy". If you're trying to train your dogs to remain interested in getting on your sofas, this is the product for you.The extremely limited return policy included with the product (that's not described prior to purchase) suggests the manufacturer knows that this thing is largely useless. Essentially, if you've opened the box, installed the battery, and listened to the weak alarm sound once it's not returnable.

If you have to use pain to get your dog to do what you want him/her to do, that's not training. Stop being so lazy and learn how to properly train your dog(s). Take a proper training class with your dog. My pup will do anything I ask, no collar, no pain.

My dog loved the original Purina One Adult Chicken with Rice Dog Food. However, since Purina developed the smart-blend, she won't eat it unless I add some turkey. The tan color pieces are awful - kind of rubbery. I went back to buying the regular Purina Chicken and Rice Mix where all the morsels are pretty much the same in size and color. My dog really likes the older version much better. I won't be buying the blend mixture again. Sometimes, change isn't better.
Great item for heating a crate but beware my little 7 pound dog has chewed threw the cord were the pad and cord meet and has also chewed the corners of the pad which can become a fire hazard.

did I like it, no , not for the cost, they just ignored it, and the little ones just drug it around they won't sleep with it... they perfered a warm just out of the dryer soft blanket, would I buy again NO, would I recommend.... No not for the price...1.99 maybe.

We bought 2 of these 6 years ago mainly for camping. They have held up wonderfully, wash well. We just got another dog and I was so happy to find these were still available. The materials don't seem as sturdy but time will tell. Love them!

Worked like a charm. My dog is very small - 13 lbs - so the collar is a bit big but can be adjusted to fit him. Best of all, it worked. I am sold on this purchase. Now all I have to do is put the collar on him and he quiets down.

My border collie mix has torn apart every toy I've bought except for this Kong. We are on month 4 and there is no major damage :-). The best part is that it keeps her busy and entertained. Instead of peanut butter or the expensive "stuff" you can put inside, I use Nilla Wafers! She loves them and when I break them in half they fit perfectly inside. Just the right size so she can get them out with a little work and there is no mess!

Nice looking little pen for a young puppies. However, the horizontal bars & vertical bar spacing, provide an excellent "ladder" for any climber to easily get out of. My 10 week old yorkie figured out how to scale the wall in less than a minute. I'm not sure the hexagon model with higher walls would be any better due to same design. I have used a superyard XT at friends house & my puppy isn't able to scale that due to tiny holes her paws won't easily fit in, so I'd recommend that instead, but it doesn't have a door, which is why I ordered this one. I'm gonna try to make a cover for it out of mesh material & tie it to the top. Wish me luck :)

One of our dogs is addicted to this ball. She will not let the other dogs near it, but we keep it up when there are other dogs around just to make sure it is not destroyed. Most of our other dogs are either indifferent to it, or will destroy it in a matter of minutes. But Jesse will carry this around all day and beg us to throw it for her. It really depends on the dog as to how long this ball will last. It is soft rubber, so it does not take much for one of the links to be chewed through. Once one link is gone, the rest will fall apart.

I was excited to get this product and give my fish a nice place to rest. However, within days the stems are coming out of the base and the leaves are sliding all along the stems. I've purchased some aquarium silicone to fix the problem but for the price, I expected MUCH better quality.

The toy is a great concept. My dog loved to roll it around and knaw on it. Totally kept him occupied. The unfortnate thing is this "everlasting" treat ball is far from everlasting. My dog had both sides chewed down within one day. After it was chewed down flat he wanted to have nothing to do with it. The ball it's self is around 17 dollars and only came with one treat. The ball fits 2 treats so you instantly have to buy the refill pack which costs about 8 dollars. Cant afford 8 dollars a day in treats.

I have a 30lb dog who is a year old. She is what is known as an"avid" chewer. I thought this would be strong enough for her - it's not. She LOVED it, though. I think all dogs are smart in their own way so what I'm about to say, I don't think is just "her", but she figured out the concept in about 2 min. Meaning, she figured out how to flip it exactly to get all the treats pouring out and this is on the hard level. I wish it were stronger and had been harder for her. It lasted a week in our house and then she chewed up so much of it, I had to throw it away. Even after she got all the treats out, she still enjoyed it. I think she liked the shape.
The product never arrived. I am wondering if I will ever get a refund or the shipped will contact me to reship to the correct address.

My crabitat is decorated to look like a beach resort, so this item looks amazing in it. It is well made, good quality, worth the price. I love the netting material for the hammock; makes it look more realistic. The base is large and substantial, so my 3 medium - large hermies don't tip it over when they climb on it.

I have owned this fountain for a while now. First of all, my cats love drinking from this fountain. They like the sound of the splashing water and that it is constantly filtered (no food bits in the water they are actually drinking).My biggest issue is that I cannot clean it completely. I do not know why they designed it with so many sharp points (they hurt!) and corners (cannot clean all the growths that form over time). I suppose if you were to clean it every other day or so, those growths would not form, but that is unreasonable (it takes a good 15 minutes to clean thoroughly).I will definitely keep on using a fountain, just not this one. I noticed in the store that one called "CatIt" seemed to have a more simple design (easier to clean), though I will check the reviews first!
We've used this for years. Great for pet messes, but cleans and de-smells anything.

I have a miniature poodle. NOT a big dog, right? I have the large Power Walker, figured it'd hold up longer than the cheapo brand retractable leash we were finally retiring after about 7 years. Nope. This thing lasted about 6 months, and now won't retract. I tried to take it apart to fix it, but even that isn't cooperating with me. For the money these things cost, you'd expect it to last a bit longer. Do yourself a favor and get the store brand--that way, if it only lasts a few months (which it probably won't--it'll probably last years) you won't have lost buckets of cash on it.

This is a great product. However, when we received the container, the plastice safety seal over the food was half off. We decided to keep the food anyway but might concider going back to a pet store to buy this food so it can be inspected before puchase.

If you are reading this I am sure you love your dog(s) as much as we love ours. We have a place in the country and the pups pick up a lot of ticks. This tool does an amazing job of removal and holding the offending wretched little tick in place until you can dispose of it rightly. I have pulled upwards of 20 ticks with this tool and am really grateful I have it every time I use it. Definitely recommend it!

I recently bought this carrier because I will be traveling on a plane with my 8 month old kitten. She's a big kitten and she fits comfortably in the carrier. I'm very glad I decided to get the Medium size. The small would have been too small for her.The bag seems very well made. She loves the faux lambskin liner. She keeps kneading at it.Right now, I have the carrier open on the floor and she's taking her toys in it to play.I've included a picture of her in the carrier.

the set is beautiful and does make my dog happier to be in her kennel - when she gets tired at night, she goes in all by herself! Less or no barking at night at bedtime for the family and no doing her business in her kennel any more. Suggestions: the velcro should be replaced with something that a smart dog can't figure out how to undo and chew off of the bumpers. Also, an elastic band across the bottom of the cover, to go underneath the kennel would keep my dog from removing the cover when she is not in the kennel. All in all, a good product, just needs a couple of small tweaks to be perfect!

We've been very happy with the dog tie out, and have used it on a 100' line that reaches between two trees. A hint though............buy turn-buckles so that your dog can't get all the way to the trees and can't get wrapped around the tree. Also, our dog tried (and was successful) in pulling out of his collar, and off the line, so we bought a separate collar and keep it attached to the tie out, so that the collar for the tie out is always put further down his neck than his standard collar--it keeps him from pulling loose!
It Work OK Inside a Barn That Only Get Down To 32 Degrees For Dog's To Tall For Cat's It's To Small For Minnesota Winter's

While I don't mind Carefresh for my rats, I will say that I don't prefer it. MY biggest gripe about it, is that it consistently has a strange odor. Its not necessarily bad, just weird. It does absorb rather well, and the regular gray color hides 'droppings'. If you can get passed the odd smell of the bedding then you may like it more, but I had to switch to a combo of soft-sorbent mint and fresh world bedding. It is my favorite thus far.

Threaded parts of tubing were rusty. When assembled you can see that the two mast sections are not aligned perfectly. It does hold our bird cage alright so I won't bother returning it.This item was purchased from Amazon.com.

Since I have two kitties, I was in dire search of a new method of keeping the kitty litter clean. I always maintained two kitty boxes, one for each but it was such a pain to keep both clean. I researched some of the newer automated litter boxes and found that they were either way too expensive or were not effective at all. Then I came across all of the reviews on the Omega PAW RA20 Self Cleaning litter box. I was amazed at all of the wonderful reviews it received. And since the price was so affordable I decided to give it a shot. I'm sorry I did. Here are some of the issues I had with the litter box:1> Very large, if you are thinking of putting this in a medium sized bathroom as I thought, think again. It is way too large to neatly fit into an average size space. I guess if you plan on putting this in a large basement, you should be safe.2> Due to the size, this brings me to the next issue - how the unit works - you must tilt the box one way and over and then back again. The concept is great but if you are in a cramped space, forget it. It was hit or miss for me, sometimes it collected the do do and sometimes not. Being so large, it requires a great amount of kitty litter. Try tilting 10 lbs of kitty litter and you'll know what I am talking about.3> How it's constructed - for $40 bucks what would you expect but it is made of cheap plastic. The fasteners were also very cheaply made too. I would not expect it to last that long.4> If you are like me, and if your cats are like mine, they want a nicely cleaned litter box at least weekly or at most bi-weekly. Cleaning this LARGE unit was a chore all in itself. I was also nervous about those cheaply made fasteners... when they go, the unit is gone. In order to clean the unit, those fasteners need to slide off. Getting them back on was another issue. Since I clean the box every week, i don't use liners... not too sure if you can find liners to fit this monstrosity.Take my review for what it is worth. It is obvious that others found this unit to be great. I for one cannot understand what all the hoopla is all about.My Omega Paw RA20 litter box is now occupying a space in the garage awaiting its final destination in the trash can. I am now back to the old traditional method of a litter box with the scooper. My cats and I are very happy with that.

I bought this at the pet store. Our rabbit wouldn't use it for a while, but once she got use to it it was just OK. I think that she eats less hay when we use this compared to if we just gave it to her in a pile. It works great in theory, depending on your rabbit's personality.Cons:You have to keep it stuffed to the fullest with hay, or else once it gets down to about half full the hay sort of hovers out of reach in the center and your rabbit won't be able to get at it.Takes up a lot of cage space, even mounted on the wall. I guess it needs extra room for the spinning...The spinning concept doesn't work so well in practice. When mounted on the stand it comes with, it will spin but will immediately spin back into the original position because of the weight of the hay. Our rabbit likes to pick and choose, so sometimes if she doesn't like any of the pieces sticking out of the side facing her she won't eat the hay at all. She eats the most when we just leave it on the floor with one plastic side taken off so it's like a bowl, but then that defeats the purpose.The little swing-open door is pretty much useless. I usually just pop one side of the plastic off to fill it.Pros:Keeps the hay clean, fresh and off the floor.Pretty well made.. Sturdy plastic that didn't get any looser after snapping it on and off to fill the thing.Prevents the rabbit from throwing the hay all over the place (which our buns will do).Entertains the rabbit a bit. When we first gave this to her she would throw it all over the place instead of eating the hay, so we finally mounted it to the cage.
Sweepa Deluxe Rubber BroomGreat for getting pet hair off hard floors, doormats and dog beds.

I was so excited to receive this treat for my dogs....guess I was more excited than they were. They will eat it, but don't go crazy for it like they do other Salmon Treats. Not sure if I will purchase again.

I had to improvise a little. The replacement would not slide into place but needed the existing screws which worked but I had to trim off the upper edge. Then it was just a little too wide so that required about 1/4 inch of trimming as well. However, the door is now working fine.
nothing to add to the negative commentary... just felt it necessary to add a negative affirmation

My groomer recommended giving my dog a supplement for his dry skin, so I invested in this product. He has soft fur as is and I'm not really sure the oil makes much of a difference. I'm also not sure that the small amount that I put in this food really flavors it or if its undetectable. I will continue to use this product bec it doesn't seem to hurt, but I can't say for certain that its really the product that makes a difference.

This comb works all right. I like the spacing of the tines, and the handle is comfortable. As to its anti-static properties, I can't say I was impressed. We were having a very cold snap, so we were running the heat a lot and the whole house was filled with static. We were getting shocked whenever we touched each other or anything for that matter, and our hair was standing out when we would comb it, etc. I was hoping this would help when combing my long haired Persian, so his coat would lay flat but it didn't make any difference. I even used it with an anti-static spray-on coat conditioner, but no change. Still, all in all, a decent pet comb with a good handle.
The water bottle is too flimsy for the price, although there are not good alternatives. Once the bottle breaks, we just replaced it with a regular water cooler bottle.

I know that a lot of people like this, but I sent it back because even the small size is just way too big. I felt claustrophobic in my car with that seat next to me! It is big & tall all the way to the outside edges of the car seat. I purchased the Kurgo Pet Booster seat instead and this was much better choice for me because my dog can still see out the window, I can still use the seat below, and my claustrophobia doesn't start creeping in on me!**Other Useful Comments --The color is definitely khaki. To me it looks gold in the photos on Amazon. It is not gold. Also - love that little drawer ... if you buy one of these ... definitely get the one with the drawer for pet supplies. It is just dead space anyway and even the small drawer is really good sized.

Tried for quite a while, my dog seemed to get worse, more stiff and less playful + he would spit them out, had a hard time getting him to eat them. Went back to cod liver oil / salmon oil & baby aspirin, he is much happier.
My two gerbils chewed and got tangled in this mess. It lasted two days. I do NOT recommend this at all.
I gave these egg sticks to my cockatiel and canary, and neither liked them, particularly. I wouldn't order these again.

I have a German Shepherd and a Black Lab. Not only does the furminator remove more hair than any other tool I have used but they both love being combed! I would reccomend the furminator to anyone with a dog.
If you want a hot PURPLE moon from an alien planet for your captive then this is the product for you, otherwise, save your money.

This bed was perfect for our purpose. We needed something this exact size where both of our large dogs could sleep. However, I wash it once a week and it has already started to show wear. Also, there are little fuzzies everywhere! It's perfect for now but I would not buy it again.

I groom my dog with an Oster clipper and it gets really hot after awhile. I use this and it does cool the blades down some and doesn't get on the dog's fur. But it's no miracle worker for cooling off hot clippers.

This is the best product we have found that helps our dog stay healthy, feeling good and keep a shiny, healthy coat. We mix this in his food once a day. People often comment on how healthy his coat feels and looks. Thank you!

Although the quality of the shak is decent, it does not fit rabbits. I have two rabbits and neither of them could fit inside and both initially refused to touch it. However, after one of them tore apart the roof, making it roomy enough to fit in, the rabbits began to eat it. So buyer beware if you are looking to buy this for your bunnies.

I just got this litter box for our new kitten. He seems to like it just fine and was not at all apprehensive about trying it out. The base is very large- larger than I thought it would be, but this is not a negative. The litter box liners we bought fit this base and I secured them where the top fits down- it has held it fine.We live in a small house and really did not have room for a litter box in the bathroom. We have this litter box in our office and it looks fine.The plant does need some help, but with a little time spent on it it looks OK.For what this product is I think it is a little expensive. But Im not the crafty type nor do I have the time to make my own, so this works great for me. I could however see that a similar product to this could be made by someone with the time, patience to do it. This was the best price on a hidden litter box that I could find and liked.

I love this collar for my Husky. I had a martingale collar with the nylon loop previously but my puppy was able to get the loop in his mouth and destroy it within a week of purchase. I purchased this type next and it worked for 12 years. I recently bought this for my 5 month old Husky and it works great. Allows for a few inches of "choke" action but does not continue to close once it gets tight. I will always use this collar for both training and walking.
Very cute designs to chose from. not the softest things in the world though.. No complaints but I won't buy again.
My puppy trained in a timely fashion........I think these pads are small so you have to use 2 to cover a space large enough for the puppy to use

My husband has a 55 gallon for mollies and I have a 5 gallon for a Betta. He did not want to use the automatic feeder that I recently purchased and told me to buy the tetra vacation gel for the 55 gallon. I decided to set up the auto feeder for Betta and my husband dropped the Tetra Gel in the Molly tank. We left for 4 days and when we returned the water in the auto feeder was not cloudy, Betta alive and happy while the 55 gallon tank, the water was cloudy, the mollies did not look well and I found alot of the Tetra gel residue. I purchased my feeder else where cheaper, and can say it was worth the purchase. However, there are some cons I would like to point out.Cons:1) Cannot set a designated time;2) Container bit small for supposedly 1 months feeding; guess if you feed once a day it will last a month; and3) No clamp to support to fish tank only a couple of velcro strips
Just wish this came in smaller size as it looked great on my dog, just would not stay on his feet two seconds. Had to return. Fortunately return was very easy and full refund was given.

These collars and choke collars are inappropriate for dog training. In fact, many times dogs will end up head shy and anxious after wearing these. Purchase a Gentle Leader or Snoot Loop and have a veterinarian help you fit it correctly (many people use them improperly). Please don't buy into the dominance ways of Milan and such.

I wasn't sure how many stars to put, because I didn't use the product. When I received it and read through the installation instructions, I realized that we had a problem. It has to be attached directly to the outlet and attached to the transmitter by a short wire. Unfortunately, our transmitter is plugged into an extension cord. There's no outlet near the window in our garage where the perimeter wire originates. So, we couldn't use it. It was my mistake, because I didn't look into the installation process before purchasing.If your transmitter is plugged directly into a wall outlet, it seems (from the other reviews) that it would work very well.I also want to thank Amazon for giving us a refund. When we figured out that we couldn't use it, I stuck the box in a corner and forgot about it. I just returned it - long past the return policy time limit - and got a refund. So, Amazon gets * * * * * five stars!

Looked like these would be great when they first arrived. The pieces are large, and my pup enjoyed chewing away at them. However, my pup has a sensitive stomach and these treats give him loose stools whenever he eats them. I would not recommend for dogs with sensitive stomachs. Stick with flossies.

Be very careful when purchasing this product. I found when I received my order that it was not the Lookout II that I had ordered but the Original Lookout. I notified the seller immediately and they explained that there was an issue with the way it was posted and that it had been fixed. They offered to exchange the products or refund my shipping. I chose the shipping but can't say to date that it has been done. So that is disappointing. As for the product itself I am very please. Ella, my dachshund, seems to enjoy it. She would prefer to be loose, of course, but seems to be able to get comfortable. Personally I feel much better about her being safe after a couple of times when she fell off the seat. So I recommend the product just make sure you are getting exactly what you think you are.

I bought a package of these squeaky balls for my 6 month old puppy because he loves squeaky toys. He took the squeaker out and was chewing it. If I hadn't seen him chewing it, he would have swallowed it. I think they should be taken off the market. They are dangerous.
Our 25 lb cockapoo had this ball in 15 pieces within about ten minutes of receiving the toy. Do not buy this if you have any dog bigger or tougher than a toy poodle.

This product works but beware the finicky cat. I have three cats and only one will let me use this product on her. The other two literally hiss and bite at me when I bring the comb any where near them. I suppose I should have seen this coming because the two that hate the FURminator also hate being brushed by a regular brush.However, if you have a cat that loves to be brushed and sheds a lot, this is a great product. It really does remove bags of fur and she's softer than when I brush her with a regular brush. Her coat looks really healthy as well. Her fur isn't all over the couch anymore.My husband who is allergic to cat hair hasn't noticed a discernible difference in his allergen sensitivity in the two months that I have owned this brush. I brush her at least every other day if not more. Maybe the FURminator would help his allergies if all of my cats were willing to be groomed but since that isn't the case, my husband still sneezes and his nose still runs and he has to take allergy pills everyday.

Before purchasing this K & H Kitty Sill, I read reviews galore about this and many others. In the end, I had to screw this seat to the window sill because the brackets wouldn't stay in the slots (and still fell off even after using the screws). The cats use it, but I have not seen them lying on it like in the picture.

I bought the 48 X 20 mat and the extension pad to cover a large entranceway in my home.Positives:1. The dogs only needed to try it once or twice to be aware of what it does.2. It does generally keep them out of the room.3. A humane punitive corrector.Negatives:1. It fires CONSTANTLY for no reason and I can not find out why or how to stop it.2. Must buy ac adapter since the battery will die in a day or two because of item # 13. While it fires constantly when no one is on it, it doesn't always go off when the dogs are on it.4. Sometimes they will take "the hit" to get across but not to leave the room.*Point to keep in mind, a coated dog or cat that has hair between its pads is not going to get as strong of a correction if any. Kind of what you would feel on it if you were wearing socks.All in all its good for a couch or an area of the home you dont want animals in, but you will need two times more mat than you think so that the animals cant get around it.
Nice, heavy gauge wire...quality construction. Works well at giving our 10 lb dog a safe place to run. I bought 2 of them and connected them to give the dog a larger area to play.

The large bottle is a good price for a large number of tablets which is useful when giving to seven dogs with health issues, which is the only reason I add multi-vitamins (vet suggested) for them. If you must give a multivitamin this this is a good brand and good price.

Orbee has the best and toughest toys for the strongest chewers! This ball withstands our German Shepherd Dogs chewing and chewing and chewing! They love the texture of the ball and the sound it makes when they chew it. This ball is by far the best we've ever bought.EDIT: This ball was good for a while, but after a few months of constant GSD jaws, it came apart at the "seams."

My Burmese rag doll cat did not like this at all. So buy this if you want to roll the dice. Every cat has his/her own finicky likes/dislikes. The odor can be a bit off-putting for more sensitive breeds.

I bought the original Drinkwell and can't stand it because it is extremely hard to clean when there isn't a dishwasher available. I bought the cleaning tools recommended for it but, without a dishwasher to put the parts in, its just a big pain in the @** to clean. My cats love the running water though so I knew I had to get a fountain of some sort. My sist has the Platinum one and she showed me how easy it was to clean! I bought it, my cats LOOOOVE it, and I'm very happy I bought it.There is a review on here by someone of the different types of drink fountains and that review also really helped me to pick the Platinum fountain. I was also looking at the 360 one, but after reading that review, I realized that the Platinum one would probably better suit both the needs of my kitties and myself.

Within a few hours of treatment, I could see the fleas drop off my kitten either dead or dying. I've heard this has been a BAD flea season here in Downeast Maine, so I've had to use all three doses. It's the best medication I have used so far!

I bought this thinking it would be a great starter kit to go along with an impulse buy of a beta fish. The pictures on the box look nothing like the actual product. It is very cheap plastic and I suspect they are prone to leaking like I have read, although to be fair, mine does not leak. It does have the requisite items to get you started but none of the materials are exceptional. The clear plastic used instead of glass is warped EVER....EVER so slightly and this causes major distortion. It lasted about a week before I felt guilty for keeping a live animal is that thing and have replaced with it with a proper glass bowl, gravel, and live plants...all of which look better and didn't cost but a few dollars more.Also the "instructions" for care of the beta fish itself contradict a few other books that I have thumbed through (and am following with success).Buy at your own risk. Again, I replaced mine (which was still in working order) for a REAL set up after only a week, for only a few dollars more.I still have the fish and am loving the look of it in my home and the experience of caring for it.

This product looks pretty good. Was not that hard to put together. The hole in the door is cut too low. You have to have an extremely shallow kitty litter box so it doesn't show. I have to medium to large size cats and they fit in it just fine.

Well i bought this product for my dungarian hamster, she isnt a draft for isnt full size, which is a good thing because this is tiny she fits in it perfectly. it has cute colors but the little lader that came with it doesnt stay on and it was terrible to put together it took me an hour to fit the peices, on top of that its impossible to clean the bottom part because you cant take it apart. but my little hamster loves it and tho the plastic is cheap it has yea to be broken but it helps that she isnt a chewer.

My dog got an abrasion on the top of her head, which is notoriously hard to stop from bleeding due to the excess of nerves and veins. We tried flour, liquid bandage, and even actually bandaging her head (not recommended, as I later found out, since dogs will invariably do all they can to remove the bandaging and will likely disturb the wound in the process). Eventually I bought this because it's the one thing I haven't tried. Turns out it's about as effective as flour, meaning, it's effective when it is reapplied with vigilance and if your dog stays mostly inactive/unexcited. It's just thousands of times more expensive than flour ($6.66 for .5oz versus $2.99 for 5lbs, you do the math). I think this is meant for when a dog endures scratches or if you accidentally cut the bulb during nail cutting. That or if you dog is very calm.

I was hoping this pad was leak proof but it's not. At least not for my old diabetic pug who has a bladder as big as a lab! Maybe good for puppies who have little piddles but I can't comfirm that. Why can't they make a pad with the same backing as baby diapers? This one just didn't work for me any better than newspapers.

My 4 year old cat does not chew these toys, she bats them around frantically and shoots them straight under the nearest appliance or rug.I wish she would just chew them, so that I could stop digging around under the stove and the fridge. She really does love them, just not for what they're marketed as.I wish that my 1.5 year old cat would chew these instead of everything else in the house, but she is not interested in them -- she doesn't really stand a chance, though, as they're not out for long before they get hidden.

I purchased this crate to that I could take my new Cocker Spaniel camping, and it ended up not being used for that purpose. However, I used it when I was moving and it was perfect! It was easy to setup and eventhough she is quite the little chewer, she never chewed through it. It was easy to fold back up (once I realized how), and stores great! I would recommend this for anyone who needs a quick and convenient alternative to large metal crates.

I bought this for my lab mix puppy. She has short fur, but is prone to shedding. She was a little hesitant at first, but I think she would have been that way with any brush. I used it for only a couple of minutes at first, and worked up each time. Now she really enjoys getting brushed. I think it feels like she's getting a little scratch! This really does take care of a lot of the excess fur and shedding, and is very gentle. I like how most of the hair that is pulled out stays in the teeth. This keeps the mess-factor to a minumum. I highly recommend this product, especially at the low price at which Amazon is selling it.

This is not a maintenance free system as advertised. We bought a litter genie and have to scoop the capture tray once a day. There is also a fine white dust from the crystals that gets on anything nearby. We end up replacing the trays every three weeks. On the plus side, the crystals do a good job drying out the poop and keeping odor in check.

hi I have a community with a variety of fish, top, middle & bottom feeders. None of the fish prefer this brine shrimp, it actually clouds my tank. All the fish actually love the krill. If anybody wants to try any type of fish food, I would suggest them to get a sample from the LFS or from their friends, feed it to the fish, if they eat it then its worth to buy otherwise its a waste of money.

Ive read the reviews on this product and it seemed kinda split in customer reviews so I decided to give it a shot. Im glad I brought it. Its a cheap price and the dogs react well towards it. My family has an annoying dog where it barks at everything for no reason. Finally I got fed up with the barking. This product is worth the money and the chance to try it. Now theres less barking and Im less annoyed with the dog haha.

I bought this for a humid cage 75% to 90% humidity. It worked great for about a month or so. My plants grew great in it. Had a four layer system and would mist daily. It started molding. Had to completely re-do my cage. Good bedding, just not for what I needed.

My comb had one tooth that had not had the tip rounded. The end of the one tooth in the middle of the comb has a sharper, more square edge than all the other teeth that had rounded tips. I returned it and purchased a real Greyhound comb from Belgium. It's more expensive but I doubt it will be flawed. The Oster comb is a good product if the particular one considered is not defective -- it's a copy of a good Greyhound comb.

As everyone says, this is a quiet filter with a strong flow. Well made but has a couple of "issues". The most annoying is there's no molded plastic piece that goes over the edge of the tank on the return hose. You have to essentially make one out of the provided tubing. Of course, any tubing you flex like that wants to kink to some degree, and I suspect my return flow may be slightly compromised. This could easily be fixed by including an inexpensive molded piece (like the intake has) for the over-the-edge-and-right-turn angle, or heck, just mold it on to the return spray bar. Secondly, I was disappointed the unit didn't have separate media baskets like the Rena series. This one will be slightly more of a hassle to clean, and I do like the segmented basket approach over this "dump it all in a can" design. Finally, the instructions are ridiculous. Incomplete and incomprehensible. They should be ashamed to ship that mess. If you find this filter at an appreciably better price than it's competitors, I think it will do an acceptable job but I wouldn't buy it again. I hate putting up with annoyances on hobby products that cost this much.

I have a Maine Coon cat that is long haired. And although he doesn't shed all that much on a day-to-day basis, he did have a period of time when it was much worse (one of his bi-annual times for "molting".) And I received the FURMinator just in time. It worked great in removing a lot of excess undercoat when used the first couple of times. Now that the heavy shedding time seems to be past it still gets out the extra hair he'd likely shed & he looks beautiful & feels like silk. I highly recommend this product for all cat owners.

I bought this toy for my puppy. He is a strong and aggressive chewer. He had this for less than 5 minutes and had already destroyed it. It seems very durable for an average chewer, but do not buy if you need the most resilient toys. The felt is easily torn off, and the rubber underneath does not stand up to any chewing.

I have not used this one yet since it is brand new and I purchased it as a back up. I do have another one just like it and have had it for several years and it performs just perfect as a dog and or wife leash. Neither the dog nor my ex-wife can run the streets without me keeping them in tow at a distance that is safe for all involved. I highly recommend this product for wayward, dogs, wives, ex-wives, girlfriends, naughty children, and or any other animals and or humans that need be restrained by leash within the reasonable length of say 16' plus or minus depending on how severe the traffic might be in that instant case!!!!!! Go for it, you will not regret having this item in your inventory of restraints or leashes. So Say I, Judge Chops.

I buy these but extend the use by taking those plastic shopping bags to line them. When I empty it, I take the bag out and tie it up, throw it out! I can use one of these for about 4 or 5 changes before I need a new one. You would think Littermaid would design a sturdy one, sell the bags, and make some money on that!

I have purchased previous PetSafe products in the past that used over the counter batteries. My most recent collar purchase uses a 'custom' module for the battery which is significantly more expensive than over the counter batteries.... What's the deal PetSafe? I guess it ensures we will be buying only PetSafe batteries for the collars......

I am sitting here watching my dog completely sound asleep after a $600 emergency vet visit. We did as instructed with this toy last night and sat with our Pit/Mastif 17month old puppy named Daisy. She loved it and today we went out for two hours to look at homes to buy. When we returned she did her usual running around and greeting us with her new toy in her mouth. Several minutes later she was laying at our feet with her toy still there. While reaching out to grab the toy and play with her it was stuck. I mean stuck. She had literally gotten her entire lower jaw stuck in the hole that you take in and out to place the food into. Not a tooth not a hair, her entire jaw. I cannot believe that this is the first occurance for this toy. It definately needs some redesign or removal from market. This toy has cut a ring around her jaw to the point of bleeding and massive swelling because of how it was lodged. We bought the large version as HELLO we have a large dog. If you really care for your pet, look elsewhere for a toy that does keep them entertained when you are not around. It kept our baby entertained alright. But she couldn't eat or drink as she walked around with a 6 inch cube stuck to the front of her face. We feel pathetic that we did this to her.

I had two cats that were constantly at each other. Jasmine pretty much laid around on a big pillow all day. Mogie would stalk her, run up and swat her, etc. all day long. I gave this product a try, in hopes that he would calm down and quit harassing Jasmine. I plugged it in right by her pillow. I didn't notice any changes in either of them. Mogie still bullied, and Jasmine still hissed, screamed, and occasionally charged Moglie. Jasmine remained totally stressed out, independent of the pheromone, so she has gone to another home. :-( (Mogie is a BAD cat, but a great companion for me. Couldn't send my soulmate away!) I still have another cat, so I'm going to try drugs next on Mogie. (A mild antidepressant that is known to reduce aggression in cats) In any case, this product might work for minor problems or as "aromatherapy", but it didn't work for us.
this is a great idea...if you don't have a dog. my dog take it out and drags the grass and water through the house. it is greast for cats.

I have a Barky Beagle Buster that loves to Howl at everyone and everything. He is a nuissance barker when outside and I wanted to control the barking in softest way. Unfortuneatly a spray in the face was not going to stop him! The product was fine, it was the dog that was the issue, he grew to like it! I recently purchased the PetSafe electronic bark shock collar which works awsome on him!!

Since this gate has been reviewed many times, I will simply add my experience as concisely as possible in terms of using this as a baby gate.Pro:1. Sturdy metal structure2. No foothold for small children to climb up on the gate3. If not latch is not locked down, you can open the gate with one hand. However, my 9 month old daughter is on the verge of figuring out how to open it when unlocked, so that is a consideration.4. Easy install, though instructions could use some clarity. I did not install any extensions, however, so YMMV.5. No problems navigating the gate for my cats.Cons:1. The main gate opens in only one direction. When I set it up with the gate latch on the right (i.e. the gate opens toward you), I discovered that the pet door will swing into your walking path if not open. Since we have three cats, it is open all the time, thus the problem. I re-installed it with the latch on the left (i.e. the gate opens away from you) and that worked better, though the pet door is frequently flapping around unhappily.2. The pet gate is not removable. This is a problem if you use this as a baby gate, since small children can swing the open pet gate toward them and catch their fingers. I had to tape it in the wide open position to avoid this. Would have been easy to make the pet gate removable or place the pet gate in a section that was not part of the main gate, both of which would have made this more functional as a baby gate. I get the feeling that the designers of this gate never field tested it for this purpose.3. The pet gate is too wide. My 9 month old daughter was able to crawl through it, obviously defeating the purpose of having a gate in the first place.4. If the gate is locked down, it takes two hands to unlock it. That is problematic in many different scenarios. For example, the gate is set to keep the baby out of the laundry room and the laundry room is the entryway from the garage, through which we carry all the groceries.5. The gate has about an 1" high threshold. In addition to tripping over it more times than I would like, forget about dragging a vacuum cleaner, bucket, baby wagon, etc. into the room behind you - you will need to lift it over the threshold.6. While the gate seems sturdy, the plastic lock mechanism feels cheap.

This toy is great for keeping a dog entertained, but not very sturdy. Granted I have 2 huskies who can destroy anything anyways, but...I have tried the KONG brand and never had a problem. Other toys as well. This one didn't last 30 minutes in their presence though.It is a good idea for smaller dogs.

I have had four of these litter boxes, many of them lasting a good deal of time. The one I received IS NOT a Booda Dome. It looks like one but is actually a knockoff with a Booda Dome filter taped inside. While assembling the product three pieces fell off. It is flimsy to say the lease. This is not going to last three weeks. The actual Booda Dome is constructed to take a beating. I am so disappointed. What happened Amazon!? Not worth $5 more less the price I paid.
This item works well for taller dogs but for short dogs it doesn't fit well. The sleeves get caught on the legs and tangle the short dogs up.

Our cats are generally very well behaved but since we got a second cat, the two play so rigorously that sometimes they damage the surrounding furniture. We were concerned about our leather couches, otherwise, everything else was fine. The covers themselves do a perfect job of really blunting the nails, they try to scratch but not even the slightest nick shows!Application was a tricky part. The front paws are easy since you can nestle the cat between your legs as you kneel down and make a V shape out of them. The hind legs are harder and is a two person job because our cats do resist. You may have to make do with a few hind nails at a time. I tried doing them all at once and Snowy got so emotionally upset about it, so I gave him a generous treat that day.They also fell off more quickly that I expected. Within a few days, half of them fell off, but maybe next time I'll try to trim their nails shorter so the cap fits on more snugly, there were a few nails that were still on the longer end.And the third issue is what has been the biggest concern that some already mentioned. Maybe I did not apply the caps well enough, but one day, Snowy got his nail caught in a loop of carpet. He was so distressed and screaming his little head off. He kept yanking to get his paw away but I got it out of the carpet for him by pulling forward then back because of how the nails curve.I am debating just getting slip covers for the couches and resuming to regular nail trimming since that is the only problem. They miss scratching their scratching posts (it is a source of leisure and exercise for them too), dislike having these put on especially if these fall off so fast anyways, and the event with getting stuck at the carpet was very scary. Oh yes, the price I find to be high. $20 for 40 and having to continuously replace those can get costly. Or, if I do try it again, I would be sure to cut their nails shorter for a more snug fit, maybe they will stay on longer then.

I use a soft crate to hold my 65lb Lab and my 26lb Blue Heeler at agility trials. This crate replaced a torn BP Backyard Pet crate that I'd used for 5 years and could nolonger find. Having used the Firstrax N2-36 several times now I'm sorry I bought it.
