So now the cover looks terrible, sags on one side, and no longer protects the seat which is the entire purpose. I suppose it works if you want to buy a new one every other month, but then you might as well get a more expensive cover in the first place.2 stars because all this product needs is stronger straps at the top and a more clever seat anchoring system at the bottom. And from what I've read, it used to be that way before this company switched to cheaper components to save money.

Claimed to be a wall/door pet door as it can telescope for thicker walls. It could be a wall pet door if your wall is only 3 inches deep. The inserts that came in the package are supposed to hide the side exposed bare walls inside the pet door. These inserts are useless if your wall is thicker than the inserts. So we are now living with a door that functions, but until we figure out what product to insert on the sides we will have to deal with the unfinished look.I had to take out the magnet because it closed so well and tight my Westie was scared of it and refused to use it. He uses now but it is drafty because it won't seal, but that is our problem because we took out the magnet. Would be good for cold/ windy country because it does have a good seal when the magnet is in place. Your dog just can't be scetchy about the sound or having to push the door open with his head or nose. I am not over thinking the whole project because I didn't spend a lot of money on it.

OK, so the tempermental Cat Genie is a not for everyone. But for the rest of us, it's godsend. What these granules do for me is maintain a very sanitary litter box for a valuable 15 year old service animal on chemotherapy and help his person who has a compromised immune system and can't handle litter at all. I'm so grateful that I no longer have to deal with scooping and bagging and hauling, and fight the endless battle of odor and sanitizing.The granules track as bad as any other litter with the difference being they don't have ANY "dust" at all. You do feel it if you step on the individual granules, but if you put a large litter mat or a big plush rug in front of the litter box, the granules will be caught in them and you can pick up the edges of the rug, shake loose the granules and then dump them back into the box, using the rug to funnel them.There is no solution to cat litter boxes unless you have a full time maid, but this is one option that I think is the best solution for indoor litter boxes for many of us. If you have the need for bacterial reduction and minimizing dust, this is as good as it gets.
perfect, wasn't sure where to buy these replacement parts for my old aquarium hoods, almost tossed the hoods in the garbage... AMAZON.COM saved the day (and the Eclipse Hoods)
I'd say it's okay for a short haired animal but not on a long haired one. When used, my dog did not care for the feeling of it.

If you're wondering whether you should get the Flexi all-belt leash or the corded leash, go for the all-belt! We have a 1 1/2 year old Havanese and I have purchased THREE Flexi corded leashed since we got him as a puppy... each of them only lasted a few months. The all-belt leash that is listed here is AWESOME: sturdy, easy to hold and easy to lock! Our dog is only 13 lbs, but he shoots off like a rocket on walks and this handles him really well. I would absolutely recommend this leash!

This product came very highly recommended and after careful desensitizing we were able to use them on two of our dogs. They walk nicely individually but when together pulling was a problem. It did help lessen the pulling but the number of times this tool was confused with a muzzle just broke our hearts...people saw only the straps, not the friendly well-behaved dog inside it. When you own a breed endlessly maligned in the media and largely misunderstood you find yourself doing everything you can to avoid further mistaken negativity.Instead, we just started back at zero and re-taught proper walking with another dog just as we had when she was by herself.The dog we continued using the headcollar with did fine but not when we tried to transition to a martingale collar when he grew out of the Gentle Leader. Without the Head Collar, all bets were off and he acted as if he didn't know any leash manners at all! So we had to start at the beginning and retrain him to walk correctly with only his collar when with other dogs, too.The Premier Head Collar is a highly effective tool, it just wasn't quite right for our situations. To avoid the same negativity issues with our new youngsters but obtain the same principles of control (turning the dog when it pulls and having excellent control in excitable situations as they learn good leash manners) we used the Premier Easy Walk harness--clipped to their martingale collars for extra safety, since athletic and determined dogs can wriggle out of the harness. They have transitioned from use of the harness to just their collars as they get older with none of the problems we had trying to transition from Head Collar to martingale only. This was probably entirely our fault but others might have had the same issues, too.

Given the winter we've had, batteries don't last long, even with the motion detector function. However, I've noticed less evidence of the six feral cats in our neighborhood since I began using this. It's just difficult to say whether it is this or winter keeping them at bay right now. The true test will be this Spring.

I bought 2 Cat Stops roughly 2 years ago when I saw the reviews on Amazon. I had hoped they would discourage neighbor cats that seemed to find my yard irresistible. To be honest, I didn't think they worked. I'd see cats stroll right in front of one with no apparent reaction. Admittedly I let them run down and didn't do a lot to clean them up or put in fresh batteries. My gardener got them even dirtier and blew off one of the battery covers one time. Contech was gracious enough to replace the cover at no charge since the unit was still under warranty.I got a feral cat coming in my yard roughly 4 months ago. I tried everything. Deterrents found on the web. Red pepper flakes, ground black powder, coyote urine...I could go on. Nothing seemed to faze him. At the time I didn't know he was a feral cat--I thought he was someone's pet cat that was free roaming (a violation of the city ordinance where I live). I contacted the city. They could cite the owner but I had to find out who the owner was. I talked to the neighbors where he exited the yard...neither owned the cat. In desperation I bought a trap, finally trapped him (after trapping 2 other neighbor cats and even more scary a raccoon (who knew raccoons like catnip?)). He had no ID and I found after having a vet scan him, no microchip. I decided to take him to the local shelter (even though I had to pay $10 to do it--not to mention gas and time). That's where I learned he was ear-tipped to indicate he was a released neutered feral cat. I despaired that the owner would locate him, bring him home and release him again (which is exactly what happened). The owners were very nice but couldn't figure out how to keep him home. I offered to trap him for them if he would buy into the trap again but I'd learned he was very smart and would probably never get tricked again. As I suspected, he looked at the trap but wouldn't take the bait. Frustratingly I'd watch him come back to the yard, stalk and kill the birds I encourage to come to the yard.I decided one day after chasing him for the 3rd time that I'd get the Cat Stop devices, clean them up, dry them out and put in fresh batteries. I did that and found on Contech's site that you could test to see if the device is working by laying it on its back and putting a pinch of salt on the speaker and swiping your hand over it to set off the motion detector. I did that. Salt didn't move. I was convinced they were goners but I decided to put them out anyway. I put them out along with fresh bait in the cat trap. Sure enough the sun came out and here came the cat. He walked over to the trap and checked out the new bait but didn't go in. He walked past the trap toward "his spot" and suddenly stopped. He stood for a moment...then turned around and went back across the yard and at some point went over the fence and left. I was shocked. That was the first time I ever saw him deterred from hanging out in his spot (which being a feral cat he thought was his territory and I was the intruder and nuisance). I haven't seen him since. I don't know if feral cats are more sensitive or if the concentration of two units in a small area increased the discomfort or what. I'm just EVER SO grateful that they finally did the trick. Being the cynic that I am, I keep looking out, expecting him to figure out a way to deal with this new addition to the yard...but he hasn't come back.I tell this long story to encourage others with a similar problem to try this product. I really didn't think it was doing much of a job but the Cat Stop unit is the ONLY thing that ever stopped this cat. I know something like a nuisance cat taking up in your yard and killing your birds should not make a person as crazy and stressed as this situation did me but it ate at me like a dripping faucet. Many people encouraged me to do harm to the cat or at least once I trapped him to take him a long way from his neighborhood to a farm or out in the woods and dump him, but I couldn't do that to someone's cat. As much as I grew to hate this cat for making my life miserable, I can't harm a cat--barring him attacking me. This cat wasn't aggressive or destructive--he just felt my yard was his turf and I was an annoying creature who wouldn't quit bothering him. I'm so glad we could both have peace in the end. Thank you, Contech, for bringing peace back to my life and my yard. And my birds thank you too.

The birds went crazy for this stuff. The seeds are held together with some kind of lard, which ends up all over the place. I had mine on a patio and I ended up with a greasy sludge under and around it that doesn't wash away with the rain. It took literally months to go away after I discontinued use.

This product is wonderful! It's a little awkward at first to get used to, but once you get it down it is so worth it. I have a 32lb boston/rat terrier mix and a 47lb lab mix (both wear a size medium) and I am able to walk both at the same time with ease. I highly recommend this product!

I have to admit that I was more than a little nervous about buying this product at first. But I figured that I really had nothing to lose. If it wound up having all the problems that other people pointed out (busted tabs, leaking litter, etc.), then I would just take out the grate and make it a regular kitty litter box. I'm really happy to say that it worked out quite well! I can absolutely see how problems may come in later. The plastic is really cheap and definitely easy to break if you're not careful. The tabs look like they might just break off at any moment. I haven't had any leaking litter yet but I can see how it might happen. It's a large box but 1/3 of it is occupied by the grate, so this is only big enough for one cat to use. All these reasons are why I didn't give it a perfect rating.Despite all the potential problems, I am really really happy with the product! I absolutely hate scooping and this has made the process SO much easier! I used to wear a mask when I scooped because I hated all the small bits of litter that would fly into the air but I don't have to worry about that anymore! My cat has super clean litter because we are always cleaning it out, thanks to the process being so quick and easy! To avoid all the problems that I mentioned above, I placed her litter box over one of those cheap, giant bath mats. That way, if it ever leaks through, it won't get onto my carpet and its easy enough to vacuum or sweep up. This also provides an extra cushion for when I roll it, which I do very very slowly, so that there isn't a lot of wear and tear on the plastic. Because you can only have about 2-3 inches of litter inside the box at a time, on occasion there are clumps that attach to the side of the litter box. I just watch it filter through the grate and take a scoop to the clump if there is one. Since I just brush it off the side and I'm still not scooping through her litter, I don't consider it a big hassle. I really hope you decide to try this out because it has definitely been worth it for me!

I have a 22+ pound miniature schnauzer who was still too small for a Size 1 Halti, and he's big for this type of schnauzer. So be sure to understand the sizing chart before purchasing one of these leads. The breed and size suggestions they give aren't necessarily going to work for your pet. I notice that other purchasers of this collar have had the same criticism, and if I'd taken the manufacturers suggestion, I would have gotten a size 2!Otherwise, the product seems well made. I hope the size 0 will work for him.

I have had and used this "house" to hide the litter box in my small one bedroom apartment for about ten months now and it has hidden the actual litter and kitty waste well from visitors but it is no secret that this is the litter box. I have two cats (one of which is about 18lbs and the other about 10lbs) that have very different bathroom habits that cause problems with this. Since the litter box that fits in (it's pretty small but has a high back) has a low front to allow the cats to walk through the "ddorway" in the front, there are often times where there's urine on the front-inside of the "house", down the door, and on the floor (my little one likes to face the back when she goes). When my big guy goes, half of his body is outside of the "house" causing urine (not often but it does happen) to hit the back of the "house" and travel down the seams onto the floor behind it. To help with this problem, I line the "house" and under the litter mat in the front with puppy pads and change them whenever there's urine to help minimize the smell and the wood from warping (i haven't figured out a way just yet to stop the door from warping, which has caused some problems in shutting the door without slamming it). In summary, this "house" is quite small for big cats and, depending on your cats habits, may not be the best for housing your litter but does hide the litter and it's waste from guests in a tight living space. If this were cheaper and my cats weren't used to using this for a litter box, I would consider buying and putting a pet bed inside for a little hideaway spot for my kitties.

I'm hesitant to criticize this product too much for 2 reasons: #1 We already had a pretty bad flea outbreak at our house when I tried FrontlinePlus on my 7 year old, 20 pound cocker spaniel. My vet said that most flea medicines work much better at maintenance/prevention but to get rid of an outbreak, the environment really needs to be treated with a fog. #2 - my sweet dog has epilepsy so a lot of different flea medicines that work through neuro-transmitters will give her seizures. (She has approx 1 seizure a month without flea med and 3-4 a month with it.) Program is the only one that doesn't give her seizures but it doesn't work for us either...that's what she was on leading up to the outbreak.That said, I still don't think this medicine worked very well. I'm not a fan of topical flea medicines anyway as I'm always concerned it's going to get rubbed on the wall or the couch or that one of us will touch it by mistake. The spot on my dog's back got very hot and stayed hot for many days. I can't imagine it's confortable for her. I didn't notice any decrease in the amount of fleas she had on her or in the amount she was scratching. I don't recommend Frontline.We've since switched to Comfortis, which is much more expensive. It's a pill form and requires a vet Rx. She's had some seizure increase with it, as it's also a neurotransmitter. However, the flea population and scratching are both diminishing. We also had our house treated by a pest company so that might be a factor.

I bought this trainer because of my dogs passion for chasing cars that speed down the dead end dirt road, in front of our house.If one dog was out it worked, but two together ignore whatever signal it sends to make them stop.We asked the neighbors, who have pets and grandchildren of their own, to slow down. Maybe they need the trainer collar.
A RABBIT AND A MONKEY ARE ENOUGH FOR THE TIME BEING. SHE WILL GET THE MOUSE WHEN ONE OF THE OTHER ANIMALS DIES. HOWEVER SHE KNOWS IT IS IN THE CABINET WAITING FOR HER.

We bought this gate so the cats could travel back and forth though the gated area but the dog can not. The small gate is so large that the 45 pound dog fits through without any problems. When the small gate is closed she can easily push it open and exit the gated area.The gate only opens one way, all other gates we have open both ways so very poorly designed.The gate takes two hands to open - one to push the release and keep it open and then one hand to lift the plastic locking mechanism - very poorly designed.The weilding seems are not all covered with the white so they show up as a darker area and look unsightly.I would not recommend this gate to anyone.
It may be made with 8" of rope , but with the knots its more like 4 or 5. I bought a rope toy triple the size for $0.65 more at pet food express

We purchased this for our Cairn Terrier to play with. He played catch for a couple of minutes and then ran under the table to play with it. Next thing I knew he had chewed off all of the legs! He will still play catch with the rest of the body. Had hopes it would have lasted a little longer :-)

Company refers to these as wee,wee puppy pads which makes you think you are getting the original "WeeWee pads"............NOT!!!They are soooo thin, leakage big time. Suitable for a 4 pound dog. Mine weighs 12 pounds and they are not absorbant enough. Cheap is expensive.
I love these fountains, this particular one was small and I returned it and ordered the large.
Bags do as advertised. Fit perfectly into Bags On Board holder. Sturdy. No leaks. Not much else to say. Would purchase again.

Our St. Bernard literally has no hip sockets...resulting in challenging joint problems in her hips. Being a rather large dog, she could easily have other joint problems.Our veterinarian recommended Comfort for the high amount of high quality anti-oxidants, and as an alternative to other, more usual, joint medications.She's now eight years old, longer lived than expected...and still doing very well.She does much better with Comfort than when we run out.Buying through Amazon gives us the best price I've found anywhere, and I've looked a lot.

I have many Kongs as I have my own dog and foster dogs at my house. The Kongs I have had over the years have all held up pretty well and I have been more than pleased with them. Having so many different Kongs, I have not used this one on a regular basis. Over the past year I have noticed occasional black tar like stains on dog beds or blankets. I had thought that the dogs had gotten into something odd in the backyardbut I just saw where the black Kong had stained a cardboard container it had been stored by with black streaks. I put my fingers in the Kong and my fingers were covered with a black tar like substance which was not easy to clean off!? Never seen this but now I realize the source. I have thrown it away and will stick with the other Kongs going forward!

Ordered the chicken flavor and received the fish flavor instead. Cat ate it with the medication the first time. It appeared that it stuck to his mouth and he kept moving his tongue in and out. Maybe it stuck like peanut butter does in our mouths. Anyway, he won't take it again. The other cats like it and will eat it.

The chip is fine. Veterinarian inserted it with no issues. You will have to pay another $16.99 to Home Again to register the chip and enroll in their "premium service" for one year. After registering you can immediately unsubscribe from auto renewal for the premium service, but there appears to be no way around paying for a year of premium to get the chip registered with Home Again. I would say Home Again is deceptive as they really push the yearly enrollment w/o listing the basic option, and would have registered with the AKC service (also about $17, but for life) if I hadn't already had pets enrolled with Home Again and if my pets weren't cats (AKC will register any pet but it just seemed odd).

I bought this a couple years back but never got to reviewing it. But anyways when I first got the product it worked great and everything operated properly. After about a couple of weeks I noticed that the water wasn't cascading across the whole surface and it was only dribbling out on a couple sides. I was able to fix it temporarily but the problem kept coming back. The temporary solution is to rub your finger all along the surface so the water coats it eventually it will start cascading across the entire thing instead of dribbling down. I got sick of doing this after while, who has the time to sit there and baby sit a water fountain? Sporadically my unit would suck in air instead of water, I checked the water levels, cleaned the filters and the pump, everything seemed to be in order. The thing that angered me most was how horrible the bowl design was, it's impossible to clean every little crevice and unless you're washing the thing every day and constantly changing the water, there will be some residue build up and calcium deposits depending on how hard your water is. I bought 3 extra filters, which I never used. I ended up throwing the unit away it just wasn't sanitary at all no matter how hard I tried and I didn't want my pet drinking out it. I would not recommend this product especially considering how expensive it is and the filters. You can give your pets Fiji water, it would be cheaper and last longer, probably healthier too.

WhenKeep Off! Repellentwasn't doing the job for me, I tried to find something better. Boundary makes strong claims, but ultimately it's the same product as Keep Off. From the label, it's clear that at least 2% of the ingredients are the same, but the undisclosed "other ingredients" might not be different either. Both products smell the same. The active ingredients are the same. A close look at the labels shows that out of the many paragraphs of text, most are the same word for word.I had higher expectations from Lambert Kay. TheirFresh 'n Clean Oxy-Strength Cat Odor & Stain Eliminatoris the best odor eliminator I have found. But with Boundary, they are selling a product that may repel cats for a while, but might not keep them away for an entire day. I expect that this will work for some people. Some cats are likely to dislike it, but not necessarily enough to stay away.I would not go so far as to say it doesn't work. If you buy this, you will be taking a chance. For some percentage of customers it will be an ideal solution. But don't expect a guarantee.

I have a cat that is 5 years old and had stayed around 5 pounds for years. She was literally only eating enough to stay alive. All my other cats are in the 12 to 15 pound range. My husband and I had consulted several doctors and tried many different approaches and types of food to get her to eat. One day, out of extreme frustration, I went out and purchased at least 30 different wet and dry foods to see if there was anything on the market I could get her to eat. I laid out all of the foods, at once, in a room and left her in the room for a couple of hours. When I came back this was the only food she had eaten all of. I have been feeding her this food for months and she is now a much healthier 8 pounds. She seems to like all the wet varieties except for the egg soufflés. (She won't touch the dry variety of this food.) I would absolutely recommend this food to anyone with picky cat!
It DOES come loose sometimes but I have a white cat that loves water and this is the only collar that comes in white (colored collars bleed onto his fur).

I felt totally safe using this brush on my Ragdoll and it seems safer to use than a slicker brush, especially near her face and eyes. She loves it, so I brushed her head for a couple of minutes. Much to my horror, there is a nickel-sized bald spot on top of her head from overbrushing. I like this product and love Kong products in general - just use caution when using for any extended period of time.

If you're looking for a great bowl with a little bit of flair this is a great bowl for you. Stainless steel, non-slip bottom, and a little name tag to prevent food steeling in multi-pet homes. Ever since we got these bowls we have had no problems with our dogs eating each other's food, thank god they know how to read.

The fabric seems very durable. I like how the top just slips around the headrests. My car seat isn't raised so I can't use the side hooks. But I did slip the thing that fits between the seat bottom and back all the way through and that seems to keep it in place just fine. The only issue I have noticed so far are the seatbelt slits are so wide that sand still goes through but the seat is still protected from mud. Easy enough to just wipe the sand off the seat.

I love Poop Off. It takes off dried poop, regurgitated food, etc. faster than conventional cleaning solutions. It's a lot safer for my birds! I pour some into a bucket and dilute with a little warm water. If you use a plastic "steel wool" dish scrub, you can get your cage cleaned in no time. Great!

I have a 14 lbs. Westie and this comb is perfect for eliminating matting problems. Well made and fairly priced, thanks to Amazon. Anyone who would buy this product in a retail pet store is throwing money away. Satisfied customer to the max.

First of all, this product is VERY difficult to remove from the packaging, which seems almost welded on. Placed at the bottom of a staircase, it also has not deterred my somewhat long-haired cat from going upstairs to pee on the carpet there. The sound does not seem to bother her at all, though it might bother a dog; it sounds like an alarm clock going off in a distant room. I think I would have to shave her to have the posts deliver the static charge.

This product was fun, although there wasn't much in the tube for the price. 100's of bubbles come out at a time, and they stick to bushes and grass. It's really fun. Kept my pet busy for a long time. I will order some again.
It's a typical small net. nothing special or spectacular about it. I would buy it again if I needed a new net.

Although this food does have good quality ingredients, my German Shepherd never really had any solid stools while on it. While switching him to this food, he had diarrhea even though I switched him over VERY slowly. I still stayed with the food thinking that the diarrhea had to do with switching the main meat component from lamb to chicken. After three months on it though, his stools are still mostly runny. I have since change to the Taste of the Wild which he actually love to eat (it smells pretty good too) and his stools are improving. This does not mean that Blue Buffalo is not a good choice for your dog. Rather I would try it out and see how your dog does on it. If you find that their stools are not improving then switch.

I bought the medium even though my dog only weighs 6 lbs. but needed it for the body length. I have to tighten the sides as tight as they go to keep him in straight. The tail hole is quite large and I could see how you could get dogs leg in wrong hole if they jump around. Haven't been able to take him for a good walk in it as we have had cold snowy weather since I purchased it but hope to use it in the spring. It is a good heavy quality material. Panda didn't seem to mind my putting him in it so hopefully it will work well for us.
This thing definitely works, but if your cat doesn't let you brush him/her than it will be really hard. However, this brush really does get the undercoat out.

I purchased this cat food after reading glowing recommendations from two or three different cat nutrition websites. One site did offer the caveat that while the quality of this brand was excellent it would not help the cat's diet if he refused to eat it and the reviewer's experience was that some cats would love it and others wouldn't touch it. My cat was somewhere in the middle - he didn't love it, but he would sometimes leave it half-eaten and the rest would dry up.My 8 year old cat is new to canned food - he has been fed a diet of 99.5 percent dry food since we adopted him as a half-grown kitten. (The other .5 percent he obtained himself from ferns and the occasional mouse. After reading an article about the nutritional needs of cats, I discovered that our rotund feline was getting too many carbohydrates and not enough protein, and I began adding canned cat food along side his daily bowl of dry food. I have tried a few different brands to find something that suits him.The Wellness canned cat food (I purchased the chicken and herring formula)has a pate-texture and I think this was my pet's primary objection to it. After trying several different canned foods, I find that he prefers more of a filet in gravy style preparation.When I first gave this to my cat I simply plopped the chunk of food into his bowl - leaving it largely in a solid can-shaped blob. Later, I began to add a half-can of warm water to the bowl and mix it up to make a thinner mush. Using this method, he seems to do fine with it, so I may or may not purchase it again.
A little thinner than what I expected. Measurements were exact. Soft and cozy, though

I ordered the Large for my 65 pound dobie and she loves it! The bolstered doughnut shaped bed is perfect for dogs who like to snuggle into their slumber.Posted 1 year later: Unfortunately after about 8 months, the filing broke down considerably, and there is no way to wash the cover...Reconsider this one.

The ball and the fireplug and a box full of everlasting treat balls were sent as a gift from a friend for my Border Collie and Lab. They LOVE them.My Labrador had started a bad habit of getting wound up when I left the house and I figured it was going to escalate into destructiveness if I didn't put a stop to it. I gave him the Everlasting Chew toy before walking out the door to distract him a few times and now he not only doesn't get wound up before I leave, he's asking me TO leave.Truly hard core chewing fun.

We have used the bed for two years, but have to replace the entire item when it is worn out because we can't find a provider for just the cover. the cost of the bed isn't bad, but it goes against the grain to have to throw the complete bed away when all that is needed is a cover. I would have given a 5 if covers were available.

This gate is a great concept, but I find the cat door too large. My 25 lb dog can still fit through easily; it's not even a tight fit. It works great for my collie mix, though (55 lbs). I also find the openings between the upright slats a little wide. My small cat can fit through even when the cat door is closed. All in all it's a great solution for the right sized pets.

We got her from a home that fed her only seeds. Also she plucked her chest and had a fractured wing bone. Needless to say, she also bit at humans like crazy. Vet said she was experiencing malnutrition and recommended ZuPreem AvianBreeder FruitBlend. It has been a few years and, she is beautifully feathered with sheen. Wing bone healed oddly but healed it did. She is a pleasure, and I attribute it to Zupreem Avian Breeder Fruit Blend and a calm environment. Will buy this again and again. Recommend!

I got the green large size for my 2 cocker spaniel puppies. They like to lay on it together. They also dive, run and play on it. They have also caused a bit of damage from chewing on the fabric, but just a tiny spot. It is irritating to put together. I would only try it with two people. My husband and I had a hard time getting everything just right, but now it has held up for 4 months. My puppies seem to prefer a blanket on it. They like for things to be soft and the fabric is a bit course. One of them sleeps on it almost every day, but the other one just lays on it to play with toys. Overall, I think that it isn't bad for dogs that are not destructive, but I would have expected something more sturdy and well built for the cost.

This one great tool and would recommend to anyone witha cairn like I have. It works so great and easy to use and my dog hates the slicker brush but will stand for me to use the Coat King on her with no problems...

The product is quality but under no circumstances will our dog wear them. We have tried slowly getting him used to them...seconds at a time complete with treats...but no go. My suggestion is try putting some cheap glasses on the dog to see how he reacts before dropping $25 for these.

My cat likes the bubbles, but the bubble gun just isn't very practical. It holds a very small amount of bubble juice, and there's nothing to keep it in there so you have to keep it steady and straight or the liquid will drip out. How fun is that? I thought it would be like a water gun, where you put the soap inside the gun, but it's actually a small reservoir on the tip that has a small wand-like circle that lifts when you pull the trigger, which sends air through and makes bubbles.It would be a lot more fun and easy to get the kitty bubbles with a typical wand that you blow on. This was just messy and a pain.

This is so much better than the small ones at Pet Smart because it is big enough that the dogs don't splash water all over the floor when they drink and I only have to fill once a day with two big dogs drinking from it.

after the first day my dog got the red isolator off the end on the tie down stake. my dog was also able to undo the clasp a few days later. i got a quick link for that end. after a week the shielding was already coming off of the cable in certain spots. so far the cable is holding my dog but not so sure how long before she breaks it.
These litter boxes are nice size and are good, but the lid locks don't lock properly and can make potential messes if not paying attention.

This was a wonderful choice...my dog absolutely lovessssss it! He gets to sit up so he can see everything, stay safe because he's harnessed in and be comfy because his seat is so cushie! Plus, on top of all of this, there's a storage drawer to put his things in when we travel. It is well worth every penny you pay for it!
I like Oster trimmers and I do use this one, but I don't recommend it. It's too small, doesn't cover enough area and overheats a bit. You can find a better one for this price.

I purchased one of these for my turtle tank about a year ago. It quit working after about 3 months. Pump just died and nothing would revive it. I was very busy at the time and dug out an old, (5 years old) Aqua Clear fish filter. I used this filter until things calmed down, then purchased another of these, I figured the first was a fluke since Tetra is reputable company. It is now 3 months later and the new filter has quit. As soon as I post this review I am going to purchase a new Aqua Clear fish filter for my turtle.

I thought that because this product was described as medium that it would be a little large than it was I guess I should have made more attention to the product description however I do think under closer examination I might have accidentally received a size down from what I purchased :( nothing I can do about it now

Second one I purchased on account of cat invading my driveway. First one lasted less than 1 yr. Battery kept getting shorted out in the rain. Finally, died. Second one has gone thru 5 batteries in 3 months. Also noticed that battery compartment still gets wet in the rain.This product is a complete waste of money
My 8 month old lab was skinning the green fuzz off this toy and swallowing it within an hour after opening. I tried to return it but the time period had elapsed.Very disappointing.

My cat leads a sheltered life and when I saw this, I thought it would be perfect to get her outside but still be protected. She was fine with it until the neighbor animals came to visit and then she freaked. It was used for a total of less than a half hour and, after almost two weeks of practically continual hissing and screeching, I'm not going to try to get her back into it.

I purchased this along with a Proselect cooling system refil thinking I was buying the fan and the refill but instead I got a refill and a refill with a holder for the refill..no fan. it's pretty conusing.
The flea trap overall works well. It is really good with knats and moths. We thought we were beginning to have problems with fleas, but so far we haven't found many fleas in the traps.

After the third time replacing my CatIT fountain due to a broken pump, I decided to try this fountain to see if it was any better. On the plus side, it was quiet and I liked the adjustable flow.However, I found that this fountain was just too much work to use and maintain. It comes apart into four pieces that all need to be regularly cleaned. In addition, the actual water pump needs to be regularly disassembled and cleaned. The water reservoir container has a poorly-designed cap that will make it likely that you will leak water when you try to place it into the fountain.Also (and I know this differs from cat to cat), around the time I started using this fountain, I noticed my cat started to drink out of toilets and people's water glasses, which was something she had never done before. As a test, I set a separate bowl of water for her, and noticed that she always drank from the bowl and never the fountain. From that, I surmised that she doesn't like this fountain, and so I eventually got rid of it. I now use a non-electric stainless steel dish with a gallon reservoir.
Our Dachshund has had this ball for over two years and he just now got the ball out of the inside. What an exciting moment! Well worth the money. I'm going to purchase some for gifts.

I have a multicat household and have been using Feliway Diffusers for a couple of years. I do think it helps relax the cats. The diffusers don't quite last a month, and it is fairly expensive to purchase in stores. I've been purchasing on line for some time. This 6 pack deal is the cheapest I've found. The order came promptly with no problems.

Tired if turning on faucet (and forgetting to turn it off!!) for my cat to drinkI thought this would be a great solution. Well, my cat won't have anything to do with it. Aside from this, it is somewhat noisy and a pain to clean and refill. Just unplugged it for now. May try again another day.

I have 3 little dogs and a very small backyard. Need I say more? The size of this septic-tank seems to be perfect for the number of dogs I have. It took me about an hour to dig the hole (using a post hole digger). So far I have no complaints about the system. I installed it about 2 months ago and it's working perfectly. The top of the tank is plastic. I read one reviewer's comment that said the top had cracked after some time. Mine seems to be holding up well so far. Once I've used it for a while, I'll add more to my review.

Our Shiba Inu, Maya, loves these. First and foremost, the packaging says Made in the USA and that makes them worth buying right there. They are quite light and airy (being freeze dried) and are easy to crunch or gum for older dogs. A definite go to treat for any canine companion.
This was junk and was missing the pieces. I was to busy with work to send it back. This was the most dissapointed I have ever been with an amazon product. dont waste your money or time
My dog loved this toy. Unfortunatley, it is not a toy for agressive chewers. It lasted all of about 45 minutes.

My cat seems to enjoy the other Felidae canned food flavor, so I thought I'd try another flavor, to keep him from growing bored or finicky.He seemed reluctant to eat it at first, and then just refused to eat this stuff altogether. He actually didn't eat for nearly two days. I thought he was sick! Turned out he just hates this flavor.But Felidae is a great, protein-rich brand!

A womnderful water bottle for any small animal. The only reason I didn't rate it five stars is because there is no measurement lines on the side to keep track of the water in take from the little critter.

I typically order the Platinum Filters but ordered these by mistakes. They are OK but expect to change more often if you usually order the Platinum filters. If you have a drinkwell fountain these filters are a must.

My dogs loved this ball and had lots of fun getting biscuits out of it -- for a day. Within 24 hours my collie mix had chewed a giant hole in it. Maybe less powerful chewers would do better with this ball.

"Be Warned" Yes this is a clever idea at first glance. Unfortunately the product does not work efficiently and the company does not back up their product return. Due to the large quantity of food coming out at one time the company advised that we take the dispenser apart and move the dial to a desired setting (why isn't this in the instructions? wait...there are no instructions). They said we could return the dispenser if we still had problems but would first need to call. We tried their suggestion and unfortunately same result. We made numerous calls about a return and were told each time that they had to check with the supervisor and would get back to us. Still waiting. . . Anyway, will be passing it along to someone else who allows their pet to eat large amounts of food all day. By the way, any cat who eats all day will have major gastrointestinal problems! What a mess!

I purchased the Super Bark Stop about a month ago and it has produced mixed results. I have been satisfied with the product concerning the labrador dog next door. It has completely worked with this type of dog and she doesn't bark at all now. However, the bassett hound is not affected by the product. If anything, the Bark Stop causes this dog to bark more as it interprets the sound as an intruder rather than a deterrent. Therefore, I am pleased with the results, but also disappointed.
Great for any household that have people with allergies. Have kept me from getting any allergies from the dog.

I hate to be negative, but this product just doesn't work in controlling fleas. Had no problem with the price or receiving the product, but I thought it would work for several months. A treatment is supposed to work for close to a month, but we've had to re-apply every couple of weeks and are still seeing fleas. Will not purchase Frontline again, I'm afraid.

These small moist treats are perfect for training - the size means you can work with your dog for quite a while without worrying about over feeding. The peanut butter flavor seems to be a favorite but he likes the beef and salmon as well.I appreciate that these treats are made in the U.S. out of ingredients I feel comfortable with. Zuke's is a pet food company I feel I can trust! I also like that they don't smell terrible, like some moist snacks can!One tip - these will dry out pretty quickly if left open - so keep the bag sealed up! Our dog will still happily eat them when they've gone crunchy but they're clearly not quite as exciting to him once they're no longer squishy.

We were in despair over our rescue pooch who, at only 14 pounds, was yanking our arms out on a regular leash and collar walk. A pet store trainer recommended this and at first I thought it was a muzzle, which seemed cruel to me. It isn't. She can open her mouth normally and is not restrained in any way. In fact, our dog's long thin neck was vulnerable to injury before the Gentle Leader. It was amazing - she is not overly fond of it (will try to rub it off at times) but from the first walk she marched down the road on a loose leash. We are trying to train her not to jump on visitors and for some reason she is calm and polite when it is on in the house as well. Please follow directions carefully as to fit and check often. If you have a dog with a short nose this may not work for you but it is a miracle for our cocker spaniel/chihuahua mix.

I bought this for my 80lbs dog to wear during hunting season. I really like the vest, everything fits well except for his private area. The strap goes right over his parts, and if I left the straps dangle, he would pee on them. So, since I spent the money on it, I will probably just cut off the back straps and let him wear the vest like a cape.

We have 2 dogs, a Golden Retriever and a Poodle-mix, who both think that they have to defend the house when someone walks by; it irritates us, and the person going by. We will not use bark-collars, so I was happy to find the Ultrasonic Indoor Bark Contol, and ordered it as soon as I discovered it. We have had it about 6 weeks, and it has been totally ineffective. We tried different locations, and different angles, but it simply did not make any difference. The battery had to be replaced within this 6 week period, although they say that it should last longer. It's not the end of the world, but we are very disappointed in this product, and would certainly not recommend it based upon our own experiences.

Got two bags of these for my dog. For some reason they make him have to go poo almost instantly. Tried two different flavors and the both make him sick. He does not normally have intestinal issues. I'm going back to regular milk bones or zukes.

Wellness kitten brand cat food has been recalled twice. It made my kitty sick both times and we had no idea it was the cat food. I will never buy this product again. The company did a poor job communicating the recall to its customers. Our cat's thiamine level was affected.
I received the pond netting just in time to keep the leaves out of our fish pond. The product works great! I would recommend this to anyone trying to keep debris out of the filter

I have seen a couple of my cats enjoy themselves as they play with this toy, and I think I've seen all of them use the scratch pad. Only drawback, and this could just be a behavior problem of my cat, but he seems very attracted to using the cardboard as a pee collector. If it were not for that, I would keep it out all the time. Unfortunately, even when I removed the cardboard and washed it, the cat was still attracted to using it as a bathroom. I guess the plastic absorbed the odor. I'm not sure if all cats react the same way to cardboard. But after seeing the delight on my cat's face, I bought one for my sister's cat.Note: Later, I bought the style without the center, that looked like a crib toy. That went over well, except that it came apart and I had to use duck tape to keep it together.

I have had more success with these litter boxes than with the regular plastic litter boxes.My ferrets just really prefer using these. I think it's because they prefer the texture of the cardboard. Their feet dont slide around like they do in the plastic boxes.Also, they are more absorbent and hygenic and less odor, definitely. You are supposed to keep them for up to a month and then replace them.It might seem like a hassle having to buy replacements but it's worth it when you dont have to clean up ferret poo around the house!

I got this as a wedding present (to each their own). I thought that it would be the greatest thing on the face of the planet - no more scooping litter, and and no more mess. Considering at the time of my wedding, my precious little kitten topped 20 lbs, he produced more waste than many dogs. The rake on this got jammed CONSTANTLY. it normally happen about 2 or 3 in the morning, right after he used it. When it didn't get jammed, it flung, uh, crap, across my laundry room. I kept it for about 8 months, realised that I handled the litter less with a box of sifting litter box liners (about $[...] US) and kept the box area cleaner.
I liked this and it was working well for a while, but then my dog decided he wasn't into the taste and stopped eating his food when I put it over it. Had to stop using.

The fountain was OK while it still worked - although it was very difficult to clean. However, after 11 monthes its engine died, so the whole thing stopped working. By the time we got ourselves to sending it somewhere - the 12 months guarantee expired (and besides - they probably would have told us we didn't clean it often enough - which admittedly we did not)It was also very big and cumbersome.[...]
They were crumbly and, surprisingly, the dogs were fairly unexcited about them when we went to give them the treats.

This collar is not strong enough for my large breed Border Collie. She continues to bark and bark. I see the collar light up with each bark and it doesn't even phase her. I thought maybe it was because she was so furry, so I shaved the part of the neck when the contacts were, but it didn't make a difference. Who knows, maybe it would be better on a smaller dog.

Unfortunately, my pug didn't like these steps no matter how many times we practiced and enticed her with treats. I think if she was totally incapable of jumping up on the sofa, we would have been able to get her to use it. May have to try again in the future. The stairs are somewhat flimsy, and needs to be pushed up against the sofa, bed, etc., and somehow anchored in place, otherwise, it will slip about. Not a bad product for the price.

These are okay thermometer covers. As an occupational therapist, I worry because they tend to rip easily and I definitely don't want to spread germs between patients. They are better than some other ones I have used though! Overall, these are okay.
I bought these from my pet grooming drill. The coarse bands work better for trimming my dog's nails. The grinding stones are too smooth and don't file much off.

We humans may find this an attractive and safe bone alternative - but it seems to be totally boring from a canine perspective. My dog who usually loves to chew anything (bones, rawhide, wood, etc.) could not care less about this "bone". I tried several times to get her interested in the Nylabone - to no avail. At this point, she will not even take it into her mouth when I try to hand it to her.

The 2-quart size was different than pictured, with upward protrusions on the handle connections; and the 4-quart size had tiny sharp protrusions inside the bucket from the handle connector. However, the 6, 9 and 13 quart sizes had no such problems.

My dog really likes this toy, but the material is very hard, and I worry that it may damage her teeth (no problems yet though). The good news is that the ring shape makes it less likely she will get it back to her molars.

I guess my american eskimno is deaf,pushing a button on this thing is wearing me out. He pays no attention, its has no effect on him at all. ended up going for a bark collar. Save your money,start mith something that does work.

My poor little one just can't seem to figure this thing out. It's hit and miss with him. He is a fairly small kitty, I would even say below average in size. He just can't seem to fit in this thing. Sometimes he accidentally poops outside of the door. I think the inside is significantly smaller than the standard box that he's used to, and either his head is sticking out or his bum is sticking out-which creates extra clean up for me. Also, when rolling the box litter sometimes spills out of the cracks and I always check to make sure the latches are tight. I love the concept of the box and I do think it occasionally makes things easier on me, but I would just recommend that you get a larger one, and maybe keep a small broom and dust pan near by for cleanup.

Hands down the best investment I've made since venturing into the fish keeping hobby. I was hesitant to get a bigger tank than the 55 gallon I already had because I wasn't interested in the amount of work it would be to do water changes. After buying the python I quickly upgraded to not only a 75 gallon but also a 125 gallon as well. Literally makes water changes effortless. I would give it six stars if possible.
It's working wonders on our Maltese. Also on our YoChon. Both eyes are no longer running! Thanks so much for making such a great product.

I've found myself needing to clean cat poop out of the collection area every 3-4 days or so.It works somewhat as-advertised, but there needs to be a better non-disposable tray option. Right now, all you can do is look on auction sites and they are quite overpriced.Occasionally, the rake mechanism makes a sound like a slipping belt, but it's still working. I hope that it lasts...Also, only one of my cats has fully adjusted to the litter box. The other two have thus far continued using the old litter box even though I stopped cleaning it frequently and have been mixing in more and more crystal litter.

One issue is with the food itself. Some the food in some cases is firm and stays together while in other cases, it is very soft and mushy. The entire case follows the same pattern. Company says it has something to do with the ingredients and the cooking. We are concerned that it may not be cooked thoroughly. Dogs do like it and it does not seem to affect them regardless of the consistency. Have had this experience with both the large and small cans. We still use the food and would recommend it.The packing and shipping by Amazon is another problem. Amazon packs several cases in a box with paper or air bags to "fill the empty space". Neither of these methods work and cans are often dented and have even had the top punched in on one can. After a week or so, it started smelling like something dead and upon investigating all of the cases, found the problem to be the punched in top on one of the cans. This allowed air in and food had started to rot. This is strictly Amazon's problem and while we are Prime members, we have had many experiences with poor packing on many items. Amazon is good about replacing broken items once you let them know.

This Feline Pine is fantastic. There is no odor and it cleans up neatly. It just melds into a fine clump. I use the big scoop you can get for free with their points program. Finally there is hope for cat litter.
Bought it for use on my hair and i must say i am very happy with the softness and condition of my hair, love it and will purchase again...
In the image of the product, one can see the fastener is black. Upon confirming at the Planet Dog website, the fastener is plastic, not stainless steel as advertised in the product description.

My small bird has not taken to the perch as I had hoped. Other reviews raved about it and I thought it would be nice for my rather cool house. The plastic that the perch is made from is not very comfortable to my bird. We still keep it plugged in when it's cool and place him on it when he goes back into thc cage. We've only been using it for just under a month, so I'm hoping it will still catch on. I think it is a great idea, I just have to convince my bird.

Although the idea sounded great - not having to manually clean out the cat litter every day for two cats - the littermaid comb is too weak to actually move the gunk out into the plastic receptacle. Although I got the deluxe, supposedly for multiple cats and/or big cats, I end up having to clean it all up myself. Also, the plastic construction is rather flimsy - the plastic piece that moves up and down covering the waste receptacle broke on the first day.
Do not buy this for your small animal! This is BY FAR one of the smallest/worst cages I have ever seen. NOT a suitable home for your pets! I would give it zero stars if I could.

The first 3 - 4 times my male 20 pounder pug wore this, it stayed on, now he knows how to get it off every time. The medium size seemed a little tight for him, so I got a large, the large is too big, I sewed it smaller, but he get the large one off also.
One of my cats doesn't seem repelled by this product. He continues to claw at my box spring. It may me just him and not this product.
My Shih Tzu is very finicky b/c he is so spoiled. I have to search high and low for treats he will accept. This is one of those few. Thank you!

Here i sit with my 1 1/2 year old Japanese Chin 8 hours after Advantix application.When the time came for us to have quiet time, she came to my lap and i noticed she was shivering and staring into space. She is now hyper and will not rest, even though it is 3am.She continues to shiver and prance, holding her tail awkwardly. Another oddity is when i pet her she jerks her legs.There were no other variables to her day. i became concerned and searched if this med has reputation for causing adversities. YES! Please read about the effects beforehand and your will find other reports of reactions!!! POISON!!!Everyone needs to report their reactions to the FDA, Here is link[...]

Lasted a couple of years before the hooks that connected it to the cage broke. I mostly used the hooks for stabilizing while it was resting on something, but I did sometimes hang it completely on the hooks. It's annoying not having them now because the house ends up all over the place now. Otherwise worked well. My chin likes it better when the flat side down though.
Flakes crumble almost to powder when touched but can use powder to feed fry. Just makes water cloudy in large tanks and fish still hungry.
It is not 3/8 and I find this just too stiff for my little one. But if she were not so small I suppose it would be okay.
This product works great for my dog. I did find this product at a lower price somewhere else. Regardless this is a very good product.

These bandannas are small - even on my 1 lb ferret. My 3 lb ferret looks choked wearing one of these. It is also disappointing that you are at the mercy of the manufacturer (Marshalls), as they change the pattern and color at whim, so you don't always get exactly what you order. Other than that they are made well and have a handy strip of velcro for doing them up.

I've had mine for a couple of years and it's still holding up. I keep it outside, so it's take the weather fine (though this is California). It assembled very easily and I got the ramp, which is definitely worth it. My only problem is that it's too low for small dogs. The bottom is knee high, so you can get a back ache. The sink is better for my cavi.It's very convenient if your dog is always getting muddy and needs a quick hosing off. If not, I'd stick to taking them to the dog wash at the pet food store.I also bought the hot water mixer, they call the " tropic shower " - The off/on valves are made of very cheap pot metal and broke after a few uses. They ([...]) promised to send me a replacement, but never did and would not answer my follow-up e-mails. Anyway, you can build your own for less money.

These leashes are amazing! Unfortunately, I was looking for the cord leash and not the tape leash. The seller had it listed as a cord leash when in fact it was a tape leash. The seller responded to all my e-mails in resolving the issue and sent a return postage paid envelope to return the product for a full refund since they didn't have the leash I wanted. So, even though it was a bummer not to get the product I wanted, I was impressed with how the seller resolved the issue.

I received this product the first of July and at first was very pleased with the item. It was plenty big for my chihuahua and installation was a breeze. The problem I ran into was the durability of the product. In less than 2 months the straps that hold the front part of the carrier disintegrated and broke. A slight tug on the strap and you could break off a piece. My dog enjoys the seat so much, that I'm not going to return it but instead put new straps for the front of the seat.I'm not sure if others have had this problem or whether the fact that I live on the Big Island of Hawaii has an effect on the straps deteriorating.I have no complaints with Amazon and do most of my shopping with them. When they say shipping is free they mean it, even if you live in Hawaii or Alaska.

I purchased the squirrel for our puppy that can destroy most toys. First off this is not a squirrel it looks more like a beaver. second it is really not intended for dogs over 10 pounds. It states it is for dogs 10 to 25 pounds and my 15 pound puppy had this completely in his mouth the moment I gave it to here. I did buy the large one and she loves it.

Needed a good food bowl set for my 20-lb terrier who likes to spill water all over the place. This pet feeder did the job. Like the other reviewers said, the really weird grey panels that were pseudo-attached to the plastic holder totally caused a WTF moment, but after I removed and threw them away, the feeder looks better and is fine. Money well spent. Maybe the manufacturer will stop making those pieces and lower the price by a couple of bucks, which would make this a really good bargain.

This collar was great a first! It worked for about 6months then we had to buy a new one cause it stopped working. The 2nd one worked for a bit but our dog started to figure out that if she barked 10 or more times the collar would run and then she was a free women to bark all she wants. So we had to keep refilling it. I bought numerous refills and replacement batteries for the collar. It finally got to the point where the collar was just blowing air not even the spray was working. So we finally bit the bullet and went with the shock collar.

This is good for what it is. Its a bit smaller than I thought it would be. I should have done more research. Its made nicely and the pup seems to like it ok.I think it will work for short trips. If you have a very small dog it will work just fine, any dog over five pounds will be uncomfortable, my opinion only.I will buy a larger one next timeThank YouBob and Char
As in the title, it works, but because I bought used it was missing a few screws and bolts. I jerry rigged it so that it works, and it is ok.

My husband and I recently adopted a 3 yr old Bullmastiff from a local animal shelter - unbeknownst to us, she has separation anxiety! While this crate is easy to assemble/disassemble, it did not stand up well in her attempts to escape. Within an hour she had started bending the frame near the door; within a few hours, her paws were sticking out of the 6" opening she had made. My hubby was able to bend it back into place (more or less), but we have since purchased a heavy duty crate to safely contain her while we're away. We're still utilizing the Midwest crate at night when she can see us but, unfortunately, it's not sturdy enough for our 100 lb. dog experiencing separation anxiety during the day.

My cats always loved this food - this is the first time I ordered it from Amazon. Don't know what changed, but they didn't care for it at all. Don't know if this was a bad batch, or if it wasn't stored properly, but something is different. Now I'm stuck with almost a full case and am out $30. Guess I will donate to local shelter.....
This gate will sahow up in a baby gate search but the instructions that come with the gate clearly state that it is NOT TO BE USED WITH CHILDREN!

I took the plunge and bought both the gel and spray. I already normally brushed my dogs teeth daily with another brand's poultry toothpaste. The new routine was two sprays in the morning after a quick brush with water, and in the evening I put the gel on a toothbrush to apply, then two more sprays. I really only missed two evening applications because I fell asleep.I thought this product would be great. Seeing as how I just got my male IG's teeth cleaned, I thought this product would be a great preventative and hopefully take the place of future cleanings. Here's my results after over 30 days of use. My female IG's breath smelled better, it could be from the alcohol in it. Not much change in plaque. My male had no change, but keep in mind his teeth were already clean. So, I guess it kept them clean. I feel like if I just used my old toothpaste twice a day instead of once it would have done the same job.So, I stopped using it and went back to my old toothpaste, only now they get brushed twice a day. The main reason why I stopped was because they really hated the gel and spray! They would run away from this instead of running to me like before. They just LOVE their poultry toothpaste, it's like a treat to them. I get compliments on how well behaved my dogs are when getting dental exams, I would hate to change that behavior.After using the product for 30 days, I have come to a conclusion. The product is rather easy to apply, much quicker than a full brushing with standard paste. With that in mind, I think more users will be likely to keep up the regimen. So for most people, this will provide a decent result with minimal effort. However, since I normally brushed at least once daily already, I don't think there was much of a difference.
my dog is still scratching after two months of applications. so not sure if this stuff really works or not. i will try a different brand when i run out and see if there is something better.

My sister used this stuff on her cat. She got terribly sick and started having tremor convulsions. She is now at the vet's office getting an IV to try to get the stuff out of her system. They did the same treatment yesterday (IV). The vet is not sure she is going to make it. She also purchased the dog treatment. It made one of her dogs really sick but did not affect the other one. If you really care about your pet, spend the extra few bucks and get Frontline or Revolution, or whatever is recommended by your Vet. This stuff should be taken off the market.

Packed well... but took forever to receive... customer service was helpful... the second time around.I have two big dogs and thought this would make cleaning my backyard a breeze... WRONG!It has a very weak spring, and leaves half the poop in the grass.Save your money and just use your grocery store bags.

They worked great for about a week. My dogs are pretty active and the caps ended up wearing all the way through. When I took off the few that didn't fall off on their own you could see right through them

I purchased the Marineland Emperor Power Filter 400 to replace a five year old Tetra Whisper filter. I chose the Emperor 400 because I have another 5 year old Marineland filter that uses the same size replacement filter. The problem with this system is, how, do you reduce the water flow during feeding since there is no switch to reduce the water flow?I called Marineland tech support about this issue thinking I overlooked the switch. I was told by tech support that they do not know why Marineland decided not to have a water flow switch to reduce the water flow during feeding. The tech support person stated I could un-plug the power to filter system during feeding and re-plug the power back in after feeding. I am thinking, returning it will be less trouble than un-plugging and re-plugging it every day.I have three other power filters, one by Marineland and two by Tetra that have water flow switches. Since, I want to standardize my replacement filters maybe I will purchase another Tetra Whisper instead of a Marineland. I am not sure why Marineland decided not to have a water flow switch in the new version of the 400.

This is ok. The little pointer deal tends to really get air bubbles clinging to i which can throw the readings of significantly. I spend a lot of time poking the needle with a dropper trying to knock all the air bubbles off.

I ordered this product because it was advertised as light-weight and easy to assemble. The photo looked as if the dog inside would have good visibility to the outside.The crate is not easy to assemble and requires strength. While not terribly heavy (22 lbs), it is heavy given the bulkiness of the crate. The weight makes assembly harder. The netting is so dark in color that there is not good visibility for the animal inside; instead it is kind of claustrophobic. I returned the crate.

I was given one of these clickers from my dog trainer and I liked it at first. However, about a week into it i was sitting on the floor training Chomper and I raised my hand, the clicker flew out, hit the wood floor and the orange button fell off. You can still use it by putting your hand into the hole where the button was and clicking but its pretty annoying now to use.I was sad.

This product was okay. We have dog with serious skin flakes. He has been like that since a puppy and is now 12 years old. The past year he went through a really bad bout of skin irritation. I did not see a difference in his skin condition at all when using this product. I ended up going to the vet and getting some prescription strength. I found the pump on the bottle a pain - probably because the shampoo is so thick. I will not buy again.

The shelf had to be modified to hold our cat's weight(8lbs). I had to drill out a hole on the wall support bracket and anchor to the wall. Easy to do. May be the manufacture could add this to the product ?

The good about this is that my older dog stopped chewing the end of the coffee table after we sprayed it. It also kept him off the bed. There was never any problem with staining or anything. For my younger dog however, she took a few sniffs and actually licked it. I even sprayed it near her and she jumped back but then smelled it and licked it off. I don't know why. I suggest you might want to purchase the smaller 8oz. until you know how your dog will react.

These are kinda stinky but the price is really good.. the ones in pet stores are usually stinky too except they cost more so i thought id give it a try. My dog ended up loving them so no regrets with this purchase.

This is a great toy, but the bottle is just too big for a small dog. The only way to get the treats out is to turn the bottle upside down and my dog's mouth is too small to grab the base of the bottle and he weighs 20 lbs. He can demolish a bully stick in less than five minutes, but cannot grab the base of this bottle to stand it on it's top. It's a clever toy for a medium to large dog!

MY GOLDEN RETRIEVER MANAGED TO CHEW THE CENTER, REMOVEABLE PIECE OFF AND GOT A PART OF IT STUCK IN HIS MOUTH.DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. GET THE ATOMIC "MOLECULE BALL" INSTEAD. ITS SOFTER AND MORE PLIABLE AND NOT NEARLYAS DANGEROUS.

We set up the panic Mouse 360, and our cat just looked around for the source of the noise, but wasn't at all impressed by the bouncing black ball on the stick. When we turned it off, he grabbed the ball, but the whole arm came off. A little crazy glue solved that problem, but he just isn't impressed at all by the turned on toy. He's a bit hard to please, I guess.
This is a great item and it really works. I have seen such a difference onmy Brussels Griffon. Will not be without it anymore. She really does love it too!

Use with caution. I would love to love this crate and give it five stars and would except for the fact that, unfortunately, as other viewers have mentioned, it is possible for a puppy or very anxious dog to catch their mouth or paw in the areas where the sides connect. As you can see in product photo, there are smaller spaces of wiring at top and bottom corners that connect the sides of cage. It would be better designed if there were smaller mesh for entire cage area preventing the dog from even being able to get mouth or paw into the spaces. My puppy yelped when he briefly caught his paw at the top front corner. He has calmed down enough now and is very comfortable in this crate with his ProSelect Pawprint Dog Cage Cover and Pad Set in black that I also purchased on Amazon for an amazing price, and is a very good match for this crate! A friend of mine also owns this crate (and same cover/pad set) but never mentioned this happening to her hyper Jack Russell or mini Aussie, so just be aware.

My cat likes this toy fine but she doesn't go crazy for it like she does for the bird pole (a pole attached to a string with a feather lure on the end). She will very rarely leap into the air after it. I have to drag it along the ground away from her to get her interested (which involves a lot of work on my part since it means I can't stay in one place) and then she pins it and her claws get stuck in it. A declawed cat might enjoy it more because the ribbon would just slip through its paws. With my cat it is sort of a pain to use. It's more fun just to tie it around her and watch her try to run out of it. Not sure how fun that is for her, though. Next stop, laser pointer.

The bag came on time and was in excellent condition, however the dimensions are misleading. I would not consider this a "large" bag. It was long but very short. It would be good for a toy breed or a kitten but nothing larger.If I had smaller pets I would have loved this bag, but it did not suit my purposes (two medium sized kittens).
Only lasted a couple days!! My doberman was able to chew the sides off of it. Kind of expensive for a toy that only lasts a few days.

My German Shepherd is not really interested in this bone. He likes many natural bones but really is not interested in this one - so it was not really useful to me. However, if your dog goes for this bone it will probably provide hours of pleasure. Recommended with reservations.

I bought this as my 6 yrs old JRT started suffering from seperation anxiety recently. He barks and barks and barks and barks... when we are not at home. Received lots of complaints from angry neaighbours. He is not alone at home, there is another puppy to keep him company.The collar works wonderfully initially. However, it stopped working after about 2 months. At first we thought that battery was low thus changed a new battery. But, it still doesn't work. I tried testing it by rubbing it against a rough surface, only sound and light, no static or whatsoever.The device was also too big for my 5 kg JRT. I tried tightening the collar till I can't insert a finger, but he still managed to shake it and moved the sensor to the back of his neck.Waste of money and it is really expensive here in Singapore, about S$140. But we haven't got much choice coz this is the only brand of static collar they sell here.

I bought this product because my cat would leave litter everywhere because she would jump out through the side of her box instead of using the ramp. When I brought it home I proceeded to put it together, this took awhile. You have to snap together some very flimsy plastic rods that kept on coming apart everytime I thought I had it together. Once I finished the very shaky frame I had to put on the plastic cover, it zips on all the way around. It's not as easy as it sounds. Once I got it all set up, my cat investigated it, she was fine with it. Then after a week, I noticed that it was starting to cave in, I figured she had been sleeping on it. Then one day I found that the entire thing had collapsed because my cat was jumping on it, I took it apart and realized that the plastic rods had snapped in half. I was so angry because I had paid so much money for this thing. My other problem was that it was so huge and ugly. I might have my dad build one out of plywood, it would be a lot sturdier than this thing and I could just decorate it myself so it would look nicer. I really like the litterbox, but I hate the tent.

I bought one of these so that we could go away on a long weekend and not kill my daughter's goldfish ($1 carnival prize goldfish--$25 feeder). It took me three tries to figure out the programming instructions--I agree with the others that encountered problems. I am fairly computer literate and the steps required to program the thing were ridiculous. I basically got it to work by accident. It is also not attached to the "adjustable" mounting bracket--it simply slides off. I found this out after carrying it across the room by the mounting bracket--it fell off and smashed into about a dozen pieces on my tile floor. So . . . it seemed to be reliable for the few days that we used it and it is relatively quiet, but if you lack technical ability or interpret "adjustable" as "attached, but movable" this may not be the feeder for you.

When we first installed the fountain we found it relatively quiet, but within a few days it had begun fits of louder operation -- a bit growly really. These noisy spells can be ended by lifting then replacing the reservoir housing. We have the reservoir completely full, so that's not it. Turning the pressure up or down does not seem to help, though the louder the water, the less conspicuous the motor noise. Not sure I'd buy this again. It'll have to live in the basement from here on out, since it's too loud for the dining room.

The comb fits alright, but I find that it frequently gets tangled in the thick, curly fur of my dog (cocker/terrier). Bought it for the Oster A5. I find the clipper works much better without the comb. Part of the problem may be that I have the #10 wide blade on my clipper, and the comb is made for the #10 regular width blade.

I think this is a great product. However, my finicky cat refuses to drink from it. I left it there for a month with another water bowl in a different location and she refused to use the pet fountain. I wound up giving it to a friend with 2 non-finicky cats. So, beware if your cat is attached to their water bowl.

The Omega is well conceived but it has one tragic flaw -- cat poop. The first time I rotated the box to dump the poop, I did not check first to see if my cats had covered their droppings. One of them hadn't. The stuff got caught in the filter grill where it became a dried mess that partly blocked the grill until I could take the box apart and hose it down. Even when the cats did cover their poop, the clumps sometimes broke up in the grill, then plopped against the top of the box as it was rotated, then fell - most of it - into the waste bin. I am back to emptying the old covered litter boxes with a hand rake while I save up for a Litter Robot.

My Shih Tzus love the assorted rawhide twist sticks. They are a bit larger in size than the little twist sticks so I don't worry, as much, that they will choke on them. They do last for a long long time. I also like the fact that these rawhide sticks do not stain my Shih Tzus coats, carpets or bedspreads. I highly recommend them for your dog's chewing pleasure.

We got this for our 45lb dog and it occupied him for 30 minutes the first time we gave it to him. He had a little trouble getting a treat out. A miracle! However he is a smart dog and quickly learned how it worked. A scoop of food that used to last him 20+ minutes now only lasted him 10 minutes. Unfortunately after a couple of weeks, the plastic lid that screws onto the jug cracked and it is now useless. This is probably best for pet owners with carpeting since my dog would pick it up and drop it constantly to get the treats out which would be very noisy.

We purchased this collar from Amazon about 2 years ago. We had problems with it spraying when our dog didn't bark. I called the company and they sent out a new one. It worked well for awhile then it started shooting up like Old Faithful when I was filling it. The batteries also didn't last very long. We stopped using it for a year because I was frustrated with the issues we were having. I decided recently to try again, and that is when it was shooting out the Citronella as quick as I put it in. I called the company again and they said that they had recalled the model that I had so they sent out another new one. They also included spray and battery which I thought was nice of them.
