This collar has been working better, but when I don't have it on she barks alot. Sometimes I will put it on her without turning it on and that works. We have a new puppy so I hate to leave it on our older dog all the time since it seems to prohibit her from playing with the puppy.I am happier with this model, and like I said, "It is better then nothing", but I am still not getting the results I was hoping for. For those of you who complained about the unit being faulty, give Premier a call. They are really good about replacing it.
OK but could be better. Was going to leeve it at that but need the words so I won't buy again.

I purchased the petmate durabed for large breeds. I have a Doberman puppy that weighs 35 lbs and he absolutely loves his bed. A concern I have is that if he weighed the actual amount that the bed says it could hold, I don't believe the product would last very long. I have to tighten the legs every couple of weeks or the bed would collapse. The bed definitely shows the wear and tear from everyday use.

A single foam insert costs about $3 from my local fish supply store. Buying a 3pk for just about the same price is an excellent value. The foam inserts can be used for a much longer time than the manufacturer suggests. Just rinse the insert, in conditioned water or water from the aquarium, and you are good to go until the foam insert starts to break down.Excellent value, and is easily cleaned and reused. Recommended for anyone with an AquaClear Power Filter.

This is my 2nd flexi - first one only failed due to my laziness--- it's best wit a well mannered, trained dog you want to keep on 'leash' but want to give some freedom. Watch your fingers!! This is improved from the model I bought 6 years ago.
The cats loved the other flavor, they won't touch this one. My bad, I ordered the wrong one. Love my cats
This collar is very well made and reasonably priced. The leather is thick but not stiff and gets softer with wear.

I bought one of these and a Lee's net breeder. I like the Lee's brand much better than this one. The plastic is flimsy and the net even worse. I thought I was going to rip the net as I gingerly put it on the plastic frame! And I didn't get all the tiny plastic grass things -the picture shows 5 or 6 sturdy ones; I got only 3 (that also looked & felt as if they'd fall to pieces).

OK - but a heating pad worked better for my litter - easier to get onto - and more consistently warm. I was glad to have the Snuggle Safe just in case I needed to take the litter to the vets (or a puppy to the vets) in an emergency. Fortunately, we had no need for an emergency vet visit - The Snuggle Safe was just so rigid that it wasn't inviting.

My cats shed all over the place, thus, the need for a brush. This one- well, better than nothing. A friend of mine has a much better one, with longer teeth that catches more hair. The teeth on this are a little shallow and don't catch that much in the brush. They more just disturb the hair off of the feline coat. If anyone can recommend a decent one to me, I would appreciate it. Just could be designed better.

I think it's a good product... just didn't work for my dog. But, my dog is rather unique in that he goes insane outdoors when he sees another dog. So, not to say this product is bad. Just doesn't work with stubborn dogs like mine.
My dog is about 12 lbs. Her feces tends to slip through the cracks in the rake. This rake still works okay, but I will pick something else when I need a new one.

This thing is not the sixe it said it is and the leather used is garbage . My dog got this peice of crap off in 1 minute . If you need a muzzle DO NOT BUY IT ONLINE go get one at a store so you know you have the right size
These have a great concept...but my little dogs were able to chew chunks off of this way too easily. It's also hard to clean the inside and it got moldy...so I'll be buying the other kong products.

I have tried both on my dog over the last few years and have found Frontline to work much better than Advantix for keeping tics away. Frontline is much safer too for everyone because it allows the tick to stay long enough to die from the medicing whereas Advantix repells them faster, which can make disease carrying tics jump off inside your home, alive and well so from my point of view; their is not contest here.
It's good and it is easy to use, but it is not sharp enough and sometimes splinters my cat's nails.

I purchased this with the hopes that it will help me navigate my aerator pretty easily between my aquarium and my fish bowl (serves as an isolation tank when the fish are sick). I don't know if the problem was with the air pump or this kit but I had to crimp the tubes in order for the air to circulate in all of the "slots" .. or else it would just go to one tube and not to everything else.

I just bought this locally (Nov. 2012) because it offered 12 feeding perches and perhaps some squirrel resistance. I think the screen will limit gnawing if a squirrel does come aboard, but my feeder location doesn't have much trouble with squirrels.I'm more concerned about the central, plastic tube. It is made of three sections that fit together, overlapping maybe half an inch. Those friction-fit joints don't work reliably. My unit came with the tubes jammed together too far, and the central tube ended up bowed up against one side of the cage. I had to disassemble the whole thing and take several tries to put it back together to have it all look straight. I suppose it was assembled wrong at the factory, or else jammed in transit.I fear the plastic central tube may not stay where it should.Updated Jan. 2013: The good news: I watched squirrels climb around the cage and have trouble taking any seed.The bad news: This proved to be the least popular of my three feeders serving hulled sunflower seed. We have various goldfinches and larger finches (house, purple), in San Jose, California. They seemed to find it hard or unpleasant to reach far enough to take seed. Rain wet the seed through the ports and by collecting into the bottom pan. The seed grew mold, stuck together, and grew even more mold. We have a plastic-disk (frisbee-like) shield over each feeder, but this feeder had by far the most trouble with rain water.So, I've downgraded my rating and removed the feeder to try another one.

My golden lab loves this squeaky ball. She likes the sound it makes while it is going through the air and each time it bounces. If your dog opens it up there is stuffing inside that needs to be thrown away. It is hard to chew open.

Both my little ones loved this item. They started scratching it immediately. I have tried to buy scratching posts, etc. and they have not liked them but this they seem to like. Would buy it again for sure.

I received the Cat Genie. It had some operational issues, but the company is very easy to talk to and we were able to get it up and running. The problem is it's been a month and the cats won't use it. I have worked with the company to use all the tricks to make the cats use it, and they won't. Maybe you can't teach old cats new tricks! If they would this machine is slick and you truly would never have to scoop cat litter again! But it is too expensive to have just sitting there unused by the cats. Also if you buy this item at Amazon, you only have 30 days to return it. I may have been able to get the cats to use it if I had had more time. If you buy directly from Cat Genie, it will cost you more, but you have a full 90 days to work with. So keep that in mind when deciding where to buy it!

It was time to get a new bed for our Aussie-mix best friend, Bodhi. We did a lot of research to that end because he was going to lose his stinky worn out bed and we wanted him to accept a new one without problems. We settled on this bed and are so very pleased with it. Bodhi absolutely loves his new bed. He took to it right away and gets into the most comical positions we've seen yet! We were so very pleased with the immediate delivery and the price. Thank you very much for having this bed as a selection to choose from.Rick ThrasherCalifornia

Our dog is not a chronic barker. She barks primarily at doorbells, door knocks, and other sounds similar to doorbells and door knocks. Hopefully if our apartment is ever broken into, the thief will ring the doorbell first.The collar functions as advertised, and for about a month it worked fairly well on my dog. We'd put it on a few minutes prior to the arrival of a friend, she'd bark one or two times when they arrived and then would quickly stop.Then she just started ignoring it and barked through the spray. Now she still barks up a storm and our apartment smells strongly of citronella. Visitors think we've been cleaning with Lemon Pledge.I can't fault the collar for not working on my dog. It seems to work well on other people's dogs (or at least they didn't wait very long before they posted their reviews).I have two complaints:* Rarely it goes off for no apparent reason. I've seen my dog just lying around doing nothing and the collar will go off.* The refills are expensive.We're going to try a shock collar next.

We got this for our 6 month old Great Dane puppy for Christmas. He absolutely loves it, especially since it squeaks. However, I should have paid attention to the reviewer who said to put it away after you play fetch and not to let the dog chew on it. Rocky chewed on it for about 20 minutes and worked the cover loose from the end. He's not a very aggressive chewer, either. We'll glue it back on and continue to play fetch with it, but he won't be allowed to chew on it anymore.
I like this product. It doesn't lather very well, so I have to use a lot and I only have a small Yorkie, but most conditioners don't lather like shampoo does. Other than that I love it.

The unit appeared to work in silent mode initially. However, either the neighbor's dog got used to it or it never really worked. In audible mode, however, the unit worked wonderfully. Not only did the neighbor's dog stop, but also went away from the area. Of course, the dog's owners may not appreciate you using the unit on their pet. But if they are inconsiderate neighbors to start with, then this will work.
This is my second one..I love this bowl for all my vehicles! It never spills and is a great bowl!

Have used this product over the last 4-5 months on our 18 month old golden...who came to us with very thin fur and skin that wasnt so good, and omg she lost so much hair, we had to vaccum at least twice a day...now she is growing a beautiful golden coat, her skin is completely normal. I would recommend to anyone....

I've been using Soft Claws for about three years now. They are little blunted caps that you fill with glue and put over your cat's front claws. When all 10 front claws are covered, they do a great job: the caps are blunt enough that when the cat tries to scratch the carpet or furniture, their claws just slide over the surface without doing any damage.They are expensive and high maintenance. I could imagine it being very challenging to apply Soft Claws to a cat who really hates having their claws messed with. After three years of practice, my cat and I have reached an understanding so that I can usually do up to three at a time without getting bitten, but I don't look forward to it. The "thumb" claws are the hardest ones for me to do, for some reason. The glue is like Super Glue and if you get it on your hands, which you probably will at some point, it stays there. The caps stay on for a couple of weeks; I usually have to replace 2 or 3 of them twice a week. My cat does pull at them with her teeth, but she can't pull them off and I don't think her pulling accelerates their falling off. You do have to keep up with replacing them, because even one sharp uncovered claw and they can scratch again.If you can train your cat not to scratch your furniture, that would be way easier than using Soft Claws. I wasn't able to train my cat to do that, and Soft Claws are the best option I've found -- good enough that I keep using them.

The material used for this protective mat is very good. However the mat itself is very small. It is barely wide enough to cover the cargo floor of my HHR, and is too short to attach over the front seats. It does stay in place with the clips on the front. It would be better if I could use it in just the very rear cargo area with the two back seats in the upright position but then my two dogs would not fit in the cargo area. Although the mat is as described it would be more useful if it were larger.

Got this to replace the tennis ball my dog normally swims after and my dog hates this toy! Won't put it in her mouth in the house and not at all interested in swimming after it even though she loves the water. I don't know if the material tastes weird in her mouth? Total waste of money. Also - this Seller needs to improve their product detail page to give the buyer the option of selecting whatever color they want. Not all of these show up well in the water.
Our cat loves this stuff and devours it. He also hasn't coughed up a hairball in a bit, so apparently it's working.

After hearing from a groomer and then reading reviews of this product, I decided to purchase one for use on our golden retriever. Brushes do not compare to this tool. It gets the undercoat that brushes cannot. I try to brush our dog out at least once a week, and when I do, the amount of hair that the "Furminator" is removing is absolutely amazing!! I am pulling half of a plastic grocery bag of fur off of her...how mislead I was when I was only cleaning out our dog brush three times per brushing!!! While she still sheds, the "Furminator" has assisted with the amount of dog hair I am cleaning up off of the floor and around her crate.

I just bought my second one of these, having owned the last one for 18 months.The only reason I bought this model again is the original flap was broken to the extent that the door would not stay in place and we had a hole where a door once sat. I needed a quick fix. I intend to buy a better model when my work schedule permits me to fit a different style door.The Cons:The tunnel that connects the inner and outer doors doe not attached securely, it clips together very loosely and can fall out.The tunnel attaches on the inside, and protrudes on the outside; it is not secured between the two sides. From the outside, with very little force, you can slide the tunnel out.The door flap is held in place by two very flimsy pins.The lock is easily defeated by a determined cat; one of our cats just bats its paws against it until it opens.The Pros:It comes with 3 different length sets of screws to accommodate different door thicknesses.

I bought two of these for my kids hamsters and the one hamster does great climbing and doing everything the cage is for. The other hamster fell off the top when she started sliding and refused to go up again so now the cage is in the basement.Its also not as easy to get to your hamster since if she is in the tank you can't just open the top and reach in unless you have super long arms so you must remove the entire top which for a kid can be tough. I worry that they will not hook it right and it will get knocked off and the cats will have lunch.Often the hamster food ends up all over the place too since its set in the top part and if you are not completly steady it spills.

This water bottle holds only a small amount of water and is a hassle to use. The bottle must be positioned perfectly so that it will dispense water, and if you manage to do this the water only trickles out. On the rare occasion that I use this product I just unscrew the cap and fill the tray. I do not recommend this product.

I bought this for my very large American Bulldog because he loves anything with a squeaker in it. He immediately took out all the squeakers and played with all of them. I never thought in a million years this could be harmful. The next morning, I woke up to hearing him throw up. I went and checked on him and sure enough, he had thrown up an ENTIRE egg. I had no idea that he could even swallow something that large! Luckily he threw it up and didn't choke on it. I immediately had to throw the toy away. I have definitely learned my lesson with giving him small chew toys. I just wanted to warn anyone with larger dogs to make sure they watch their dog the entire time they are playing with this toy and if you are not able to then you probably should not purchase this toy.

About 1/4 - 1/3 of each box has chew blocks that are too big for our Blue Front Amazon to hold onto while chewing, and he just ignores them. They would be more suitable for a Mccaw, I feel. We end up throwing them away, making the overall cost higher.

I also ended up throwing it out cause it's too hard, which makes it an ankle breaker at night if you should happen to step on it. Nice idea, but my cats gave this one a 3 out of 5, and my fear of stepping on it at night gave it less than that.
this is a beautiful sweater but runs super large. Had to return it because of the size, waiting to hear about the return credit.

Time will tell how well this works on Bubba's teeth. Just thought I'd share how I got him to eat them, since he wouldn't at first try.He ignored it when it was whole. So I cut it in half, and then dribbled a teeny bit of tuna fish on it. Then I left the room. When I came back, he ate the whole thing.Next day, I cut it in half and just smeared a teensy bit of his canned food on it. Then I left the room. When I came back he again had eaten the whole thing.So, you might try this method if you didn't have luck at first. I really want him to munch on these, 'cause I've heard good things about what they can do for his 9 year old teeth.I'm gonna continue with this, gradually cutting out the "treats" smeared on top. And then if I can get him to eat it cut in half, I'll eventually try to get him to eat it whole.
my picky bird will only eat these if they are chopped into small pieces. Excellent product, excellent service--just a picky bird.

This does what it's suppose to, it's not pretty but blends pretty well with my seats.When I opened the package the cover has a definite odor to it. Had to FeBreeze my car. Keep in mind that you have to wash it in a commercial dryer and air dry. Also, you need to have actual headrests in your backseat to wrap the top of it behind. Wow, these have no light at all and as another reviewer said it makes my tank look maroon and gloomy. Not the "glo" I was hoping for!! Do not buy!!

I was not aware this item was hard disk based on the description, and remained hard after heating. I'm sure it would work well for others, but my cat was suspicious of his bed anytime I had it under his cushion. Unfortunately, it added too much bulk, like a mound due to the small size. I never used the cover it came with because my pet doesn't like anything that doesn't have a familiar feel or scent to it. I must say the disk does heat up well, and not too hot to touch, which is good. I'm looking for a softer heating pad that plugs into an outlet, and covers a wider area that won't put my kitty on a hill when he sleeps. Not sure how much luck I'll have, but I'm trying.

I purchased this item by mistake because I remembered the brand name incorrectly and was in a hurry when I ordered it. I was looking to re-order theDenta Clean Herbal Pet Tooth Pastewhich did a very good job and had a flavor the dogs loved.While our dogs love peanuts and peanut butter, both disliked this toothpaste despite it being peanut flavored. We also found it to be less effective; their teeth were more yellow and they developed bad breath more quickly in the few weeks that we used this product despite using electric toothbrushes with it. (They are used to electric toothbrushes so we know the toothpaste is the problem.)The tube is very small so it only lasted about 3 weeks for 2 dogs with nightly brushing. But I guess that was a good thing because we switched to a more effective product that the dogs like better (Denta Clean Tartar Control Tooth Paste for Dogs.)
Cats don't really like laying on it. Not as big as I expected.Also, picture makes it look much more padded than it actually is.

The brush is effective in removing fur, but it seems to irritate my cat's skin - no matter how gently I brush, he doesn't like it and will wriggle away. (The comb has sharp metal teeth.) So I can't use it unfortunately.
I had two of these and both have burnt out! They were not wet and no other issues were found. This happened in two different outlets. It's starting to make me suspcious.

We recently adopted a larger cat and needed to enlarge the door for the litter box access. This cat door was large enough for our new cat but doesn't appear to be cumbersome to the normal size cats. I needed to enlarge the door opening, and with the included template and clear instructions this was easy using a drill and a electric jig saw. Our door was hollow and this posed no problem as the door doesn't screw to the thin wood door, rather one half screws to the other half and sandwiches the door in between. I believe this is a better approach for a hollow door and is still fine for a solid door. The door is well made and looks good installed.
I would not trust this in a windy environment without an extra screw into the deck rail.

My cat Stache doesn't seem to care too much about these. I bought them to help him with dental health since I don't yet brush his teeth...but probably will start needing to. At first he was interested because these were different and he likes batting them off a table and watching them fall, but if he chews on it it's only the pieces of fabric that come out and not the actual mesh, so he isn't getting any dental help. Mainly, they just sit around my apartment unused. I may pick it up and throw it now and then and he will chase after it, but then forget about it one second later. I wouldn't buy these again.

realized it wasn't made for humans. It focuses a lot on sounds. It has a lot of dog barks inserted artifically, which I guess the dogs appreciate. I sat and watched it with 5 dogs on a rainy/stormy day. The Boxer looked at the screen occasionally. The Shih tzu with storm phobias stopped trembling and started to doze off during the ocean segment. I saw ears perk at different sounds from most. Since I can't ask them, I'm going to assume that it holds some interest for them. I think the training segments totally suck. I don't see how a dog can learn by hearing "sit....good dog" repeated for 10-15mins. I would think they would become numb to the words, if anything. I was ready to throw my shoe at the screen to make it stop.

This is our second Easy Walk Harness, bought 45 days ago. Our wheaten chewed up the first one - our "fault," I guess, as we'd left it on a counter where she got it, and she'd already chewed up two cloth-and-plastic collars. We should've known! The second one we "hid" from her behind a TV in the kitchen each time we took it off her (she cannot reach it there), but even so the nylon strap near the front metal attachment has begun to shred! I'm going to reinforce it with carpet thread stitching, but still - shouldn't the material have lasted a little longer? P.S. I wrote to the company and they are replacing it. I'll have to pay postage, however!

We need to order the Frontline TopSpot because our vet no longer carries this product--they only carry the Frontline Plus. I'm not sure why anyone would need the Plus product to control eggs, when the TopSpot product kills the host and therefore any eggs that would also be laid/hatch. Our dog has used TopSpot for years and has had no pest problem. In fact, we apply this product for the weight category BELOW our dog's weight and only do so every 6-8 weeks during flea/tick season. We are hesitant to apply this poison at a greater amount or frequency into our dog's bloodstream, but at the same time, topical products are not as reliable for pest control.When ordering this product online, I would like to guarantee its authenticity. I spoke to the Merial manufacturer, who said Amazon does not order the Merial Frontline products from them, and they do not sell directly to Amazon. With other supply issues on Amazon, it is impossible to find out exactly where/how Amazon is ordering this product. I would like to know where they are ordering this product so I can make a judgment on its safety and reliability. According to Merial, their U.S. manufactured Frontline products should have three things: 1) NO expiration date, 2) weight class of the animal in POUNDS on the front of the box, and 3) a lot number on the box that MATCHES the lot number on the vials.One of the Amazon reviewers said the lot number on the vials did not match the lot number on the box. This concerns me, and I am always afraid of getting a counterfeit product--especially one from China. I wish there was some way to guarantee the authenticity of this product on Amazon.

I bought this for my two male gerbils a few months ago when we first got them. They have already chewed the exercise wheel (unusable), one of the blue tunnels and both of the red platforms - one of them is missing a side and the blue tunnel can no longer stay attached. I will never buy another chewable cage for a gerbil again - I'll be buying a more practical glass aquarium ASAP....before they chew themselves free!

I give a 3-Star Rating to this product. It arrived and put to use on a 55 Gallon aquarium used for my snakes home. The appearance of this product is not as expected, it seems a little shoddy. It sagged slightly but the books hold it in place. I do like how it is a snug fit to my aquarium though.

I thought I was getting plants...I can't believe I paid all this money for seeds and a tablespoon of soil and a plastic dish...lesson learned read all the way to the bottom off the description no matter how much jibberish there is in between! Even the picture looks like live plants...
For my car, the seat cover does not have adequate fasteners/straps to keep it on the seat. I had to return it.
My keets love it. I see slow progress but its seems to be doing its job helping to keep their nails in check. They also rub their beaks to clean themselves after eating.

We made a bracket which fits over the storage area on the lower door. It allows the ramp to fit in at an angle so the dog can get in the car past the car door. I got the x-large, and it was still too small for my 82 pound dog. I have ordered several name tags from this store and I am very happy. Actually I use these as name tags for key chains for me and my family with a name and a phone number on it so our key chains are lost people can return it to us. The quality is very good and we are happy with them.

Although this is an attractive and sturdy collar, it is not one size fits all. I have it adjusted to its smallest setting, but it is still too big for my 73 pound dog. He has slipped out of it twice. did not control problemBut had carpet professionally cleaned @ this pointheard from veterinary in this area pets are becomming immune to some of these products like 'Siphotrol' in S.W. They attach to the pole like the da bird, but they are bigger. They weren't packaged with the labels like Da Bird either, just 12 attachments in a plastic bag. They work, but my cats love the ones that come with the Da Bird pole.

This product is not airtight. I use it to store cat food indoors so that factor is not as important for my use. The lid can easily be separated from the container while in the closed position. There is a seal where the lid and the container touch but you can lift the lid to stick your fingers in between the lid and the container the seal doesn't do much good.The small opening on the top is great for easier access to scoop cat food out. After reading the instructions and watching the DVD, I introduced it to my 18 month old Amstaff. I let him smell it, let it hang on his nose, etc. Once I saw/thought he was comfortable with it I fitted it on him as per the instructions and DVD. I immediately noticed his demeanor changed and he seemed to mellow out right away. Then he started the clawing at his nose and finally gave up once he saw that he couldn't take it off and that I wouldn't take it off for him. Then came the walk. Before, he would immediately pull with a traditional collar. As I set out for the walk he was walking alongside me, I was impressed. Once in our walking routine I started to notice and hear his heavy, and sometimes seemed labored, breathing. I started to get a bit concerned, but as the instruction stated, "Fit should be that you can just get one finger under the collar and it should look like a V", which is how I fitted it on my dog. As the walk got longer, he seemed to breathe even heavier. Then came the ultimate reaction from him that made me stop using it. He all of a sudden went into a "crocodile death roll" in protest. The leash was wrapped around his head as well as catching his right front leg into the loops. That made me decide that this wasn't what I need to use.I will say that this product seem to work as advertised, but in my case, it isn't the right training aid for my dog to teach him not to pull. I guess it is time to do more research for other alternatives.

Our kitten loves this toy. The only downfall is that the little mouse completely came off the orange stick within a week. He still loves playing with the balls and is pretty entertained but playing with the mouse was his favorite thing to do so he doesn't play with it as much.

My problem is with Amazon, when you receive a faulty cartridge that doesn't work, there is no way to return it or get a free replacement for it, you're just stuck with it. I received 2 cartridges recently and both were bad and there's no way to get a refund or replacement.

Even with the included extra head strap, it wouldn't stay in place. I ended up purchasing the original doggles and so far so good. I am feeding five kittens at present and offered them three different kitten foods and they prefer this. They are presently five weeks old and the babycat34 is an excellent and well thought out product. Product was shipped as promised. The packaging was excellent, from both Amazon and the manufacturer.The instructions are well written and easy to follow.Be prepared to make several fittings and adjustments. Be sure to read the instructions thoroughly for proper fit.My large dog likes to sniff a lot while walking, with his head low to the ground. I bought this to keep my Rottweilers out of the front seat of my Jeep GC. The Jeep has fold down seats, so I wanted to use it both behind the rear seat and behind the front seat when the rear seats are folded down.===The Good Points===* When I heard the rattles when the UPS guy delivered the box, I was waiting for disaster. However, after assembling the unit and trying it out, there are almost no rattles. The vertical poles use rubber grommets to minimize rattle, and the side wings are clamped on securely, at least so far.* Behind the back seat, the product almost works fine, subject to a few fixes. It slips in and out with no problem, and I can install or uninstall it in 2 minutes.* It is (usually) secure enough mounted behind the back seat to deter my dogs. No doubt they could push it over if they really tried, but they are more opportunists than dedicated escape artists.=== The Not-So-Good Points===* I was hoping to use the same gate when I fold down the rear seats. Here things were a bit more problematic. First, the base of the unit now sits on the folded seat back. While the seat back is a hard surface, it is sitting on top of the seat and seatback upholstery, which tends to compress. As a result, you have to keep tightening the gate so that it doesn't fall over. It takes about 30 min or so of tightening until the seat upholstery fully compresses. A length of 1x4 across the whole seat back spreads out the force and makes the problem a little more manageable.* The other problem with a hehind-the-front-seat installation is the gap between the bottom of the gate and the console between the front seats. It is just large enough to tempt a dog, and once they get underneath it, it falls over pretty easily (albeit with 90 pounds of canine muscle).I contacted the manufacturer, and they suggested adding thisGMI PetShield Bucket Seat Tubular Travel Barrier. Unfortunately the way my seats and center hump are on the Jeep, this really won't work. I plan on adding another piece of grating to the bottom of the existing grate, just enough to discourage nosy dogs.=== Things I Fixed===* The tension between the floor and ceiling is governed by how much you tighten two thumbscrews on threaded rods. The problem is that these will loosen as your car vibrates while traveling. My first solution was to add another nut below the thumbscrew to keep it snug. This sort of worked, although it would still work its way loose.The better solution was to put a small clamp on the thumbscrew that wedged itself next to the backseat. The clamp I used was one of the $1 cheapo plastic ones that are often on the checkout counter at Home Depot. The prevented the thumbscrew from turning.* The gate would also shake itself loose, no matter how tight I made the screws. The solution was to bungee the gate to the back seat headrests. It didn't have to be too tight, just enough to keep the gate from vibrating towards the front and back of the vehicle and working its way loose.* It is sometimes hard to really tighten the gate in place, because the threaded rod will rotate inside the sleeves/feet. So instead of tightening the thumbscrew, you end up just rotating the whole threaded rod, which doesn't tighten anything. Keeping a pair of channel-lock pliers handy fixes this problem.=== Summary ===I really had two applications in mind for this product- mounting behind the front seat and mounting behind the back seat. I'd call it a 2 star performer behind the front seat-it just doesn't seem to stay installed without being at least partially supported by the back seat. Mounting it behind the back seat-maybe a 3 or 3 1/2 star deal. It sort of works now, but definitely did not work the way it came out of the box.Overall I am disappointed, but it is just serviceable enough to keep.

This shelf is simple to install, ingenious,andinexpensive. However our cat, being a cat, hasnot accepted it yet. It is July 1 and the shelfcover is fur-like. It may too warm for her. Butwho knows with cats.We feel that she will like itas the weather turns cooler. This cat needs to seea shrink.

My review is not for the product, but for the seller - BUYER BEWARE!The product PHOTO shown above is for Bayer K9 Advantix II. The photo you'll see when you add this product to your cart is for K9 Advantix II. What you'll actually receive from the shipper is K9 Advantix, which Bayer stopped manufacturing in March of 2011. I contacted the seller, asking about the discrepancy and was told "The photo is NOT of K9 Advantix II, it is just the new packaging they have for the regular K9 Advantix", prompting me to contact Bayer directly, describing the packaging I received. Bayer actually stopped manufacturing K9 Advantix in March of 2011 and went to K9 Advantix II (pictured above). The difference is the newer product kills flea EGGS, while the original product does not. While I read the description of the product, the photo itself is PURPOSELY misleading and it was until I received the shipment and checked my purchase history, that the photo of the old product appeared.Since my concern is ticks, not fleas, and as there is no expiration date on the product, I will use it rather than go thru the hassle of returning and repurchasing. Bayer did say there was no harm in using it also. I simply feel the seller here is mis-leadng an their fOllow-up email proves it, as they are trying to claim new product packaging....I'll continue to purchase this product online - just NOT FROM THIS SELLER.
The cat comb is nicer to work with on my dog and cost less. I use them to pull loose deer ticks off a bird dog.

So I picked this stuff up at the pet store and brought it home. Tidy Cats wasn't doing it anymore with the addition of the second cat. After adding it, I sneezed for a few days. My eyes were puffy, and I kept leaving the house for air. I kept using it because the stuff is to expensive I didn't want to waste it! After a few days the scent died down and the litter did its thing. I couldn't smell a thing from the litter box. I'm not a scoop every day person. I scoop when I smell the box, which was usually about 2 or 3 days before. With this stuff, well. I'm almost embarrassed to say how long I went without scooping. I don't have a scoop schedule, so... when I started smelling it 10 or 14 days later I just went ahead and replaced all the litter. So I'm not saying you should forget to scoop for two weeks like I did, but if you go by the "when I can smell it" system, you might need to come up with a schedule! Only getting unscented from now on, which works just as well and doesn't leave my nose and eyes irritated.
love the look of this, goes great with my beach decor. but my crabs are not interested in eating this

I'm giving it 3 stars only because I've had crappy quality wee wee pads purchased online before.My current purchase was excellent. No irregular, bunched up, shredded pads this time.I would give a higher rating if the quality of the pads were consistently good with every order.

I got tired of feeding expensive birdseed to squirrels so I decided that I needed a squirrel-proof feeder. This works fine aganst the squirrels but the larger seeds don't get to sift out until all the small ones are gone. So cardinals don't come to the feeder until the sunflower seeds start appearing.

We took a Rubbermaid container and cut 1/2 the top off with a razor. We gorilla glued a catmat on the other 1/2 of the lid. It has worked great and was obviously cheaper! While I don't think $30 is bad for the convenience of ending "spillage", I was worried that our cat might not use it (like one reviewers) and we would have wasted our money!

Because these collars are round, they're reflective from every angle, which is great. And when I say "reflective", I mean reallyREALLY reflective, which is also great. The reflective tape is woven through the whole collar, and there's lots of it, so it really picks up the light when I'm out walking my dogs at night.I would've given them a perfect rating, except for the fact that the collars are a lot bigger than they're supposed to be. The size is stated as 19"-24", but even when it's buckled at the tightest notch, the collar is still a little over 27", which is so big that they can slide easily over the heads of my two 75-lb Golden Retrievers. So it's a great collar for night-safety purposes, but really bad for dog-restraint purposes.The collars so inexpensive that it didn't seem worth the trouble to return them, so when I take the dogs out at night, I just slip the reflective collars on along with their regular collars, kind of like a necklace rather than a dog collar, which actually works pretty well. So overall, I'd recommend the collars pretty highly - just order a size a lot smaller than you think you'll need, or plan to use it mainly as a decorative accessory.

We bought this cage about a year ago at a major pet retailer to house our two gerbils. It lasted almost exactly one year, and then on Saturday one of the gerbils chewed through one of the top plugs and made a cunning escape. Luckily we caught him later that day (which really surprised me) but we're off to buy a new, chew-proof cage. I actually didn't dislike this cage as much as most of the other reviewers, but there are some definite pros and cons:PROS:- It's a cute cage, with lots of space for 2 gerbils to live comfortably.- The top "handling area" is pretty nice - my childrens' gerbils love it, and often spend a lot of the day up there sleeping. It's often an easy way to corral them when I'm cleaning the cage - I just wait until they're up there and take the whole top unit out, block the exit, and leave them there until I'm done.- I personally don't think it's that hard to clean once you get the hang of it. My husband did break a tube the one time he cleaned it, but it was because he attempted to put in the tubing incorrectly. Once I figured out how to do it I could get the cage emptied and completely cleaned out and reassembled in 15 minutes.- The wire portion of the cage is very strong and well made - stronger than the other cages we're looking at now.- You can buy lots of accessories for this cage on Amazon and at major pet retailers.CONS:- I feel that the plastic absorbs some liquid waste and gets an odor after a while. I don't know if this is actually the case or not, but I've noticed a slight odor that doesn't go away after I clean the cage. I'm very sensitive to smells so it may be just my imagination.- The cage is chewable, hence the escape. It took my two gerbils a year to chew through, but they're my first rodent pets so others may chew through faster.- The bars start fairly low on the cage, so LOTS of litter gets thrown out of the cage. We use the Carefresh compressed paper litter, but I tried granular and it was a mess-fest. I have to use my hand-vac about every 2-3 days to clean up around the cage area.- There are lots of extra ports for accessories, so lots of areas to chew and eventually escape from.So all in all I didn't hate this cage, but I won't buy another one of this brand. We're switching to an aquarium tank-topper cage in the hopes that it solves some of our problems. I guess we'll see!
The title should explain this product effectiveness, it does not work. Used this product for a 7 week old puppy to stop chewing up a part of the carpet. Did not work.

I bought the large containers after reading the reviews about the small ones not holding 40 lb bags of food. I have 2 dogs that eat different kinds of food so I needed 2 containers and wanted stackable ones due to space constraints. I thought these would work great but they will not hold the weight of a full container stacked on top of them. Not only did the top of the lower container start buckling, but since I thought maybe I had them seated wrong and had my husband push out the buckled one and switch them, now both have buckled and neither one's lid will close properly so they are no longer airtight. If you are just buying one or will not be stacking them they will probably work great for you but if you are buying them for their stacking capabilities, look elsewhere.

I've had this pump for about 10 days and it's been running fine. I did a water change today in preparation for a vacation I'm taking this week. After changing the water I turned on the pump and it didn't work. It's a tight fit in my sump, so it's not easy getting it in/out. I got it out, checked it again in a bucket of water, and got nothing. I could hear and feel it humming, but no pumping. I dismantled it and checked it out. Being just 10 days old it was very clean. I reassembled it, and viola! It worked! I wedged back into my sump, started it up again, and nothing. Long story short, third time's a charm. It's working now, but for how long? Very unsettling. I guess you get what you pay for.

My wife is nervous about clipping our spaniels' nails and bought this at petco today. These reviews are consistent... the red light stays on, even when you can clearly see that it's in a safe zone (I'm actually good at nail clipping and would never have bought this thing.) And, true to other comments, it's not sharp enough to actually function as a clipper, even if you know what you are doing without the lights working.Don't waste your money. Instead, find a clear nail with the quick easily visible, get some good quality clippers (read: sharp!) and start slowly from back to front, preferably with the blade away from the dogs foot. Slowly shave off a miniscule amount of the harder nail tip; like shaving parmesan cheese. Once you get a thin slice off, you can slowly take more thin slices. Don't overdo it. As you begin to clip more regularly, the quick will withdraw back into a shorter nail over time. Then, match the amount you've shaved with the amount you would take off the darker, opaque nails.It's also helpful if the nails are a little soft, like after a bath. If you don't overdo it, your dog will get used to it. If you go too far and hurt them, they will have a tough time letting you do it again.

I have a lab puppy that is starting to put on too much weight. No surprise there. I thought some search for food toys would work well. I have about three different ones now and a couple more treat toys. He will barely touch this. He loves rubber and the hard plastic seems to bother him. He is smart and can get some of the food out but then gets frustrated and walks off. He is extremely food driven so this was a huge surprise to me. It sits on the floor with food in it and he will just walk by. I have another hard plastic food dispenser that has similar results with him. He is also an aggressive chewer so I figured he would just chew the rope off. But he doesn't even do that. Know your dogs preferences when purchasing these types of food toys.

She insists on drinking out of the tub and won't touch this water fountain. As a product - it's great - works well, is virtually silent (until runs low on water), and circulates the water seeming to cool it as well. If only my cat would use it instead of preferring the tub.
I had high expectations for this product based upon reviews. The item was nice but my kitten could care less about it and I guess kittens are like humans (everyone is different).

I had purchased this Khaki Classic Cratewear set years ago from a local pet store and it was great! This is a must if you have your crate inside it provides a den like place for your dog to relax in and it looks nice. This fabric washes well so if you have the need to clean it don't worry follow instructions. After checking the pet stores in the area I was unable to locate this Cratewear until I checked on Amazon and found it not only in the size I needed but it cost about $30.00 less!

Awesome little snack treat for your favorite pup/dog. My two pekeingese just love these. You can use them for training as well as just a treat. They come in a variety of flavors. My pups like the liver the best. For senior dogs, these are perfect if they don't have the "jaw" power or teeth use anymore. They are easy to carry so you can treat your dog whenever you want to for example on a walk around the neighborhood. They are just 3 calories each so you don't have to worry about their weight. Absolutely recommend these to every dog owner!

I just received my Cat Genie three days ago, and I already love it! I have two cats that are 5 and 6 years old. The younger one took to it immediately and, let me tell you, there is nothing comparable to not having to scoop poop! My other cat hasn't used it yet but is very curious. He smells it every time he needs to go and then goes in his old box. But it's only been set up for two days, so I am still optimistic. And I love the sanitizing solution. It makes my whole house smell clean. So not only have I gotten rid of the smelly, dusty clay litter, but my house smells even cleaner without any effort from me! I have had none of the problems that were reported in earlier reviews, but it sounds like those were solved by the company already. I highly recommend this product if you never want to scoop poop again!

This product is good with a couple exceptions. The metal content was minmal with a large amount of plastic.After installing through brick wall, there was a six inch gap that had to be filled in, and the door wasn'tas easy to install as stated. All in all, the door works fine with modifications.
For my 20 year old Stinkpot Musk turtles, this is a very economical size! ANd I don't have any more words as required...it's turtle food for heaven sakes!

I have a tiny Yorkie and I keep his hair cut fairly short, so he needs a coat during the winter! This coat is easy to get on and off with the snaps and it fits him great. The best part is that it is cut high on the belly so he doesn't pee on it!

I have an Italian Greyhound that likes to find the seam in a carpet and pull it so she unravels the carpet. I got this hoping I could spray areas and she would leave it alone. I have light colored carpet and I didn't want to have to put chili pepper all over. Well she didn't like the smell in the bottle so I thought that was promising but when I sprayed it she didn't care and kept pulling at the carpet. When you read the bottle is sounds more like it is to keep them from licking them selves.
My puppy swings between fear of this toy when it rolls on the wood floor (it's a bit noisy) and disinterest. I'm really hoping when she gets older she'll like it, b/c it's not a cheap toy.

This toy is huge. My cat is 16 pounds and this is so much bigger than him. It takes up a good amount of space for being a cat toy. Some of the toys are too high up. He only played with the ones that hang down lower. I threw it away after a week. The Panic Mouse is a much better interactive cat toy.

It does what it is suppose to, stop my dog from picking at her stitches. I bought two different types of E-collars, this one and the Kong Cloud. I prefered the Kong Cloud over the classic E-collar, so did my dog.

I put my 4 gerbils in this playpen (actually ordered two to make it bigger) with newspaper under it and left to go clean their cage. When I walked in again after, I saw one of them running around on the floor- thank goodness the other 3 were still in there and I had the door closed, otherwise by-by gerbils; and we have a cat. I was impressed at how large the playpen was ( I could lay down in the two playpens attached and still have about a foot of open space.) ( I am about 5'6"), but the playpens are very short. A guinea pig is shown on the cover of the box in the playpen, but on the back it says the playpen is suitable for gerbils and hamsters...how does this work? No way would I put gerbils/hamsters in it unattended let alone guinea pigs, because normal adult guinea pigs can stand up taller than the playpen. The only way I would purchase this is if I had dwarf hamsters. The bars seem close enough together nd they wouldn't be abl to climb it. Now I have to return it.

After reading some of the other reviews I decided to try this product on some urine stains that I had discovered after they had been dried for several weeks. I totally saturated the stains and let the product set overnight and then blotted them up. I was disappointed to find that I could still smell a faint urine smell. And if I could then I KNOW my dog could. Perhaps it works well on fresh puddles that you can blot up and then treat, but it is no cure-all for old stains.
The cord is soft and pliable. Maybe a little too thick to get up in the right place on my small dog, but it is an easy leash to use.

I needed something to hang my Zoo Med combo lamp fixture from. This looked good on the site but in reality it's not as well made as it could be. I'm sure it would be fine for a single lamp but it's hard to keep the lamp balanced. It was very easy to set up although I wish the bottom platform had a way to attach to the tank. It just sets under the tank and I have my tank set up on small feet as I have a heating pad underneath for the winter time as well.
Nice dog bed, zip off cover would be a nice feature to have and this one does not.

With no bottom connecting the sides, the Scoop Free unit is essentially a rectangular frame. The disposable litter pan fits in the center of the frame and rests on the floor. If the unit is not on a level surface, the disposable pan does not fit properly in the frame: the rake (or part of the rake) either gets stuck in or moves over the top of the litter. I did not have this problem with my Litter Maid - Litter Maids have their own bottoms, so there are no fitment issues. I like the premise of the Scoop Free unit. I wish that the Scoop Free had a solid bottom and that the disposable pan were placed on top of it. The solid bottom would make the unit rigid enough to be used on unlevel surfaces. It would also protect floors in the event that the litter pan became saturated. .

On paper, this is a great invention. No more daily litter clean up, right? Wrong. The rake thing is constantly getting stuck, and inevitably it's in the middle of the night, so we have to get up and get it unstuck. My cats don't like the noise it makes, and I think they've gotten scared of it, since one of them has started to poop just outside of the box, and the other one started to pee on the bathroom rug (he's 5 years old, and has never had a problem before). So I switched back to my old litter box, and the litter problems have gone away. I still have the littermaid, but neither of my cats will step one paw in it. Plus, Littermaid insists you use their brand of litter, and I think it's one of the worst clumping litters I've ever used. It has NO odor control, so I'm almost glad my cats have stopped using it.

I was a groomer for 4 yrs before I became a stay-at-home-mom. I still have a few family dogs (and my husband) that i give haricuts to. I needed another 7 blade and so I bought this one. I went to shave my husbands head and this blade left so many uncut hairs I was afraid I had put on an old blade accidentally. It was the brand new one and it did a terrible job of evenly cutting my husbands hair. I did keep it for a labradoodle I groom just as the beginning blade to us to get the majority off but I was not pleased in the overall clipping of this blade.

After reading many reviews of this litter box, I knew not to expect a miracle product. The LitterMaid meets my expectations in that it does what it says it will do, but there are some little glitches occasionally. I do wish it waited longer than 10 miutes before cleaning because I think that would give more time for "clumping". [I do use premium litter]. Sometimes the litter clumps stick to the rake and need to be pushed off with the hand scooper. I find that it works best for me to use a conventional litter box also. I have two cats, and at least the LitterMaid cuts down considerably on how often I have to scoop! It's a decent product; just don't expect perfection. UPDATE 7/9/07 [original review in May]: I finally figured out what llitter works the best: It's Arm & Hammer High Performance- natural and light weight! Try it.

With 5 hunting dogs, what a hassle it has been for years to remove those damn ticks. Some you can't feel right away & some you can. 50-50 chance of removing the whole ugly tick. When that head stays attached what a bugger it is to remove. Our dogs were, to say the least, very uncomfortable with us using those sharp tweezers to get the head out.Not to mention how it hurt to remove those ticks from us as well. Try to pull a tick from a kids stomach with that sharp metal point. See what kind of reaction you will get. With all the tick diseases out now it is very important to remove them quickly. We tried all the methods we got from our families and friends who swore these worked - soap on a cotton ball & let it soak, alcohol on a cotton ball & let it soak, even lighter fluid on a cotton ball. These manner of removal were not accurate. Nothing seemed to work all the time then....................Along comes this spoon. Well, what a lifesaver. Works EXACTLY as it states. Used it on all our animals and ourselves as well. No muss, no fuss. Works every single time. It really does. Simply. Cost effective too. This is much cheaper than going to the emergency room to have a doctor remove the head. Eww.Trust me. Our dogs do. So do the kids.

Product is nice but would have been much better if they had also included a method to clamp it down on aquariums with no ledges or light with indentation to set it on. We have a similar gate that is about eight years old. We like the new one, but we've had a little trouble getting it to stay in place. Sometimes, it loosens up and moves its position on the wooden molding. It is, however, a fantastic improvement over the old standing gate. I bought one of these, and it works great! HOWEVER, the unit developed a leak, and won't hold the spray. My neighbor, a vet, is also impressed, but has had a similar experience with the units breaking.Be sure to get a good warranty; 30 days doesn't cut it.

OK, so I saw this after searching for something to quiet the neighbor dog's incessant barking at all hours of the night and it seemed like a great idea. However, it seems to suffer from mixed reviews and I suspect that it's because it is such a small and under-powered device. Imagine trying to annoy your neighbors by cranking up a small handheld radio. It just doesn't quite cut it. The thing is probably like a gnat in the dog's ear, so it may get the idea or it may not.So I considered other possibilities and discovered what I feel is a better idea: download a free tone generator app for your phone/iPad/computer and hook up the audio out to a real stereo. Then string a speaker just outside the door aimed at the neighbor's house. When the dog barks, blast the tone at high volume (the 16kHz - 17 kHz range worked best for me, but YMMV). The app lets you dial in a frequency from 1Hz to 20 kHz and just play it (note that you wont hear anything above about 14 kHz, but the dog still will ). The app i found was called Simple Sine in the Apple store, but there are a few other free ones as well ... search for tone generator. Anyway, it's worked wonders for me. I'm guessing this thing sounds more like a freight train than a gnat in the ear. I started out thinking I'd have to do this for weeks to get real results, but after one day of playing it when it barks, the dog which used to bark practically all day and night is now quiet as a mouse. I seriously haven't heard a peep out of it for two whole days.Anyway, like I said ... this thing seems like a great idea, but thought I'd offer another suggestion for those who may have a bigger problem that this doesn't handle. Also note that if you go this route, only do it while the dog is barking. The idea is to train the dog and not just be cruel and annoy/confuse it. Hope this helps someone.

I was very pleased to find this cleverly designed pond-deicer on Amazon. We installed it in the late fall, before the temperatures had dropped. So it was sitting there for a while before we knew whether or not it would work. When the temperatures finally did drop, the thermostat failed to kick in -- tried unplugging and replugging, checked circuit breaker. It simply didn't work. We returned it for a credit. Don't buy this product.
I dont if it works because my dog still scratch and whenever i spray it on he roll like crazy lol it seems like he doesnt like the herbal scent, but I hope it'll help him from itchiness
This product is a scam. I applied the product exactly they way it instructed me to, and even exaggerated in the quantity. The following two days, dogs were doing their thing as usual.
Tried the reg. size 1st, it was too small, & my cats are not very big. This "large" size is perfect. & the brown goes much better w/ my door than white.
I had high hopes for this product, but was frustrated when it didn't hold tight and fell repeatedly against the strength of my danes.

The Drinkwell original fountain gives me confidence that my cats' water is always fresh and clean. They took to it immediately not being afraid of the new (soothing) sound. It's easy to disassemble for cleaning and the filter can be changed in a snap.

The product works WELL as advertised; however, to insert a replacement sticky disk into the flea trap you must peel the backing off the sticky disk. I have had much difficulty peeling some disks. In some instances I couldn't get the backing off the sticky disk at all. In total I have had 4 NG disks and returned 3 disks. 4 out of 40 in total is not acceptable.
I have two cats and one is a very large Maine Coon. Best Litter box ever, she can get her big ole but in this one.Thanks

My 25 lb. cocker/eskimo had this toy shredded in less than a day. Granted, she does tend to chew her toys up, but I wrongly assumed from the other reviews that this one just might last....not so!!! If your dog tends to chew up toys, this is not the toy for you!

Hello, plenty of people have reviewed this positively and I agree with all of them. I ended up getting one of the slightly noisy ones when I started it up (vibrating and stuff). I read some other solutions where they said to take off the motor, pull out the impeller and generously lubricate the shaft. I was worried at first because it sounded complicated since I'm not mechanically savvy, but it literally took less than a minute to do (the motor has a half twist to pop it off and then the impellar can just be pulled right off the shaft to reveal it). I did that and it worked like wonders. It's now a very quiet hum and has been like that for the past week (I've only had my tank for a week, I'm a newby to this). I used petroleum jelly to lubricate mine. I've read that it's biosafe. Another option is silicon lube. They say silicon lube is better because petroleum jelly can degrade certain kinds of rubbers (like latex condoms). Still I've read of people using petroleum jelly for years on their filters with no problem, and it was the only thing I had so I'm fine using it.
I'm not sure exactly what I was expecting, but I know this wasn't it. My dog can't play with it because it is way too big and the throwing device doesn't work any better than my own arm.

It does the job but it's certainly not the best scoop on the market. It's so poorly made that when you bring both together to pick it up they dont line up. Then the metal is so thin that if you hit the ground the tines will bend.

Since my new kitten Meesa loves to run outside the minute we open the door, I felt she was adventurous enough to venture outside in a stroller. She also cries when I leave her alone and so the only solution seems to be to take her with me when I leave the house to go walking or to go get the mail.Both cats were very curious about this new object as it sat in the living room. I pretended it didn't exist for a few days and then started to put each cat in the stroller and left the zipper panel open so they could get in and out and not feel trapped. Once you go outside you will appreciate the safety the zipper panel provides. Your cat will be spared the inconvenience of being chased by dogs, that type of thing.So, after a few days, Meesa was ready to go outside. Since she was used to the stroller, she felt safe. I put her mouse toy in the stroller and lined the base with a soft towel. We then ventured out to get the mail. She was in bliss. Not only could she view everything from the safety of her mesh viewing window, she could also see me through the top opening and see out the sides. So, no matter if she was sitting, laying down or looking back at me, she felt safe.My main concern was that being in a stroller would cause her too much stress. I know how cats seem to dislike suddenly being put in new environments. It seems Meesa is rather adventurous.The Happy Trails Pet Stroller Features: Shock absorbers in the front wheels, 4 Pet viewing windows, Front Entry with Zipper, Waterproof Material, Top opening to view pet and a One-Hand Fold Mechanism for folding the stroller easily in half.If you are taking the stroller with you on a trip, it will store flat. Unfolds again in an instant. You will also enjoy the Ergonomic handle.Other features for your convenience:Parent-Tray for water/keys, leash, etc.Waterproof tray on the inside base of stroller - can be removed for cleaningLarge storage basket - You could use this for going on a picnic and taking lunch if you are heading to a park. Also useful if walking down to the mailbox or for carrying around cat toys or other kitten luxuries.The only thing I was worried about when I ordered this stroller was the handlebar. I wasn't sure if it was expandable. This might be an issue if you are very tall or want to stand further back from the stroller. I found I could easily push the stroller from the side while walking or walk behind the stroller without any problem. They could improve this item by allowing the user to adjust the handle bar position and length.Assembly: To assemble this item all you do is take the stroller out of the box and then you attach the wheels. Now, if only the instructions matched what is in the box. Fortunately it was easy enough to figure out, although I do think they need to update assembly instructions for the wheels immediately if not sooner. It seems they updated the design, but are still using an older pamphlet. I did not find a collet or a collet cover, but another metal "hair-pin-like" object that fastened the wheel onto the axle very easily. Like putting a hairpin through a metal bar with a hole in it. So, that was easy enough.Once you get the wheels on, there is a tiny hubcap. Once the rear wheels are attached to the rear axle, you just slide the rear axle onto the frame until it clicks and locks. The front wheels are already assembled and all you have to do is basically remove the covers and press the wheels onto the front of the frame base. Assembly took me about 10 minutes max.Suitable for pets up to 33 lbs - cats and dogs or I'd imagine other pets who love to get out of the house now and then.Very lightweight - easy to push with one hand8" wheels - Perfect on rugged terrain and the shock absorbers make the ridemore comfortable.Fully lined canopy made from 600 Denier waterproof material - walk rain or shine.Easy to store, fold or take with you when you travelReplaceable parts - See the website for customer service.To minimize wear and tear, they suggest you keep all moving parts in the wheels lubricated with WD40, but they make a note about not lubricating the brake components or swivel locks.For Pets Only - perfect for older pets, new kittens, puppies, small dogs and other small animals.My new kitten and I love this stroller and I think you will enjoy this product. Now I look forward to going outside for more walks because I don't have to worry about Meesa getting lonely. She likes to be within 4 feet of wherever I am these days and follow me around like a puppy. She is currently sleeping on the desk in her comfy kitten bed. Eventually I'll train Meesa to deal with a leash so she can get out of the stroller when we arrive at our destination.Most pleased with this purchase!~The Rebecca Review

my Eclipse Hex 5 is my favorite as I also have the 5 gallon corner Eclipse, the 12 gallon and another Hex, but there is no feeding door like the Hex and I like to let my gases excape also through that door and no contaminate seem to get in.. but the 12, 6, 5 corner and the 3 .. do not have this little extra that I like. After using a different system on my first try, I ended up with all dead fish and a soured tank. I will buy nothing else than the Marineland's tanks with the bio wheel. My tanks stay crystal clear and they are all easy to clean, vacume, and admire. Only big problem I am dealing with is the 12 gallon as the filter is not sized right and my water just runs over the top and back out without the cleaning that is so excellent in my other smaller Eclipes ..3 others. So what I did is buy a reasuable nylon bag .. add extra media .. as I had never had problems with amonia until the 12 .. so I added ammo lock with carbon into the bag, put on the bottom and now it seems .. still not sure as I just did this yesterday after getting bad readings .. but it looks like the filter is up highter and catching the icky stuff like the Hex. My hex has never had a bad reading so I know it is a great filtration system for this beginner.
Not big and bulky,cleans effectively, easy to clean, yet Very Noisy,constant rattling and running water sound.I have other filters alot quietier.

This is a review for the Clevercat Top Entry Litter Box Liners - not the litter box. I like the box, but the liners are nothing special. I bought these thinking I needed them because they are specially sized. Unfortunately they don't stand up to extensive scratching and are easily torn.I was pre-lining the litter box with heavy duty garbage bags because these liners were always shredded when it came time to change out the box. Now I just double line with heavy duty garbage bags and skip the Clevercat liners all together. I have found this to not only be less expensive, but also more effective as the cats don't always completely shred the first layer of bag anymore since the garbage bags I am using are much stronger.Get the box, don't buy the bags. You don't need them.

I have noticed after reading a score of reviews, that most of them pertain to training their own dogs. Not about curbing the offensive barking of neighbor's dogs. Something to consider. I am looking for a product to use on our next door neighbor's Psycho Dog, otherwise known as "Buck". (I think they got the wrong consonant at the start of the name, ha!).

hmm where do i start with this one. BE CAREFUL. This is not a life jacket, like for people. I have chihuahua's and they arent the best of swimmers. i had one of my dogs get turned upside down for a second in one and he freaked of course and paniced. we had to grab him. it needs more boyancy on the chest to keep thier head up. the dog does not realize he will stay afloat. so they swim thier little hearts out and can exhauset themselves and can go under with this vest. just enough to drown. i bought the same version locally. little dogs arent meant for water-they do not have the boyancy like a big dog and cant take tides-surf-currents-rapids-swells- etc.....So dont think this will keep your dog up long time- it will for long enough to grab them (thank god) and buys you the time to turn around in boat or backup. i had one jump off poontoon boat without one and i ran grabbed her skin to save her while the boat was running (split second timing) so thats why i bought one.i am an avid boater/dive instructor and breed chihuahua's. now if they only made a dive outfit -lol
This stuff is really expensive and didn't seem to make much of a difference for my cat. I know it's gotten a lot of great reviews, which is why I'm a little disappointed and only giving it a 3.

I have three cats, and this grooming tool works well on all of them. It works especially well on the one who sheds the most. I was really shocked at how much hair this got off of my cats. I am trying to use it more often to get them accustomed to it, as none of them really like being brushed in general. In just a few brush strokes (often, the most I can get in a sitting) yields a good handful of hair, mostly undercoat. One evening when my heaviest shedder was being particularly cooperative, I got a softball-sized ball of hair off of him, and I could pet him without getting covered in hair for about a week or two. I definitely recommend this grooming tool. There is a clear reduction in the amount of shedding and hair on my furniture, carpets, clothes, etc. None of my kitties had hairball issues (probably from the kind of food I give them), but I expect if your kitty is plagued with hairballs, this would help with them too.

This product allowed me to take my cat off of her steroid medication. I never thought my cat would see relief from her skin condition, mainly caused my allergies. She was on a special diet, needed medication daily, blood tests every six months, this was all vey costly. This product eliminated the medication and blood tests, not only offering her scatching relief, but my pocket relief!

This product warms quickly. However, the issue I had was finding a blanket that was still comfy to lay on and where the heat could still be felt. This is difficult..therefore, it's now stored in the closet.

Our girl Fiona Dorothy has been taking one capsule every night for the past couple of years. The vet charges an arm and a leg for these things, and I was very happy to find them here. Although the capsules are largish, they are easy enough to give to her, and that way we know exactly how much she's getting.
pretty good... but overpriced! You can buy a cheaper one and see the same thing... these are my five more words.

The biggest problem is this four sided unit tends too lean into a diamond shape when my dog leans against it. I also agree with another persons comment that it needs a top cover, as stated the dog can just climb right out which my dog does.

I love the Ethical stoneware products! We have other items. They're a great sizeand they wash up easily. Plus, they have a great weight so they don't endup pushed around the floor. The designs are adorable so - we think they're 'Paw-fection!"
I think this product is far more economical than the brand I used before. But the three Koi in my pond do not eat it as quickly.

I purchased this collar for my 50lb Lab. Since the description said it was for a <40lb dog I purchased it thinking it would run a little big. Turned out that I was too right. I have the collar as tight as it will go and it still only makes contact with her neck 40% of the time. She barks right outside my window every night and when it does hit she is quiet the remaining duration of the night. I recommend changing the description to size of neck range along with weight of dog.

We purchased one of these cages before we started raising dwarf hamsters extensively. It was difficult to clean and would come apart everywhere and have to be pieced back together every time. A couple pieces broke too soon and too easily. We did not use the water bottle - it is hard to see the water level and I am not sure they get enough water using it. It is also hard to get a hamster out to play. We quit using this cage but I did take it out to put a new hamster in one night. The hamster got out at the point where the wire curves and died at the paws of our cat. At the point of this curve the wire is too flexible and bends easily. The entire cage is too flimsey and should be better quality with stronger wire and plastic as well as better fittings. I feel this cage is too small for a Syrian and the bars are too far apart and too flexible for a dwarf. I would suggest an aquarium with a hinged lid, a Silent Spinner wheel, a dish, and a hanging water bottle which will run around $40 total. The kids can make other things for the hamsters with legos or disposable items with cardboard. We save all our paper towel and toilet paper tubes. As breeders we have used several types of cages - this one went into the garbage.

First: my 2 cats and 1 small dog love this! They are drinking much more water now than they did from their bowls, and they go to the fountain often. I think one of my cats just likes to watch the little waterfall.I'd owned this (the jumbo size) for a few weeks before it started gurgling loudly. Adding more water seemed to mostly fix it, giving the sound more of an "indoor water feature" quality. Then, tonight, 6 weeks into ownership, the fountain began the (previously unbeknownest to me) infamous leak. No visible damage or cracks, and I've been keeping it filled and relatively clean (ie, have only dissembled and scrubbed it once, but I always remove anything I see floating in the bowl). After failing to figure out where the water was leaking from (and a lot leaked in a short time...about 1/3 of the basin emptied onto my hardwoods in 30 minutes), I immediately googled it and tried out the suggestions I found there.Had the power cord been jostled during a cleaning, causing the water to trickle down it? No...Had I put it back together incorrectly, so the parts weren't perfectly aligned? I adjusted it carefully; it still leaked.Had I tried removing the filter? I...hadn't realized that was an option. I removed the filter; instantly, the fountain was silent and the leak stopped.Obviously, Petmate is serious when they ask you to change the filter monthly. I'd rinsed it out a few weeks ago, and figured I would change it soon. I'll update if adding a (new, clean) filter causes it to begin leaking again, but for now, removing the filter entirely has fixed the problem.
of the 4 cats in the house, 2 ignore the Activity Center completely, 1 will lay on top of it, while the 1 we thought least likely to play with it will bat around the attached toys for a few minutes.

Get Serious removes stains and odors that other products leave in. It takes out old, set-in stains as well as new ones. I use it for cat, dog and tortoise stains. Other products like Nature's Miracle and Ewww are mostly useless. Not only is it effective but it is also fast since the steps are apply, scrub and blot. Thumbs up!!

I got this for my super fuzzball long hair cat. The cat didn't mind being brushed with it, but honestly, I wasn't that impressed. I actually did better with a fully silicone rubber style brush. It did work, but not to the extent I was hoping.

This is the best litter in my opinion. I won't buy online due to cost. If it's cheaper or the same price, I'd love to have it sent vs. get it at the store. Although it's dusty, I don't think it's any worse than any others. It clumps better and my litter box has less pieces that fall thru the cracks. Plus, the scent is much better than any other litter. I tried all sorts of litters...newspaper, corn, and other clay and clumping litters. This beats all of them.

I got this because I thought my dog would like it better since it claimed to be bacon flavored. He really liked the original one, so I thought might as well try it. But there was not the slightest scent of bacon. My dog chewed it once or twice, and is not interested in it anymore. Not very happy.

I purchased this for my growing puppy a month ahead of time. Very cute on her, but the fit isn't perfect. For the size of dog they recommended it for, it fits lengthwise (neck to rump), but not so much width wise (around the stomach). The belt that goes around the neck and stomach area are a little big. It could use some additional velcro on the sides to hold on the somewhat oversized belt. I will probably rig something up myself. For the cost you can find it on Amazon, it's still worth the price.

I bought this bottle to replace one of the types that you opened the top to fill. Needless to say this bottle is 10 times better than the other, no more changing bedding every 2 or 3 days because my guinea pigs are floating away with the excess water spillage.The bracket leaves a little to be desired it isn't extremely sturdy and the bracket itself will not hold the bottle up, the metal tube needs to rest on something in order for the bottle not to slide out of the bracket. I found this out when I wanted to mount the bottle inside of the cage and not the outside. I got around this by super gluing a couple of thick plastic washer to the back side of the bottle, now it can't slide and the bracket holds it up.The bottle holds a good amount of water I am not sure it is really 32 ounces though. Between my two guinea pigs I would estimate that it would last more than a week before I "needed" to refill it. All in all it is a good bottle, the bottle itself is made of durable plastic and it really doesn't have issues with leaking or dripping.
