my dog is tennis ball obessed and likes to pick up 2-3 at the same time.. i thought it would be fun to watch him play with this. he has never pulled the yellow "fur" off a regular tennis ball. this one had big patches ripped off in the first day! ill go back to getting free regular tennis balls behind the fence at the tennis court

The Aquarium Vac was terrible,if I hadnt cut open the package and had the time,I would have sent it back.The idea is great and would be a great tool to use,but the suction is so weak,that is virtually useless.

Rated a 3 r/t size: What to do? I measured my dog every which way - and girth size 30. That's the cut-off for L to XLg. I ordered L. She is a very small German Shepherd - not even 60 lbs. I can get it zipped by pulling and stretching but I'm not sure she can breathe. If I order larger, would I be able to get a snug fit? She isn't a water dog and only thing I know is to put her on a diet. Otherwise...love the yellow color and the handles and it's easy to put on. Haven't tried it so don't know if it will keep her afloat but quality looks good.

This is a standard Premier leash with about 12 - 18 inches of glow in the dark/reflective tape sown on one side of the leash. I would have preferred the tape to be on both sides to increase visibility from more angles. We use this leash at night and our regular leash during the day. I'm not sure how long the reflective tape will last. Being placed close to the clasp means it is closer to the dog's head and less likely to be bent and broken off. The glow fades rather quickly once it has been charged by light.PROS:- reflective tape reflects well- placed near dog's headCONS:- tape only on one side of the leash- tape only 12 - 18 inches long- tape not long enough to show where the human is- glow fades quicklyIf it is on sale and you want a little more visibility at night then this leash may do the trick. I think a reflective collar may be a better idea as it would work from more angles.

I had one of the original dog doors from before this company changed hands, it was solid grey, with no window. They were robust, and still work beautifully.I bought another one for a dog house, brown with plexiglass inner door, a few years ago, and it wasn't as good as the original grey one. Lighter weight, and didn't seem to seal as well.This is my third one - building a dog door for my patio slider. The basics are still there - but much more flimsy then the brown one. I'll use it, but its just sad that the quality isn't what it used to be. I'd pay more for better quality.

Sounded like a good idea, but my dog doesn't care for them. I do break them up and add them to a meal that she really likes, and therefore, will eventually use them up. I'm not too fond of the smell of them, but could get over that if my dog would eat them as treats. Too soon to tell how effective they are in eliminating or lessening her shedding. She's a labX.
This is the best product for my dog. She is all white dog, she was getting stains under her eyes and all over her body, in 5 wks. she was clearing up.

Literature indicates hair on neck may need to be shaved. I'm not interested in shaving a beautiful dog, especially because one shouldn't leave this collar on 24/7. It doesn't work on the dog without shaving.

I spent two months trying to get it right. Which brand of "recommended" litter won't stick to the rake? How much is just enough litter? (use too much and the rake can't return to its starting position and will keep repeating its cycle) How often should I add another cup of litter? My 2 cats went in the same location in the pan, so the receptacle overflowed after one day. Also, the rake would pull the clump and litter away and then they would urinate on a pan without litter! Not a good smell! This did not liberate me from cleaning the box, I was dealing with litter box issues twice as often!(...) PS: Don't bother with the privacy tent. It wraps UNDER the tray, so when litter misses the receptacle it is trapped in the tent and you can't easily get it out. What a pain.

I bought a large Hamilton collar like this one for a large dog (120#). Chasing a squirrel in the park and coming to an abrupt halt at the end of the lead, the steel ring on the collar can be jerked up to put pressure on the release tabs and voila! loose dog! Not something you want to happen around traffic or with people who are afraid of dogs.

My little 13 lb. Bichon/Shih Tzu/Miniature Poodle mix had the eagles head torn open and de-stuffed within 20 minutes of arrival. He enjoys playing with it, but would be better without stuffing. This eagle is going to need to go to the rehab center, he will never recouperate and return to the wild!
I dropped in my fishtank. all of them go down to graveland fish can not catch completely. If it is lotting, it is better.

It would go off even when our dog was just laying down doing nothing. Then when he did bark it would only work some times. And because it only worked part of the time and when he was not barking at all it made This collar worthless, and not even worth a $1.00.

This was one of our very first cat dishes for our 3 felines. It is very cute, and good quality and we still have it, but we have moved on to raised pet dishes - much more comfy for the cat to eat/drink from. Good price though!

This looked like a great product and had good reviews which swayed my choice. The way the bowl works is great. Where the product fails is the carry strap. When I filled the bottle about 3/4 full with water, and carried it on my shoulder with the strap, the bottle fell off. The screw top isn't strong enough to hold the top with strap to the bottle. The result: the bottle falls off and spills all the water. It might work better if it had a fanny pack type waist carrying strap.

This is my first citronella anti-bark collar. It works fine to curb the barking of the dog wearing it. However, it corrected/sprayed my dog when he was playing with my child and my child squealed in delight at what a good dog he was being. That was the first spray my dog experienced. I was extremely upset to discover that the microphone will spray my dog for any loud noise near his neck. If you own two dogs that bark when they play or if you have a neighbor's dog that can get close to yours through a wrought iron, chain link, or picket fence, your dog can get corrected/sprayed when that neighboring dog barks at yours. I guess in that case it would be okay, because it would be teaching your dog to stay away from the fence when the dog is barking, preventing any fence barking/fighting. I just reserve it for times when my dog will NOT have the chance to be corrected by a person's voice or the bark of a dog he's playing with. That was sad and very unfair. I still prefer the Tri Tronic Bark Limiter. It is the best product on the market.

Alternate Title:If you don't expect much, you won't be disappointed.This product is simply a piece of clear plastic tubing with legs, but if you catch it on sale, it may be worth it for some...The Ghost House looks ok in the tank, but it's cheaply made upon any kind of inspection. I don't really own the kinds of fish that this was made for, so I can't speak to how knife fish, etc will take to it, but my small goldfish liked playing in it and my pleco used it every once inawhile. No tears were shed, though, when one of the legs broke while I was pushing it back down into the gravel one day. It went straight into the garbage and will not be replaced.
Works great for a while then my dog showed allergic to it. He developed redness around his eyes, so we stopped it.
Good item only problem is the assembly instruction are not clear. you need to be handy and have a good imagination to figure it out. Its like a puzzle. enjoy

First of all let me tell you I've used litter maid, litter robot, litter free (the first generation cat genie that went broke) and now I'm on my third Cat Genie. While I must say that Gat genie is by far the best product of them all, the unit seems to last only about a year before its starts making trouble for you. I've had the bowl flooded, the hopper and the genie hand stuck more times than I care to remember.To be clear, while the unit is functional it works great and you basically can forget that your cats use it, sometimes you go a whole months without having to deal with it. The stench when the unit is flushing is pretty bad. The pellets get all over the house. Get used to it. Even the beds... That lets you know where your cats sleep while you're not home.When the unit gets stuck it is just REPUGNANT. The smell is unbearable. Even with gloves it makes you want to throw up. I've noticed that the rod inside the hopper is quite sharp. I know it has to be to breakdown the poo and everything else that the cats have swallowed but its sharp enough to cut skin. Imagine my surprise when I felt removed my hand and noticed blood coming through the glove. Pretty scary to have cat poo on an open wound. I have to wash it really good alcohol, and triple antibiotics and then a visit to the doctor just to be safe. I was given a strong oral antibiotics for a week just to prevent any infections. Thankfully nothing happened but I'm sure I could have gotten a serious infection if I had not gone to that extent.The toll free number at customer support is always busy. I've never been able to reach them and I've been a customer for years. You might wonder why I keep buying products from them. Well the answer is really simple I cant stand cleaning litter boxes and while flawed this is still the best solution available. Either they are extremely busy handling all complaints,which is very scary or the number simply is not reachable from Puerto Rico. They need to have a non toll free number reachable from anywhere the product is sold.I have two ragdolls and therefore the Cat Genie is a little small for them, the hood which probably would have reduced the tracking a lot is useless because the cats would not fit.The beeping sounds are really annoying.Overall this is a great idea with a mediocre execution. It has come a long way from the days of Litter Free but it still has a long way to go. In any case even with all of its flaws its still a whole lot better than Litter Robot and Litter Maid. Do yourself a favor and don't even bother with them. This is so far the only marginally usable convenient product for an automated litter box

These rolls are convenient to put in a bag, purse, holder, car, backpack, where ever! We bought the many pack for a greater value. They are thick enough I'm not worried about holes where I'll get my hands dirty. They are large enough to handle our yellow lab's droppings. They are brightly colored making them easy to find. We're happy with these!

This is the best option available for stackable and airtight containers. Most containers available just aren't airtight.My first issue is the 40lb+ is ridiculous. I could barely fit 25lbs in before it started spilling out the front. You have to stand it on end if you want to fit the full amount in and of course it is no longer stackable at that point.The second issue is, when stacking, you cannot fill the top vault more than half way before the weight of it causes a slight bend in the bottom vault which makes the lid impossible to screw on. I am going to create some sort of a brace and place it inside the bottom vault to hold it up so the lid closes correctly.Anyways its the best option available.

I got this as a cheaper alternative for my dog. It does the job, but I have a few complaints. 1) The smell of the collar is very strong and took about three weeks to go away. I am not sure if that's safe for the dog, myself, or my furniture, as it's clear it's the flea repellent that smells so strong. 2) The reflector material comes off almost immediately. 3) The buckle that is supposed to hold it in place is cheap and I have to resize it around his neck often.That said, the price is great, since these things can be very expensive. I am not sure I will buy again, though, since I do not want to have to go through that three-week limbo of now know if the smell means something harmful.
Well this is a very large and ornate bird feeder. The beveled glass is a bit much and the light weight of the feeder is not too promising .
Was defective ..... the food drum wouldn't rotate at preset times....it only rotated when manual button was used...needless to say, i was very disappointed with product

Well, my big lab managed to get a plastic chunk out of this after the first 5 min of playing with it, so I'm not impressed! It did last longer than our $1 frisbees, but I think I'd rather have 25 of them than one of these.

I normally give fish oil capsules from Nature's Made, but after seeing this product with high number of reviews I wanted to try it. The bottle came by itself (as opposed to include with other products) and well packaged. My dogs seem to love this oil. However, I noticed that both dogs start having runny bowel movement after I fed them the oil in their food. I am stopped using this for a while and start using capsule fish oil again to see if this fish oil is the culprit. All I want is to give my dogs the best fish oil for their health, and most economical purchase. I usually buy the Nature's Made FO when they have specials "buy one get one free". I was worried that maybe the Nature's Made brand may not be pure FO and I don't want to poison my dogs.

I bought this for my chihuahua and it has been perfect. The carpets on each step keep it from being slippery and the whole set up is extremely stable. I highly recommend it for anyone with a small dog.

Replacement for broke one. This one also squirts by the neck. Always disconnect hose before moving the hose, so it doesn't wiggle the pump, and break it. FINGER TIGHT ONLY!!! or you will wear down the cheap, plastic screw grooves.

If you have a dog that likes to chew through toys, this is NOT as tough as you think. My corgi was able to rip it up within minutes. I'm sure it would have made a great toy to play fetch with otherwise.

seems to do job at distracting and deterring barking but also goes off when he groans while stretching or gives any type of throat sound. It's way too sensitive and has no setting other than on or off. he gives low happy sound when I come home and now gets sprayed for that as well. Not the message I want to give.

This pet toy was a replacement for the child toy version which broke. Can't seem to find the child version anywhere anymore.The pet version is built better than the child version. No pets play with mine, so can not provide review of how well it holds up to *Fido*. Half the size of the child version, but that is not an issue.

I have a Pembroke Welsh Corgi/Australian Shepherd mix I adopted from the SPCA to find that he has severe skin allergies and if left to himself, he keeps gnawing until he's bloody and hairless. So, at the suggestion of some of my dog-owning friends, I bought this and the Epi-Soothe shampoo. Unfortunately, it only seems to help for maybe a day, sometimes less. He hates baths and is beginning to hate them more and more with me giving them to him daily. It's not the only treatment he's getting for the skin allergies, but I was hoping it would help more than it is.

The item came quickly, but when I unpacked it one of the plastic handles to a bolt was broken. I think I can replace it from hardware store. And I have managed to use it. So it isn't worth the shipping to return it.

My cats loved this product when we sprinkle catnip on it. What at an resist catnip? However after having to sweep up catnip a couple times because the cats tipped it over we decided that it wasn't a keeper for our house. If you are looking for a scratcher for a full grown cat, look elsewhere.

OK I was disappointed to see that the FURminator is actually the top of a clipper blade mounted in a plastic handle. I could have probably made one out of my collection of clipper blades! Having said that, when used in short strokes, it does seem to remove the dog's undercoat. However, it is tedious and my dog is very bony (greyhound mix) so it isn't very useful on him. I tried it on my cat and it seemed I had to push hard to get it "into" her coat, and she objected to that. Maybe it is because she wasn't freshly bathed. So, if you have the time, energy, and patience to do this, I'm sure it works well. I think I will stick to the PetSmart Grooming $55 shave every couple of months instead.

Arrived with two of the four brackets broken (probably due to shipping), so was in alright shape after some superglue. Hedgehog loves it otherwise, but will have to see how well it holds up considering.
These are the same treats that my vet sells, but they are cheaper on-line. The delivery was fast and ordering was easy. Dog loves them.

after two weeks, I am still hoping the filter will work and clear the water. Very convenient, but it came with filter encased in plastic. After a week with water still cloudy I realized I had to remove the plastic. Then I failed to notice the instructions stuck to the back of he filter cartridge. Water still cloudy. Removed instructions. Usually instructions are outside the item. Still hoping for clear water.
I purchased this product for my 4 pound Chihuahua. He barely fits. It is long enough, but not nearly as deep as I thought it would be. It is very difficult to use. It is now sitting in the closet.
This product is great to distract the dogs for a little, but this product is not as great as the others offered by the same company.

The actual rubber Kong toy is in line with the legendary indestructible product Kong has made for years, but the nylon mesh rope attached was torn to shreds within the first few hours of playing with it.

I like the idea of these more than the end results. The fact the bowls slip out of the hangers is nice for refilling, cleaning etc. However, I did note that the entire unit has been knocked off the side of the crate more than once (I did not have the bowl knocked out of the hanger as another reviewer noted though). I also found, after buying four bowls, that some hang more evenly/horizontally than others and it is not consistent bowl to bowl. I do plan to try to bend them back to horizontal (they were made inconsistently - it is not shipping damage or anything) - I am just not sure I expected to have to do that. I don't think it is a crate difference since all four hang at different angles in the same spot.A side note of sorts - I have also noticed that the cat on the outside of the crate can easily reach in and grab things out of these since now the food is conveniently hung in a stationary position up against the bars. Just an FYI if you have animals both in and out of the crate and are trying to keep them from eating each others' food for whatever reason.

We purchased this toy on the recommendation of several acquaintances, one of whom claimed that their two labrador mixes loved this ball, and would spend hours just pushing it around by themselves, fascinated by the "ball-within-a-ball" concept. Since we have two dogs, one of whom is young, curious, and very playful, we were hoping, perhaps foolishly, that this would be a toy that would be able to keep him entertained, at least for a short while, whilst the human members of the household were attending to necessary chores, etc. We care about our dogs very much, but there are moments when we have to direct our attention towards other duties, which can be difficult with a very high energy dog.Since most dog toys are designed for the human and dog to play with together, and our doggy tears through bones in minutes and there are only so many treats one can give him in treat dispensing toys without overfeeding him, we were searching for a toy that would at least pique his curiosity long enough that it would be able to keep him occupied in those moments when we have to pay attention to something besides him. This was not that toy. For some reason, no matter how appealing we tried to make this toy, and no matter how much we "oooh"ed and "aaahh"ed over it to try to get the dogs interested, neither of our dogs (Labrador mix and Golden Retriever) wanted anything to do with this toy.Giving it three stars because the idea is a good one, and the construction is decent, the plastic it is made out of seems pretty sturdy and it would probably take a fair amount of chewing before a dog could completely destroy it. (The small ball inside is made of flimsier plastic, but it seems like it would be very difficult for a dog to get ahold of that to chew on.) It's a good concept for a dog toy, and it seems like other dogs like it from what we've heard, but be aware that your dog may simply not be interested, even if he or she is, like our dogs, very playful and happy to play with any other toy they are presented with.We were not able to "test drive" this toy in a pet store because none of our local pet stores carried the large size (10 inch) we needed since our dogs are large, but because our dogs typically will play with anything, we didn't really think it would be a problem. For reasons that are unclear, this is the only dog toy that our dogs have simply not wanted to play with.

This is a terrific product, and customer support is fantastic. It works as it claims it will.All those things said, I have to be honest and tell you one of my cats won't use it at all. He goes on the floor beside it.The other cat, small though she is, stand in it and urinates out the door or over the sides. I've even purchased the optional dome, and she still goes out the door.The walls are too short and the doorway is too "widely open." I purchased four more sets of walls and stacked them tightly and strapped them together. It raised the sides, but she's still going out the doorway. I'm going to order 1, maybe 2, more side sets and hope that takes care of the problem. She climbs onto the sides as she's getting into the box anyway, so I doubt the sides will be too high.Now if these design problems were fixed, it would be the best thing ever invented for a litter box! Catgenie just needs to work on the design, so it better suits all cats and not just the "perfect ones" who don't have opinions. I don't know about you, but I've had 5 cats (only two currently); and they've ALL had very strong opinions and no problem getting that opinion known.

We used to have a problem with neighbors' cats following our cat, Amber, into the house. One cat in particular was inside fighting with Amber and making its mess for several days while we were out of town. This problem was totally eliminated after we installed the Animate Electromagnetic Cat Door. Installation to replace the conventional kitty door was pretty easy, and Amber had no trouble wearing the magnet on her collar and learning to use her new door. Highly recommended!

The cover is not what I call sherpa. It is not what sherpa looks like if you go to the Majestic webside and zoom in on the texture of the cover. It is soft but doesn't have the sherpa texture.Also, the bed comes in a box (from Majestic) folded in half. It took a couple of days for it to lay properly. I agree that this bed is very light weight. I am using it for 2 dogs that are each under 20 lb. Therefore, it is sturdy enough for them. I would not recommend it for a 50 lb. dog.

So, this thing is basically the best thing since sliced bread.It's durable and is heavier than a normal Frisbee (contains some hard ring in the border of it). It's easy to throw it really far and it flies well.My dog is now on his second flyer, one downside to them is that the hard ring inside of the flyer tends to break in time. And when it gets really worn it sticks out. But I just pulled the ends out when that happened.My dog absolutely loves this toy, it simply his favorite.Stocked up and bought 3 of these the other day :)
Overall, I think my dog is responding to the supplement. I would give the product 4 stars if I could get me dog to eat the pills without peanut butter.

I have a miniature pinscher puppy and thought the X-small would be fine for her, but it is way too big! MAYBE when she is full grown she will fit it but I very much doubt it... It is a very cute shirt though. Guess I'll have to keep making my socks into shirts for her until I can find SOMETHING that fits right...

THIS DEVICE IS SO PHONY, I'M ASHAMED THAT I PURSCHASED IT !! THE ONLY THING IT'S GOOD FOR IS TO CALL IN CRICKETS! DOGS ROLLED OVER LAUGHING AT ME.IT USES TWO BATTERIES THAT ARE FOR SHOW. DON'T BUY IT !! (UNLESS YOU WANT TO WATCH CRICKETS HUMP)
Have several dachshunds who are aggressive chewers. This bone is a bit too soft as they can devour it quite quickly. on the plus side, it would probably not cause digestive problems.
this brush is only ok I use it 2x a day on mt cavilere king charles and i still end up daily with a vacuume full of dog hair.

I tried it on the audio to see if it worked and it worked infrequently when my dog barked in the house. The barking in the house was very loud. This would have no effect out in the yard on neighbors dogs so I used it from a window. It had little effect on their need to bark but they found it annoying and would go to the far side of the pen. Bark free was not sensitive to barking and did not work unless I pressed the button on audio. It certainly was not cheap. Thank God these horrible neighbors who had dogs penned about 60feet from my window are no longer there. In this county there are no enforced ordinances.
It's nice but not as plush as it shows in picture and dimensions are off,36in pad will not cover the floor of 36in crate.

I understand that any cover for this kind of bed would need to be thin, but this cover seems incredibly cheap. Unless this cover's price goes way down, you'd be better off covering the bed with a thin blanket. It was priced at $12.99 at the time of this review...

I wasn't totally satisfied with The World's Greatest Cat Litter re clumping and odor control, so I started transitioning to Swheat Scoop. Seemed great in terms of no dust and at least ok in terms of odor control, but both yesterday and today I "caught" my darling cat sniffing it a lot and then, to my horror, she nibbled a little bit. (Yesterday I thought maybe I was imagining it) Back to the drawing board...

I had 9 feeders up and needed more. I put three up three of these feeders and although smaller than my older ones, they were heavily visited by the hummingbirds. Last week when I got home from work, these three feeders were completely covered with bees, I couldn't see any red. I got a garden hose and washed the bees away and threw these feeders as far as I could.After two days, I retrieved them and cleaned them and refilled them and hung them up. The next afternoon, they were covered with bees again.None of my other feeders have this problem.

I'm planning on buying this to try with our nervous dog who we recently got from a shelter. We has an animal behaviorist come in and help us with various techniques to work on with our dog to lessen her fear and aggression. The behaviorist said that in her experience these collars are effective 50% of the time, which these reviews seem to reflect. I feel it's worth it to try it if you have an anxious dog before other, more extreme or expensive products (e.g., drugs). Whether it works or not is probably more due to your individual dog, rather than the product itself.

My golden is a finicky eater and didn't really care for the treats. He seems to like the soft treats better than the hard ones. And when he does eat one of the treats it ends up in little pieces on the floor.

I bought the Kyjen Pig and Duck, and all I can say is wow... Are they small or what! This isn't Amazon's or Kyjen's error. In fact, it is mine. I should have read the description. I purchased this for around $6.00 through Amazon (give or take a few pennies). For a toy this small, it is borderline expensive... Especially considering the fact that it IS made in China. The pig has a sound box inside it, which does deliver noise to entice a dog's curiosity. I don't think this will stand the test of time though, even if you're like me and you supervise all toy play time with your dog.

First of all the delivery rate was fast and packaging was great.Secondly, the gentle leader is the best thing ever invented! I watched the video and found it helpful especially with the commands and what to expect when you first use it! and its very easy to use too...Usually when I walk my German Shepard/ Rottie mix he pulls and lunges at other dogs and its insane to have to walk him late at night when no one is around. But with the gentle leader it was amazing and after 3 walks he no longer tries to take it off. He doesn't even lunge at other dogs!! I love it!! Its the best $13 I've ever spent!

Well at first when I hot the filter there was a giant leak in it, because apparently on the assembly line they used the wrong o rings. They will replace it if it's broken, I fixed mine myself with putty tape and it works beautiful. I have owned these filters before, about 6 of them different types from terra, and they all still work, first time tetra has done me wrong, but I'm still sticking with them. Especially for the price.

My cat watches it and seems very amused. However, I think you need to have a cat that was already into watching TV. My cat already liked to watch movies and stuff. She likes this better than our movies but She only watches it sometimes. She's not quite as enthusiastic about it as the cats in the preview. So, I'd say if you know your cat watches TV and is fairly active, go for it. The loop feature is great! And if your cat is not that attentive, hey, at least it wasn't a very expensive cat purchase and it can't hurt. :)I really like the product.

The wood on this gate is much thicker than other designs I have seen. This makes it a great option if you're dealing with dogs or toddlers. (We have both). The non-pinch top is good, easy to install unit, works. Height is perfect, width more than adequate, and it's just flexible enough to install in odd places. I recommend it. I doubt however it is something that could withstand more than a couple of years of being beaten by dogs and kids. Packaging was horrible, but item arrived in one piece with all its parts.

It stirred up too much debris when I removed it clean the filter. Other than that it worked really well at filtering the water. I chose to just use the filter on the drip pan. I really wish it was easier to remove for cleaning.
Excellent product. Works great. Allows me to keep cats at home, instead of boarding or having a cat sitter show up.

My girlfriend wanted to buy something to hide the litter box in so it wasnt in plain site. Its easy to put together but the one I received didnt align perfectly and had to file one of the sides for it to align. If it werent for that I ould be giving this 5 stars. But at this price you expect it to be perfect when putting it together. This would have frustrated a lot of buyers possibly to the point of returning it.Once we put this together we also found out that the typical literbox with the covers wont fit. You need to buy a smaller one without the cover for it to fit. That wasnt much of an issue since we could get one at walmart for 4 bucks.Another tip is to line the inside with the plastic see through sticky paper used for books (sorry, the word for it evades me right now) prior to assembling the whole thing so the wood doesnt absob any smells and its easier to just wipe and clean.
when ordering the decor we knew it was not going to be huge but we definately expected the quality to be much better. would not buy again

I had a different model that worked great for many years. I accidentally messed up the motor cleaning it ... my bad. I ordered this one for a replacement and OMG! If color doesn't matter to you then you may be ok with this. It is definitely not a cream color ... try more like a pale pink. That must be why they are selling it cheaper than normal. I'm sure I will get used to it but it looks like a bad batch got out ... yikes!

These bowls are a good price but as the old saying goes "You get what you pay for."My new bowls are already denting and they don't dry unless you wipe them (some kind of residue on them from stamping them out I would guess.)My older bowls are thicker and though I've had them for over 12 years - they have no dents and dry on their own.It's like I said - if you want bowls cheap and don't care what they look like - these are fine for you.But if you want something that's going to last and doesn't look like it's been dragged behind your car, get something with a higher thickness.It's your choice.

I looked at many harnesses and knew I wanted a front-pull, martingale harness. When I was looking at the SENSE-ible, I didn't notice it wasn't a martingale. So, I was disappointed on that score when it arrived. But that's my mistake. It is well-made, and the profile is low--in other words, I can pet my dog without having to dodge a million bulky buckles. The colors are extremely limited in the small sizes.It didn't control pulling much better than back-pull harnesses.If you don't care about the martingale feature, then I can recommend this. However, I'd suggest that you reconsider. Without the martingale feature, the harness shifts around significantly. With a martingale, I can leave the harness loose, but the dog tugging snugs it up without pulling the harness around, which would, I fear, lead to chafing or discomfort.

This collar worked the first day as a charm.Then no more, the mechanics and spraying and all works fine, not problem, but I do can not figure out why the spray does not go on her nose anymore, I loosen it and tighten it and still no good.Also I think she got used to the smell. One time she was barking her heads off I ran in the yard and it was like I had 50 citronella candels lit at the same time, and she was still barking. Hey at least she won't have any bugs on her.I need to try again and study how to make it work again.

My cats absolutely love the feathers and the way you can make them fly around, but this product is so flimsy! The feathers are attached to a string, which my cats immediately chewed through. I keep re-knotting it, they keep chewing through it. It would work so much better if it were fishing line or some kind of strong nylon. Also, the plastic handle which comes in two parts is difficult to put together, and while doing so it creates tons on teeny tiny splinters, which then get stuck in your hands. I had to cover those joints with packing tape. In all a great idea, done cheeply and poorly.
Easy to use, but my dog kept trying to get it off and it jazzed him up, if anything. Not the calming influence I was hoping for.
We bought this 4 months ago, as an add'l day bed for our vizsla to use upstairs. The seams have begun to come undone in two places with only light - moderate use. I haven't even tried to wash it yet.

So far so good. I've only been using it for 1 month, but it's doing the job.The real question will be how long it lasts...hoping for @ least 2-3 seasons, like my last (not the same, but similar) de-icer.
i expect fleas to be gone and dead, and het the next day, they are still on my dog who has a got spot.. failed..

This makes the not so fun task of cleaning of the poop somewhat more pleasant. You don't have to bend over and pick up the mess any longer. The rake which is included is relatively effective even when working with grass. However, the tines on the rake could be a bit more substantial. They do tend to bend relatively easily. Once it has been used, I don't think that you really want to work on bending the tines back into place. If you're cleaning up a poop in a deeper wet snow the rake will be almost useless, as the tines just bend back. You can use the shovel portion once frozen and scoop under for those!Took away a star from the original after several months of use, the tines are bent differently. Sounds benign, but when one of those awkward ones grabs on the ground, and it flings poo at your dress pants, you're not going to be happy.

The product itself is terrific! After using the poop off spray ,I turned to the wipes. The only problem is that every container of wipes I have bought has mildew in it. I just opened a fresh container, and the inner wipes are all mildewed. I guess because there aren't preservatives?? But I don't like using mildewed wipes!

It certainly seems to keep my pooch off the bed, but the sound scares her to death. About 50% of the time, when I turn it on, it make that lound, high-pitched sound. I would rather not scare my dog needlessly.

I have no complaint about the product, except that my cat didn't like it. Some cats will, I'm sure. She is a very tiny, older cat and I was using it to re-moisten her canned food after she had licked all the gravy off of it, hoping she would eat more of the food. No luck. She wouldn't touch it.

My feeder just arrived, and as I feared but could not find in writing for sure, the top is copper-COLORED PLASTIC. I have one exactly like this but with a gray plastic top that has turned brittle with UV over the few years it's been up, and in fact a recent hail storm poked a hole in the brittle roof. Can anyone tell me if this copper-colored plastic top will hold up better than my gray-plastic top? I'm thinking not. I'll have to compare prices a little harder now, and decide if I'm sending it back.

It's a kong. Gotta have them. Ordered as a second in this size because my dog is eating most of her meals out of them now. Indestructible. Dishwash-able. Staple at my house. The amazon price is pretty much unbeatable.

The stretchy loop on this toy was gone in less than 3 minutes. Our puppy can tug pretty hard and this did not endure being pulled at all. This toy does stand up to chewing, even though it's listed as "not a chew toy". Our puppy likes to play fetch with it, and the firehose material is almost indestructible.

Not sure if this is good or what. I think its better if you have a flea infestation. I left it on all night the first night and didn't catch anything. The next day the light bulb blew out. So not sure what to think about that. I guess they should come with a better bulb. But since I don't have an infestation I assume it would have taken much longer for the fleas to make their way to the trap. Haven't picked up a new bulb yet so haven't been able to test it any further.

I ordered this item for my 6 pound Yorkie who likes to piddle when I'm not home. It is large and confortable, lots of air-flow. It was easy to assemble and looks attractive in my room. The only down-side is that I was unable to find a pad for the bottom, but I folded up a towel and that worked. Also, the "bamboo" is plastic, but it's not bad. I'd recommend this for anyone who wants to contain a pet but doesn't want to look at a plastic or wire kennel. It comes in a dark or light finish for any decor.

I have a 2nd hand pair of andis AG2 Super clippers and could not find part numbers any where that would tell me what combs would work with my clippers. I was pretty sure these universal ones would work and they are a prefect fit, they are durable and now I have a guide I can use so my mini schnauzers coat looks almost as good as if they went to a professional groomer
I have one I previously got from Walmart and I figured it was the large one but it was not. I still love them, very sturdy and good if you get caught out walking after dusk.

Size is good, but make sure to get the urine guards for the corners (which by the way aren't the right size to fit completely), otherwise when your bunny backs into the corner to pee, it completely misses the tray. I love how it folds down easy for storage as well. I've had better cages, but they weren't the folding kind like this.
I bought this tank with the idea of making a small salt water tank to sit in my office. It was very easy to set up and with some basics I was on my way to building a small reef. I would recommend!
So fragile. Take care while removing the plastic protection. When i did it one peace of sensor was damaged (the colored parts)
Collar works when it wants too, and goes through so many batteries that I can barely afford to use it. beep sounds different every time I use it.
This works best for me and my dogs. You will get 6 for the price of 3 from your vet.

Somewhat disappointing. We've had to make numerous calls back to the company to resolve problems. The upside is that their customer service representatives are FANTASTIC and have been a pleasure to work with.
Easy to put together. cats kinda like it.. the only thing i don't like about it, is that its like a plastic nylon material.. it definitely should have been made out of canvas...
This product was supposed to help my dog heal, but all it did was mess up his stomach and give him diarrhea.Don't try it if your pet gets sick easily.Pretty disappointing.
I've used this a couple of times on my dog that sheds a lot. It takes off a lot of hair but she still sheds a lot. But it doesn't seem to hurt her like other deshedding tool do.

So not only does this not work at all on any type of fecal matter that is not solidified (and randomly, at best, on already hardened stool - in which case, the product is really pointless anyway), but when I got the item in the mail, I was both amused & shocked at the directions. It indicates that you are supposed to spray the top of the poop, then there's a step where you must flip the poop over to spray the underside. Well, if I'm gonna flip the crap over, I may as well just pick the damn thing up. Pardon the pun, but this product is the biggest 'waste' of money ever.

This hat is really cute- it's basically everything its advertised to be, but my maltese hated it. It seems like the strap under the chin was going to choke him. The one picture I have of him wearing it, he looks miserable. I probably wouldn't buy it again.

This is a fabulous product! My mixed-breed rescue dog barked at every noise. With the Gentle Spray he learned to be quiet in 2 weeks. Now he only wears the collar for occasional reinforcement. I followed the product's directions, and now the words, "Good quiet," are all he needs. He disliked the citronella, but it certainly did not hurt him.

Maybe at one time these were built properly, but we bought two recently that were pure crap. The yellow "flowers" don't quite fit in their holes, and pop out. The base has to be aligned PERFECTLY with the storage bottle in order for it to go together; trying to line these two pieces up frequently results in a lot of the feed splashing out. The two of these units we bought are sitting in a corner, wasted money. If you're interested in high-capacity feeders, look for the Best-1 72-oz. We got two of these at the same time we did these two Perky Pets, and love them. I STRONGLY suggest you do not waste your money on this poorly engineered, poorly constructed, and poorly thought out product.

May not be pretty as my 4 year old put it, but it looks like the picture and works as stated. I do have a very small turtle though I added weights to my dock and it will hold 1 lb 5 oz up out of the water before sinking under.Had the grainy sand stuff but rinsed it off before putting in the tank (who would not wash something new before exposing there animals to it any way?). No scrubbing as it is foam afterall. I like it, my kid's turtle likes it, and it is as advertised so thumbs up.I also think it is great ZooMed provides products I can afford that work. I also use their turtle filter.

We've had had alot of problems with our blue heeler barking uncontrollably whenever visitors stop at the house. We were hoping this would deter her barking by at least 50% to something tolerable. Boy, were we disappointed.At first, the spray startled her but did not stop her from barking. After getting used to the spray, it doesn't even surprize her anymore. It just makes the house smell like citronella as she barks away until the visitors are gone (and these are people that frequently visit).I purchased another three cans thinking it would just take a little longer but it looks like it will be a wasted effort. We opted to purchase the spray collar instead of the shock collar thinking it would be the more humane approach to breaking the annoying habit. When given a 50/50 chance.......well, that's why I don't go to the casino.

I purchased this a few weeks ago. I placed this container right where we are having issues with ants. I put some dog food in it. Not a lot just enough to test it. Absolutely no problems.I find the reviews for this item to be more about other complaints then just keeping bugs out.Why would anyone throw a full bag of expensive dog food in a container before testing it ? Why leave it out side ?If you need to leave out side one would think a person would know critters will eat through plastic to get the food. Some complaints are over stacking. Yes it says stackable, if its protecting the contents in side the container isn't that a major plus.Most reviews for this item are are not about how it protects the food inside but rather what it doesn't do out side the container.My only complaint is for something so simple and made of plastic. It sure is expensive, yet so is the dog food my dogs eat. They don't eat the cheap junk, a healthy dog eats good healthy dog food.

This dog toy was delivered as advertised via ground shipping - I think it took about 5-6 days. It had a loop of string on the top that we cut off before giving to our dogs and they enjoy chasing it around and making it squeak.

I was so excited to get this toy because it is very cute. We got the Stegosaurus version of the toy, and as soon as I opened the package my dog was just as excited as I was. Up until this point she had been barking at the UPS man who delivered it!This toy says it is designed for active chewers up to 50lbs. My 5 year old Clumber Spaniel is a very active chewer, and weighs 50lbs - I thought it was perfect! However, within twenty minutes, she had chewed it to the point where it looked like a giant wad of used bubble gum.

I bought this collar so that I could use the Tracker Flash Hunting Dog Collar Lights, red and green, when I walk my son's dog at night. It is a very strong collar and it works fine for that purpose. My son normally uses a collar that is some sort of fabric reinforced plastic that doesn't absorb odors on his dog. But that collar has the usual side release buckles on it and the Tracker Flash Hunting Dog Collar Lights will not fit on it.

My poor car--she loves this when it's up, but it keeps falling off. It also made marks on my wall. I may not have allowed it to sit long enough before my cat sat on it, so it may be my fault, but it's still pretty frustrating. Warning: follow instructions EXACTLY.

My puppy chewed through the red plastic handle and after that started on the "rope", which is many thin threads braided together. She was able to break the threads with no problem. If your dog likes to tug and doesn't chew, it should be fine, but for aggressive chewers -- it isn't indestructible.

I bought an everlasting treat ball because everyone told me how wonderful they are, and I have a Jack Russell Terrier who is fairly calm for the breed, but does tend to have a bit of a seperation anxiety problem as soon as I leave. I got it yesterday, popped the caps on either end of the ball, and gave it to him on the five mile ride back to my apartment. By the time I had gotten home, he had already popped one of the caps off and chewed it up, so I took that one away and popped the third cap on, and gave it back to him, and both caps were off and eaten within probably fifteen minutes of being at home. I am completely unimpressed, I spent over $16 on these treats and the ball, and the Everlasting Treat ball was useless in a matter of minutes. I still really like the idea of this product, but the ball itself needs to be manufactured in a way that would really grip the treats a lot better.

I bought this toy locally expecting it to last and last.....well 20 minutes later my 8 month old pup weighing in at 40 lbs. had it torn open and eating stuffing.Exposed seems, weak tennis ball, tight corners are all negatives in a toy meant to be super tough.The reason I gave it three stars is that he company sent me 2 replacements as compensation.BTW, he has already torn them open too.

We have a very furry Chow mix dog and this works great on her. She doesn't seem to mind it and it pulls up a lot of hair. I would definitely recommend this product. The larger would one probably be best for big dogs.
My cat is smart, she walked around the mat in order to avoid it. Won't buy this again.

This is a good idea for a product, but the design is poor.After I had ordered the 2-pack for around $7 with shipping, I found a 4-pack at the 99 store, so I felt that I paid too much.The design makes it difficult to put the two halves back together once you have loaded the food or treats.I would recommend cutting a small hole in a tennis ball. That is what I have done and my cat seems to like it better.If you still want this product, let me know, I'd be happy to send it to you for the price of the shipping.
Although they come in different sizes, the shape of your dog's face definitely effects how well these fit and how much coverage they give.

Do not know how could I live without this blower before, I have 3 aussies, 2 of them have very heavy coat, this blower is excellent, still try to learn the best ways and how much air and all, but it is sturdy, not cheap chinese plastic, and it blows air very good.great buy.

I was a little disapponted with this item .It doesn't stay warm but 10 min at most.But it will stay warm long enough for the puppy to lay on top of it and get to sleep if they have had a active day and are very tired.I like the snuggle safe it larger and stays warm for 10 hours.I have three of those.One I have used for three years

This filter seems to work quite well and is very easy to change. I only have to put in a new one about once every 30 days. Doing that along with regular cleanings and water changes seem to keep the aquarium in balance and the fish healthy.

The actual cage once put together is awesome, however assembly was difficult. It took me (and then my husband) about 40 minutes to put this thing together. The plastic snap together pieces are very awkward and are tough to snap together. They don't like to stay together, and then putting the ramps and platforms in is quite gymnastic in nature, lol. But it is together, and it is solid. It is a lot bigger than we thought it would be and our 2 year old male ferret loves it! We had to take the slide part out and add a ramp from his old cage because he was just too big to fit up the spiral, but it is all good with modification. He is sleeping happily in his hammock now, enjoying his new home. The rollers on the bottom are a nice touch as well.

Unfortunately, my little dog is between 6 and 7 lbs. so based on reviews of the small Snoozer Console Car Seat, I chose to try the large seat. I have a RAV4 SUV and this size is way too big. I'm going to return it and order the small and cross my fingers she fits comfortable in it. I think it is well made and very comfortable for the dog. Based on the stated dimensions, the small should just barely fit. Will update if it works!

I bought two of these, one for each floor in my house, as an additional scratch post with the bonus of a game to play. They seem sturdy and well-made. However, in regards to their intended use... Well, let's just say it wasn't as successful as I was hoping, but at least they're washable.The scratcher in the middle actually rarely gets used. My cats usually love these type of cardboard scratchers and will use the plain ones I have enthusiastically, but this one doesn't seem to be attractive for that purpose. I'm not sure what it is, maybe the surrounding ball channel, that keeps the cats off of it. I placed the one in the basement near one of their favorite scratch spots down there but they keep ignoring it in favor of the sofa. Sprinkling cat nip on it gets them interested temporarily, but that doesn't last long. Curiously enough, I've kept some of the old cardboard inserts in the garage and my cats have discovered those and will use them as scratch pads now, but never used them while they were inside the toy.The ball running in the track is a neat idea and at least two of my four cats actually get the idea and will play with it when I'm running the ball around. One will occasionally play with it on his own, another will put his little toy mice or fur balls into the channel and bat those around in it. It does not seem to be much of a "play by yourself" toy though. They are more likely to interact with it if you show them how to use it and play with them.The main issue I'm having with this toy is that it seems to be more attractive as a place to pee on than play with or scratch on. It may be the type of plastic used or the shiny surface, but something about it says "pee on me" to older cats. Usually, my oldest will pee into the ball channel, but sometimes he'll miss. Pretty much the only times I've had to replace the cardboard inserts were not because they got worn out from scratching, but because they got soaked in cat pee. I had to place a puppy pee pad underneath the toy to prevent the surrounding floor from getting wet. I'm not the only one with this problem either. A friend of mine has one in her house and stopped replacing the cardboard inserts altogether because her oldest cat pees in it as well. Luckily it's easy to take out the insert and ball, wash everything, and put a new insert in, but it's certainly not the intended use.
I've used this vendor before, and usually everything is great. This time, one dose was broken inside the package. :(

This is a great way to keep your litter box clean without daily maintenance. Just check it every other day or so to empty the waste receptacle and clean the rake.Only problem is, it worked great for about a year (the length of the manufacturer's warranty) and then broke down on me & my felines! The rake would get so far and when it got to the point where it had to lift the waste it would get stuck and make this loud clicking noise until you pushed the rake the rest of the way. There is no replacement part or service available; only buy a new one! I'm buying a PetMate now; we'll see how long that one lasts!
I've had this gate for almost two years since my daughter started crawling and we needed a wide gate for an entryway. This gate has been very reliable, durable, and importantly safe for my child.

I have used this product now for a few months. I wash my dog around ever three weeks because she can't stop itching, scratching, biting or licking. I also buy dog food without grain to help with this as well. I spare no expense for my dog but still haven't found relief for her. I will need to further investigate if there is another shampoo to help relieve the itch.
This is gone within a few hours of hanging it- my bird loves it and instantly starts eating it! Easy to hang as well.

I was apprehensive when I bought this cage for my two female rats because it is a ferret home and I was told that rats might be able to climb through the bars. I never had any problems, but if you have dumbo rats or baby rats, it might be an issue. My girls loved the extra space and I also noticed they slimmed down a bit from running around so much! Some of the slides and slopes were hard to clip into the levels but we have not had any problems with quality or parts breaking.

My neighbor has 2 dogs that she leaves out in the back yard when she goes to work. One of them, a Pit Bull, has taken it into her head that I must be destroyed every time I make an appearance in my back yard. She can see me and attacks the fence, barking incessantly. I bought the Lentek Bark Free in an attempt to quell the noise, but the device only seemed to make the barking more furious. The problem lies more with the dog than with the device, so I am giving it 3 stars. A new fence is in order instead.

The pup liked this toy very much, but I do not recommend if you have any type of carpet in your house. We don't even have carpet - just a few wool rugs, but the toy was soon the most disgusting thing in our house. All the rug fibers and dirt and slobber matted around the nubs on this toy, making it very unpleasant to touch. We tossed it outdoors, and it wasn't much better. Those nubs grab everything gross and use slobber as glue to make sure that it stays that way.

this is a beautiful feeder but I expected it to be a little sturdier. The plastic "walls" of the feeder are extremely thin and flimsy. I don't expect that it will hold up for long, but hopefully I'm wrong! Time will tell.

This incident report is about the Angel's Eyes powder used on a sixteen (160 Pound poodle, 7 Years old. The product was purchased based on advertising and received promptly.When used the first day we noticed our dog could not keep his eyes open because of apparent light sensitivity. This continued until day two or for approximately 30 hours and gradually subsided.When the manufacture was called it was blamed on Liver allergy, which had never surfaced before. It was suggested we take the dog to a vet and he/she determined product sensitivity we could return the product for "up to 50% refund. If you are a perspective buyer I am sure you can do the math and understand why we did not follow through. (After the cost of bringing the dog to the vet and then shipping it would have cost me more)The bad side - we spent about $80.00 on a product that did not work for us . The good side - our dog was/is just fine once the side effect, adverse reaction wore off.Buyers be careful of this productRobert Bulmer/ Naples, Florida
Kind of noisy, doesn't hold a lot of water, and stained pretty easily from the water..

i have used this product before and has worked great. however this batch isn't quite up to par. it repels fleas(but not much problem with them in winter anyway) but has not been effective against ticks. hopefully second dose will work better.

I bought two bags of these, thinking it was the same product that I used to buy in different packaging (light blue, with a see-through dog shape against a grass green background). Unfortunately, it was completely not the same thing! These treats were actually like jerky-- tough and brittle. I give my dog soft treats because he doesn't chew the damn things, and he choked on these horrible things; I had to toss them out.Note that the "Zuke's Jerky Naturals" with the other packaging (http://www.amazon.com/Zukes-Jerky-Naturals-Beef/dp/B00008DFPY) have always been moist and soft, and I've never had a problem with those. I suspect that this batch was not new packaging, as I had thought, but very old packaging; these may be the same treats I usually feed my dog, just having sat on a shelf for years. In any case, these were COMPLETELY different treats, and not safe to feed my dog.
Not recommened for small spaces as it is difficult to rotate.Nice conceptI would recommend it if enough space is available

About a year ago, my dog and I discovered this adorable, softly 'voiced' toy. Since then, my two year old beagle has had an obsession with these overstuffed, fluffy creatures. Unfortunately, the toy - while cute and soft - doesn't hold up well under my animal's hunter instincts. While a few of her 'herd' have lasted a week or more, she's been able to take one of these apart in as little as 15 minutes. That said, she has as much fun with the 'sheepskin' as she has with the toy in tact, so we keep buying. If you have a pet that doesn't destroy stuffed toys, this is a great option. Its sound is a muffled 'baaah' that is nowhere near as annoying as the typical squeaky toy.
our dog has enjoyed her new bed. the bed was just as presented in the ad. i wish there was a little more stuffing in the bottom. good price

My 30lb aussie mix ate the rings off in less than 5 minutes, but he enjoyed just chewing on the plastic bone ends by themselves. The toy lasted longer than most do for him, but his mouth is slightly too small for the ball, which is all that is left of it. This is a very heavy toy, not good for fetching.

I purchased this substrate from Amazon because I had heard good reviews about it from the YouTube fish tank community. I set it up in my 55 gallon aquarium with a DIY black background, and boy do the plants look stunning! The black really brings out the color in my fish and the green/red in my plants. It has a large amount of nutrients in it, and I suppose you could use the substrate alone without fertilizers or CO2. I just use a $9.00 250m bottle of Flourish, an aquatic plant fertilizer that I bought at Petsmart. It lasts for 2 years for the size of my aquarium, so it's a worthy investment.My only complaint about this product is that it is kind of misleading when it says that it has beneficial bacteria in it to cycle your tank. Please don't take it like it will instantly cycle your tank. It comes packed in water which is cycled, and smells very foul when you cut open the bag. ALSO, make sure that when you open the bag that you open it up over your aquarium or over a tub/outside, as it is almost like vacuumed sealed and it will splash. I made that mistake and it spilled all over my floor. No big deal, though. Anyway, you need to let your aquarium cycle completely just like you would with any other aquarium.The substrate itself consists of very small sand particles and small sized granules. The package says that the small particles sift down to the bottom of the tank naturally to allow for optimum root growth and CO2/Nutrient supply, which is mostly true. Some of the particles still are on the top layer of the substrate, but overall the statement is true.The bag also says that you do not need to wash this substrate before filling your aquarium up. I have found this to be completely true. Because it comes packed in water, there is really no residual dust on the granules. You may have a little cloudiness for 2 hours to a day depending on the amount of filtration/size of the tank, but it's again no big deal. Only 3 days after setting up my tank the water was crystal clear.Overall I would give this substrate a 4/5. Would buy again, but not at the normal price it is listed for (30 bucks). I'd buy it from my LFS which sells it for 17 per 20 lbs.

I used to buy this brand all the time for my previous cats that passed away about 4 years ago. We did not have anymore cats, but we just go a new kitten in November. I bought other brands, but I remembered that I used to use Van Ness which you can't find at Pet supply stores anymore. These bags are not the same. The cat scratches through the bags and ripes wholes. I switched to the Jumbo johnny cat bags which are pricey but much stronger.

I can't believe there are not a ton of rave reviews for this product, I KNOW it's what saved my 3 month old rescue puppy from dying when he had distemper. The vet and I had tried everything. I also did what Dr Pitcairn recommended in his book on natural dog and cat care. Although some days were better than others, my baby slowly became a motionless limp rag within a couple weeks or so of fighting this horrendous disease. He seemed to have coughed the life out of himself. It appeared totally hopeless. Heartbroken, I made burial arrangements and called my vet to discuss euthanasia (which she was ready to do). Then I called a close friend for moral support and she was adamant that I try Pet Nutri-drops. I got the product, didn't like one of the ingredients, but thought - what have we got to lose? With each dose I saw improvement...within a few minutes!! It was amazing!!! By the time another dose was due, his symptoms had regressed but weren't quite as bad as they were before the last dose. The reason it works so fast, according to the company, is because it bypasses the digestive track by "shunting" through the stomach wall directly into the bloodstream, where it delivers large doses of Vitamin A, D and E plus some B and trace minerals. I gave the product to my baby for a month though he was doing great after a couple weeks. Now he's 12 years old and in excellent condition. As I recall, this product is specific for bringing sick animals back to health, but not as a regular supplement. I'm sure you could talk to the company if you want to know about that. BTW, my vet said that a dog has about 0.05% chance of surviving distemper. I sure hope veterinarians read this; they could save more dogs from needless death. What else could have saved my dog's life? The battle was lost. The only thing that turned things around (and it was obvious within minutes of each dose) was this product.
I have one I previously got from Walmart and I figured it was the large one but it was not. I still love them, very sturdy and good if you get caught out walking after dusk.
I purchased this for my dog run so I guess i shouldn't complain, but really in my opinion the cost is not worth how cheaply it's made!
mice are well done and cat's enjoy to play. I will buy more of those mice they are awsome.

My ferrets are very destructive, and they chew and destroy most any hammock i give them. They are slowly making their way through this one, though to be fair it is taking them much much longer than any other hammock I have purchased for them. It helps that it is shaped triangularly and the clips are in one place and its difficult for them to climb up to where the hammock hangs. It is very soft inside, comfortable (or so I presume) and can be machine washed. The biggest problem I have with are the zippers, the hammock would be much more durable and useful if it was one solid piece. instead of having zippers up the sides.
Large is too small for sub adult female ball python but is great quality!! Deals like a real rock and would fit a smaller snake great!
This kennel is a great product for the price. Assembly is very easy and it features a slide out plastic tray for the bottom floor, for easy clean ups!

This hammock does not support the weight of my 1-year-old bearded dragon, and she's tiny for her age. I was able to switch it around so that she uses it to climb the side of her vivarium, but I still wish she could have used it to hang out in.
This is an ok product. My dog didn't like them, however. Best used outdoors because the wand drips. Better to buy a bigger container. It's cheaper that way.

piece of junk product. collar is inappropriate to hold the unit to the dogs neck. Its a flimsy piece of junk and barely holds the shocking component in place. When the collar can't hold the unit to the neck, the product is a failure. with such a wimpy nylon webbing collar, the unit fails more than it executes.

We bought this gate to keep our new cat separate from the old. We actually ended up extending if to the widest with and flipping it up like a screen door. The older cat did not jump it, but did manage to climb up it. Boy were we and the new cat both surprised! It's a standard issue type of gate and did serve the purpose. It did arrive quickly and without any shopping issues. As long as u don't have cats with super power like ours, it's a good deal!

I have two dogs. One of them is really smart, and she took right to this thing. She LOVES it and gets so excited whenever I pick it up to go fill it. She spends about forty minutes pushing it around the house. Since this ball is made of rubber, it's a lot quieter than a lot of similar products. All that being said, my other dog, bless her heart (she's very loving and cute), couldn't figure out the ball. She just sits and stares at it, or maybe sniffs it. For the life of me, I can't get her to push it around. However, that's not incredibly surprising. She's always been a bit on the umm... not so bright side.
The top of one had a crack in the plastic. I hope they will still let it on the plane..

I had used the littermaid mega box for more than 5 years before switching to this ScoopFree box. The main reason is that it is hard to find the right clumping litter for the old littermaid box. Not to mention the difficulty in cleaning the old littermaid box because of all the nudges and indentations in the box molding.I have used this ScoopFree box for a month.This newer ScoopFree box is way better in terms of ease of cleaning. If you think you do not need to clean because you are using an automatic litter box, you are wrong. Occasionaly you still need to clean the inside of the box if you see dried pee. Make sure you also buy the hoop.Now the main problem with this product. The disposable cartriage has a very poor design. The idea is a big step forward but the design is poor. It is just made from paper. The bottom of the cartriage has a plastic like sheet to prevent pee to leak through. Now that is good except that sheet only covers up to the four edges! Pee is like water, it just leak through whereever there is a gap. There are four uncovered edges at the bottom and it is very likely that your cat(s) pee on an area where there is no crystal or if the crystal there already has saturated. I have to put a very big plastic storage lid under the entire litter box to catch leaked pee. It is not uncommon to see a pool of pee on the lid after a week of use.A better design for the cartriage is to have the plastic protective sheet shaped like a bowl. I think for the price of those cartriages, it is something the manufacturer can do.
these work ... purchased two for the price of one and change at a local pet store ...no brainer

I bought one of my cats these herbs to quench her greenery desire, as she was making meals out of my husbands plants. Talk about chow-down...she loves this stuff! Grows quickly and thickly; I water the grass every other day. You get a good amount of seeds in a package. Your plant eating cat will love you for this, your plant will love you too!
Trying to return this item, waiting for the seller to give me instructions. The first time it went off it scared my cats but after that they ignored it.

I can rate this product as a fair 3 out of 5 for a couple reasons.We received the product on time and it certainly met most of our expectations on quality and fits the commode like a glove. The only real problem for the cats comes from the flimsy construction. It's not like the cat would actually fall through it, but the cats seem to think they will. A more firm plastic would have been appreciated.We believe the problem in usage lies in our cats and ourselves, not the product. More written assistance with problems getting the cat to use the product would be appreciated because included directions and troubleshooting help are very sparse! Their website is easy to navigate, but it just doesn't provide the help needed in certain areas.The product comes with catnip, but why? Are they expecting you to use as part of the training or is it just a nice treat for the cats? They never do say.At this point, we're hoping our cats will become acclimated to the CitiKitty being on the toilet soon so we can finally take away the litter box next to the toilet. Only time will tell.

Every tutorial for this collar (and all collars) specifically states that they need to stay under the chin of the dog in order to work. This collar does not have a closure hook or clasp so it must be put on over the dog's head. Well, in order to get it over the dog's head, it has to be much larger than the neck. The collar slips down and does not stay in place and therefore cannot work properly. It should be made with some sort of a hook closure to put it on and off without going over the head... Won't work, it was a waste.
Used it with our dog and it removed the urine well.Used it with Cat pee, and it had little effect.

we bought the SD2000 and two additional collars for our 3 dogs.... after a labor intensive installation I was ready to begin the detailed training program outlined in the DVD provided with the system. I was very dissapointed to learn that the additional collars did not come with the protective training caps to put on the extra collars to start training the dogs (the training caps allow you to put the collar on your dog but it protects them from getting shocked so you can first train them to learn where the boundry is and only hear the tones) so, I called innotek to find out how I am supposed to train my other two dogs. They told me I could buy a kit that has the extra plastic caps for $10 per kit! and the kit includes the removal tool and extra prong extenders that already came with the collars in the first place. They then suggested that I dissasemble the collar between training each dog and install the caps on the next dogs collar. Sounds easy, but when you are trying to train 3 dogs each day on this month long training program, the last thing you want to be doing is disassembling a collar three times to accomodate the different dogs (my dogs range from a lab to a chuahua). Long story short, it probably would cost Innotek about $.01 to add the little plastic caps to each collar sold, but they wern't smart enough to think of that to keep customers happy and rather than pay and extra $20 to buy parts I don't need, I will probably go to Lowes and try to find something to act as a protective caps. I'm just ticked that I can't start the dog training yet. thanks innotek!

Never had an automatic litter box before. i did a lot of reserch on them before choosing this one and have not regretted buying this one. It works great. I get close to 21 days between changes. and there is no odor. The first time i had to add some regular litter to help train my cat to use it but she took to it great after that.

In our home, Maxx gets excited when asked if he wants a 'chicken cookie'. He'll do anything for one of these dehydrated discs of chicken. Between the size of a quarter and a half-dollar, these 'cookies' are easily snapped into smaller serving sizes (very useful for training treats). They come in a see-through plastic container with a screw-top lid. Besides the size and convenience being a plus, so too, is its ingredient: 100% pure chicken. There are no additives, no fillers. Another plus is that, this product doesn't have an offensive dog food smell. I feel that I'm giving my dog a healthy treat when he's rewarded with Chicken Nibbles.Whenever friends visit with their dogs I give them Chicken Nibbles, too. They love them so much that, their owners inevitably ask where to buy them. They used to be found at a big box pet store but, no longer carry them. I'm delighted to have found them at Amazon.com. Now we can all buy them right here.About Cost:A container usually lasts a few months so, the price is not unreasonable. When you consider that, you probably buy a variety of treats in smaller quantities (more frequently), there is not much difference in cost. When you don't have to make a trip to the pet store, there is savings, too, in having it delivered to your home. There are further savings when you buy through Amazon Prime; there is only an annual fee and not one for each time that you make an Amazon purchase.

This spray covered the smell the first few times but my cat kept going back to the same place to pee even after I cleaned the carpet and after a few times it was not working as well. I wish it stopped the smell enough so that my cat couldnt smell it

I have had several Lupine collars and the product is absolutely the best there is. These can't be destroyed!! The colors stay sharp and it doesn't fray no matter what you do to it (and we're pretty harsh on our dog stuff around here).My ONLY complaint is that this collar doesn't have a 'click' buckle to open and close the collar, it has to be slipped over the dog's head. Kennels do not accept these types of collars and they're not ideal for dogs with great big heads (like mine). I assumed all Lupines had buckles on them and didn't even think to look more closely!!

I have two cats, both of whom have been urinating outside the litter box. I use clumping unscented litter and have three litter boxes. This product may help some but it has not solved the problem like I had hoped.

I purchased this as a back-up spare after my original all-tape Flexi Classic got caught in a crack & the tape was damaged. I did not realize that this leash includes a section next to the collar attachment that does not retract.The first time I used it it somehow snapped back while I was fastening it on my dog's collar. It took a chunk out of my finger that bled for almost an hour; it was painful for several days after and still isn't fully healed. I haven't used it since, and have ordered an all-tape leash which I hope will be the same model as my old one. I have used tape Flexi's for over 2 years with no problem, and this is a poor substitute. The design is awkward, and since the non-retracting section hangs loose it is inconvenient to carry or store. I rate my tape Flexi's ( I have 3 in all, two of them 25' Classics) 5 stars; I would not recommend this model at all.Flexi now makes so many different models that it is quite confusing, so be certain that the one you order is the one you really want.

I bought this jacket to use on my then 90lb Boerboel (South African Mastiff) puppy and there is room to grow. She had never swam before and the jacket gave her the confidence to follow the other dog out into the lake. The jacket does a good job supporting her weight. It was a little big on my 80lb lab mix, but gave me the peace of mind that he wouldn't drown if he tired. Kyjen has a good reputation and I would recommend this life jacket to other x-large breed owners. This product was filled and shipped by Amazon and received just a few days after placing the order.
It's a super cute collar. But kitties scratch, and thus this collar frays like crazy. Bummer, because it looks so good on the old man. See my photo...

I bought this for my 8-mo-old blue heeler/husky puppy, and she managed to pull the rope enough to break it within 2 days. She's a rough-and-tumbler to be sure, but they claimed it was indestructible. Hardly.Pity too, she'd almost learned how to use it.

I received my package on time, but when i opened the box there was no metal wire. The wheel works fine but the way our chinchilla hops in it makes it far from silent. At night i have to take it off to sleep. Think it would be fine with the wire, but i did not receive one
The texture of the paw wax was chunky and I could not get it to spread on my dog's paws evenly.

This was, by far, the cheapest piece of garbage I have ever purchased online. Material quality is very, very poor and the assembly instructions were entirely (and only) in French. We still attempted to assemble the product but were so frustrated by the lack of detail in visual instructions and poor, poor quality of the materials that we gave up and intend to return this product immediately!Do not be fooled by other positive reviews. This is definitely NOT WORTH the price!
Don't just look at the total number of tablets. Price based on total weight is more per tablet.I will go back to purchasing from Petco (300 Tablets for $18.00Thanks,MichaelAntioch, Ca

My dear little catty refused to drink from this, so, I gave it to a friend for her pet. The quality of the fountain is good but I'll admit the sound of the water drove me nuts, and I decided I didn't really like the idea of having to clean another thing and change filters, etc. So, "we" just went back to drinking from our little simple water dish.
