I was expecting a soft heated bed, similar to a heating pad, only larger. This bed is solid with a fleece covering. My dog prefers to sleep on her cold cushioned bed. I tried putting her cushioned bed on top of this heated bed, but it didn't heat through. I've tried covering it with blankets, but she still prefers the cold cushion. I'll keep trying to entice her! Other than that, it is nice and warm, just not real cozy.

This rain coat is cute and serves the purpose. However, The extra large size was HUGE and the Large size is almost too small. The changes in size are drastic. The smell of it is like moth balls, gasoline and plastic which makes my dog smell that way. The smell does get somewhat better with time.

Have two almost 2 yr year old cats and this is far and away their favorite thing in the world. Works well every time for exercise and play. They cannot resist when it is taken out and they even seek it out when it is stored. (Should be stored away safely when not playing with your cat. Not intended for unsupervised use!). Feathers have an amazing flutter-action that drives them wild. They do beat up the "bird" quite a bit so I purchase the refills and replace as needed. Easy to replace, just clip on a new feather bird and back in business. A MUST HAVE!!!

The mat works great, if you are trying to keep a cat off of something, but not so well if you are trying to keep them from going outside. Unless the extension is bought, a cat can easily jump over the 30x16 inch mat.

My dog loved these treats but be aware that the Chicken treats reek! You must make sure the bag stays closed and always wash your hands right after touching them. You certainly don't want to walk around with these in your pocket. We didn't purchase these from Amazon but price is about what we paid.
my dog chew through the rope immediately and doesn't seem to be interested in playing with the ball part of it.

This cat box is the answer to many of the ordinary problems with regular cat boxes at a very reasonable price. It's much larger than a standard cat box so I'm finding that the "kitty karats" are more toward the center of the box as opposed to sometimes being on the edges. It's a simple design that functions like a self-cleaning cat box with very little manpower. Also, unlike the automatic, plug-in type of boxes, this uses no electricity nor does it have any parts that are likely to break down!
Chinchillas get way too hot way too easily, the lack of ventilation could kill them! This is not suitable for chinchillas.

I tried this product as an alternative to Advantage because my cats really protest application of that product. Altho I was relieved to see my 3 cats much more relaxed about the Frontline, and my own allergies did not kick up, I rated this product 'average.' Of the 2 applications, separated by 4 weeks, I noticed little to no reduction in the scratching in one cat, marginal reduction in the second, and the third cat was never bothered from the get-go. On a positive note, there is an almost undetectable scent that disappears within a day or so. Perhaps with continued application I may see improved results.

Good sturdy ramp supports a lot of weight and gives great traction to the animal but it is difficult and ackward to fold up and takes up a lot of room in the car. I would love this product if it came in a telescoping version.

I like this to hide the litterbox. It is nice looking and the cats like it. I wish that it had some kind of plastic coating on the inside to protect it. they tend to urinate and hit the walls on the inside of night stand.

by far this is the best flea/tick medication we have tried on the cat and dog. While it doesn't stop the ticks from biting, frontline does kill the ticks right away. They just have to be removed later on. But that's just how the ticks work and it cannot be helped. It does keep our kitty flea free all year round.

This isn't my first pet fountain I have never been satisfied with any of them until this one. I have had it a couple of weeks and just had to write a good review because I rely on reviews for most of my purchases. I have three thirsty cats and a big dog and it lasts almost a week between fills. It makes that drippy noise my cats love but has a flow control knob so I can adjust the flow of water and subsequently the amount of noise it creates. My favorite thing about it is its super freaking easy to clean, the motor comes out and it's all open so I was able to scrub the heck out of it without having to worry about water getting where it shouldn't. Lastly it has a long super sturdy cord. My pets love to drink out of it and I couldn't be happier.

Maybe I'm the only person with this experience, but my cats won't touch this thing. They scratch my couch, the cat pots, and pretty much anything else, but they literally will not touch this. I've put the catnip powder all over it, according to the directions, but I can't get them to scratch it. Maybe others will have better luck, but I'm returning mine.

This is a nice product, well designed in concept. Works as advertised, nice price, and worked great at first. Then began having problems - started making grinding noises (although this eventually went away), the gears ate one of the plastic bags in the liner tray (required taking the entire thing apart to peel away the wound bag, which was surprisingly easily caught), and then the tray stopped turning (turned out the motor and gears were clogged with litter and litter dust. The motor is now dead). Also, the tray with the litter does not hold the litter all that well - cat flicks it out every time so I have a nice mound of litter just outside the box. Sadly, the litter box is now dead and I'm buying a LitterRobot. I say sadly becaues I think with some relatively minor modifications (v2, if they come out with it) this could be a great machine and I'd consider buying it again. When not dead, the machine worked great and was very simple to operate and use.
Bought this product to curb some solitary barking, but my girl is a smart one and figured out that if she barked long enough, the spray would run out. I'm disappointed.

The last batch that I received were very brittle. I know that crunchy or hard is great for keeping dog teeth clean. But, I have a small dog approx. 7-8lbs who does not like it even in small pieces. I prefer to give them the dried meat products for strong muscles. The packages that are sold at the stores are far more expensive, so for the price, I will tolerate the brittleness of their favorite food.

I am using these aspen shavings for years and was always happy with them. However, for several months now I think that the quality has definitely changed for the worst. The shavings are much rougher, not as fresh smelling, and very(!) dusty now. I just wrote a complaint to Kaytee on their website. I am very disappointed and I will try to get a better brand.

My resident gray and red squirrels have yet to figure out how to get food out of this (after a couple months). However, it is not a favorite with the birds either. I have the occasional titmouse, chickadee, cardinal eat from it but only once or twice a day. It is filled with black oil sunflower and spanish peanuts.

Had used Frontline Top Spot since it came on the market. With 3 Catahoula Leopards I see no difference in performance between the 2 products... flea & tick free. K9 was recommenced by my vet so I gave it a try. I'm sold unless PetArmor is better.
My dog loves this bed so much she has chewed a hole in the middle. I've tried spraying with bitter apple but it hasn't helped.
I received this cool bed III two weeks ago, it is already broken (water leak)

We give these to our German Shephard daily, he likes them..so we're happy. We don't really know how much or if they are doing his joints any good..he has hip dysplasia..but still running and jumping. I will be re-ordering though. This is his first bottle!

The sides on the product were too high and our little dog did not like walking on it, thus the product was a waste and we are stuck using the pads themselves (and our dog peeing on the edge of the pad which results on her peeing on the floor). If you have a small dog, I would not use this product.

I thought this would stop more rain from getting on my dog than it did. His feet still get wet of course, but the hood doesn't stay on his head and it's difficult to get the back elastic straps to keep this straight on his back end. Overall, it keeps the bulk of his body dry, but be prepared to still wipe his belly, head, and feet.
My guy likes these. They deliver protein without lots of fat. And that's a good thing. Most seed and nut combos have lots of fat. I supplement his diet with these pellets as well.

I bought this over the counter at Petsmart because it was 15 dollars for 3 doses, and I have 3 cats. I applied it to all the cats, and when I noticed my calico, Aria, licking at her application site (even though it was right on skin behind her head between her shoulder blades).I did a quick search and found all kinds of horror stories of cats being hurt or even dieing from this product and others like it. So I kept a close watch on all 3 cats that evening, and while none had any severe symptoms, Aria and her brother, Octave, were more lethargic than usual, and poor Aria vomited twice.I wasn't comfortable leaving a known poison on my cats, plus it's greasy and wasn't drying at all, so I washed it off of all of them with dawn dish soap and warm water (oh boy, this is fun). While I did this, I noticed this junk just made all the fleas go to their heads. They were covered in fleas there. They did act less lethargic a couple of hours after washing it off. I just consider myself lucky nothing worse happened.Stick with vet-prescribed products like Frontline or Revolution, even if they cost more.
it did not state what voltage it was. Australia is 240v. if you post to Australia you need to send the correct voltage.

These are expensive dog kennels, I got that. But I have a special use for them, I use them in the baggage area of my 4 seat airplane. I put it in there, pop it up and my lab. is eager to jump right in and off we go. I like it as the dog has plenty of ventilation and the mesh screens keep dog hair in the kennel.

I was having trouble with one of the kittens that we brought home urinating on the beds. I found this litter and he loves it so much that he will sleep in the litter box (clean of course) just so he can be near it. Talk about attracting kittens! It doesn't smell like other clay litter either. I have allergies to dust and this stuff doesn't seem to bother me as much as the overly chemical clay litter does. Oh, and he uses it instead of the beds although I did have to make sure that there were lots of boxes to choose from.

The only way to keep this collar from eating up batteries is to literally turn it off when the dog is not outside. It has an on/off switch where you insert a coin to rotate it to the off position. They don't make this clear enough regarding battery, if they had I wouldn't have bought it. I got it because of the levels of correction. I already had collars and their batteries lasted up to 12 months but one dog needed something a little stronger.

I bought two treat dispensing toys. I have two Airedales and they both were excited by this toy and wanted to play with it even after the treats were gone. However, within minutes, my "chewer" had rendered it useless. The large kong is still intact and enjoyed. I previously had a Bobs a Lot and that lasted for many months until the chewer got the top off and chewed the neck of it. Really wish the Omega ball was longer lasting. It had great potential.

I agree with everyone else about this feeder being junk. I too had the problem with the screw top threads cracking, wrapped electrical tape around mine. Part of the filler top broke off & the bottom tray is now cracked. It is also hard to clean. Had this thing 4 months & will not buy this brand again. Big waste of money!

My dog destroys all toys, even Kongs, but this has survived since Christmas. The ends are frayed but it still squeaks! The squeaker is usually the first thing to go but both are still working. It great to spot in the snow unlike the many balls that won't be found until spring.

I have a beagle terrier mix, who loved plush toys, but would destroy them within minutes as a puppy. Many recommended the Hide-A-Bee because removing the bees from the hive would satiate her destructive tendencies. It took her a minute or two figure out how to remove the bees the first time, but she went right to destroying the individual bees, and I had to remove them from me. After her first time, she could remove the bees in less than 30 seconds and she was back to trying to remove the squeakers.I did not give it a terrible review, as it seems to work for many dogs, but if you do buy this toy expecting it to cure destructive chewers, you may be disappointed.
Five minutes in, one tentacle was bitten off, ball inside cracked in half. Not durable enough to be a dog toy. Disappointed :(. So is the dog :(.

I take 'treats' (ears) to my sister's dog whenever I go over there which is usually just once or twice a week. The entire time I was taking her pig's ears she was battling being overweight. After just one month of switching to cows ears she has lost 3 pounds and is much more active. I also like these ears because they are individually shrink wrapped which I'm sure keeps them fresher and they are less expensive than pig's ears too!!!!!!!!!!

I was very excited to purchase the Hide-A-Bee pet toy for my dogs but the excitement was short lived. I purchased two of them and within a couple of hours they had them shredded and had stuffing/squeakers all over the house. Both Rosie and Tinkerbell can be rough with toys but this is the first time I've ever witnessed them chewing a toy apart so quickly. After I cleaned up the mess Tinkebell found one of the squeakers she had hidden somewhere in the house and almost choked to death. I had to wedge my fingers in her mouth and perform a doggie heimlich to get it out....very scarey but thankfully she's okay now.I would NOT recommend this toy if you have strong chewers in your home and it was a big waste of money. I'll stick with the large rubber kongs for them from now on.

The gate was easy to install and fit the width of the opening exactly, however the metal brackets on top of the gate that holds the gate together in order to slide in and out started to come apart after a few use of opening and closing the gate. I had to reinforce the metal brackets with screws for it to stay on. Other than that the gate does its job with keeping my dogs on one side of the gate.
Works great for the scoop free litter box. The product cost $$$ -- too much so. A better option is to by the permaliner from a private company and by crystal litter cheap at Winco Foods.

This food has given my dog the softest shiniest coat! I adopted a really underweight pitbull mix 3 weeks ago, and he was really skinny. I can hardly see that dog now. He's filling out and looks so much healthier. After I feed him, he's always looking for more.(I saw some reviews about soft stools and initially thought it was the food; turns out it was parasites. Once he was medicated, his stools were fine.)

I'm not kidding when I say I opened the outer mailing package and there was a dead flea on the box. Kind of ironic really--but gross.This product is really good and a great help in fighting fleas. It's oral which is easier for my cats. The seller wasn't good. The package was flatten since it wasn't in a good mailer. I mentioned the dead flea already. Also, the ad didn't mention that this was the European version. I mean that's the same active ingredient and all, but I don't know my cats' weight in kilograms! Why the European version and not the domestic one?

Worked alright at first. Very convenient for people who are not home all day. The receptacle is fairly small, and with two cats, I was changing it more often than I'd imagine. The piece all together is much larger than I imagined as well.It has recently stopped functioning. I called customer service, which was a nightmare, and it is still not working. When you call, there is an insane wait. The lady I spoke to was understanding and helpful.

This thing is horrible. I have to clean it every week. I only have one cat and for the 1st month she refused to use it and peed on our carpet. Now she uses it but only if it is not saturated in urine. If it is then, it's back to the carpet. The litter is very expensive and changing it completely every week will not work for me. I purchased the forever tray and the litter is about $15 a bag every 1 1/2 weeks or so. I'm looking into buying something else.

This scratching post costs a little bit more than the cheaper shorter carpet scratching posts, but it's worth it because a cat will actually use this one. It's tall and sturdy and cats love the material. With the cheaper scratching posts, they are less sturdy and fall over, scaring cats from ever using it. You don't have to worry about that with this one. Cats love this!

I am so disappointed with this cheap product. I bought one of these a few years ago and my cats really liked it. It broke a long time ago. I bought this new one and I cannot tell you how cheap this is. What a waste of money! The feather comes off even though it has some kind of (obviously cheap) glue on it. The stick part is in two parts and I have no idea why! The second the cat bats at it, it falls off. The top of the stick will go flying off about 5 minutes in even if a cat doesn't bat at it because it is in two pieces. I have never been so disappointed with a cat toy. I really wish I didn't buy it. I also bought replacement feathers. So, I spent a lot of money and it's just a piece of crap. I will not buy this again. I gave it 3 stars because when it isn't being a piece of crap, my cats like it.

It used to be that when I let my dog outside, she would go do her business, drink some water, then go bark at the sky, or a tree, or a bush, or a ... you name it. When the doorbell rang, she would launch into a fit of barking and wouldn't stop sometimes even after she discovered who was at the door. I hooked this collar on her and rang the doorbell. She barked one time, the collar sprayed, and she stopped. I tried it again about 5 min later with the same results. I put her outside, she did her normal routine... then I heard one bark out of her before she stopped. She walked around patrolling the yard, but this time instead of being a nuisance, she did it quietly.I remove the collar when she comes back inside. The collar is easy to adjust and the clip is easy to release and attach.UPDATE: 12/17/2012As of 12/3/2012 (less than one month!) the Collar has stopped working. At first it appeared the battery was bad, so I bought some "Petsafe" brand replacements at my local store. After installing them, the collar worked one time and never worked again. I have tried several different batteries, thinking that might be the issue, but now I suspect the microphone inside the collar is out.Will contact the manufacturer for help and update as necessary.As an interesting side note, the petsafe website has a battery replacement plan where they send you a new battery every 3 months over a 12 month period. On the same page is a not stating that one can expect the battery to last 1-2 months.

My puppy loved to play with this toy but it only lasted a week and a half so I'm not sure if it was worth it. It came with a replacement ball which was nice. Maybe my puppy was just too rough with it but one arm was torn off by the second day.

The wipes were not very wet, perhaps not enough wiping fluid packaged inside. Even though the roll of wipes were sealed inside a plastic bag inside the container, it was still not very wet. The roll was difficult to separate each wipe, have to pull and damage the next wipe. Don't know how well it actually works, but at least my cats don't mind when I try to wipe their front teeth and gums. Don't really notice any minty scent.

I bought this pump after reading hyped up reviews by others and inflated product specifications from the manufacturer. It does not deliver anywhere near as much air as promised, no matter where I set the control screw. I've had better luck with pumps that cost me less than half what this one did, so I will stick with those in the future.
The retraction on the leash is a little slow now, and we've only had it a few months. I'm hoping it doesn't completely give out for a long time, but we'll have to wait and see.

I bought this bed for our outdoor dogs. I plugged the bed in and waited about 45 minutes and it just does not seem to be that warm? I am not sure the dogs are even going inside the dog house to take advantage of the bed, but I keep hoping once they lay on the bed and feel the little warmth that comes from the bed they will start staying in the dog house in the evening.

I bought this harness on the recommendation of my puppy's trainer. She helped me fit it on the dog. It does help with pulling, but it's really hard to fit on my dog. The shoulder and belly strap fit OK, but the chest strap droops even at the tightest adjustment . When I walk the dog, the leash slides to the side and even to the back. My puppy is a 6 month old Havanese wighting 9 pounds. I purchased the petit size, but I think her chest is too narrow for a proper fit. It also seems to rub her behind the front legs. I gave a 3 rating, because the harness works if the fitting is good.

I bought this thermometer for my 75 gallon tank. It does not give an accurate temperature reading. It is about 1.4 degrees off higher than the actual temp. It does not have a way to calculate it so I took it out of the aquarium and it is in a closet already. I do not recommend.

It would have been better for the vertical bars to be spring loaded for installation purposes. It is hard to put together and install in the back of a minivan for someone with back issues. My dogs blew right through it and ended up in the front seat before we knew it (they're Aussies, so go figure) Also, it leaves marks in the ceiling of my van that I can't get out. Not thrilled with the design. So far it hasn't been very useful, but I will keep trying.
Not the quality I get of Hartz brand at Walmart. Very disappointed with this orders quality. I will not order this again.

First of all, I want to start out by saying that I would have given this kennel more stars had it arrived in better condition. The thing was not shipped in a box at all, but simply taped and wrapped in a thick gray plastic. The top and bottom were stacked together as usual, but a small part of one of the corners of the top section was broken off. When I bolted the kennel together, the two broken pieces were bolted to the bottom section and I was able to Super Glue them together. I have used the kennel twice and don't think this will be a problem. I needed the kennel pretty badly, and didn't want to wait for the return/replacement.I already owned two of the XLarge Ultra Fashion Petmate Vari Kennels, and this Giant kennel was just as easy to assemble as these; however, the top and bottom sections do not join in the same way as the Ultra Fashions do. I tried to locate a Giant Ultra Fashion Petmate kennel but was unable to do so. I am not picky about the color of the Giant, but was disappointed that it did not fit together like the Ultra Fashions, which can be seen here:Petmate Vari Kennel Ultra Fashion, XLarge, Bleached Linen/Coffee Grounds. I think these possibly are more sturdy because of the way in which the top section of the Ultra Fashion fits over the bottom section's rim.(I wish I could explain better; those who have assembled these things before probably understand.)I will agree with the reviewer who said that these crates are not made as sturdy as they used to be; I guess that goes for a lot of things today. I have had a great deal of success with them, though, by training my dogs when they are very young puppies to accept them. They then go on to be successfully crated when grown. Of course, one doesn't always have this option when they adopt/buy an older dog.This crate is advertised for large breeds such as mastiffs, Great Danes, etc.; I would question whether some of the grown versions of the giant breeds would be comfortable in this thing for extended periods, although it is exactly the dimensions advertised, but I could not accurately give an opinion on this. I have a female Cane Corso/Rottweiler cross who weighs about 90 pounds and who is about 25-26 inches high. She would be very comfortable in this Giant kennel for probably about 3-4 hours, which is as long as I like for grown animals to be crated before a break; of course, puppies have to be relieved more often than that. I also have two young coonhound pups (pets) who have been trained to crate together since puppyhood.I have used the kennel twice for this purpose, and it has worked out very well.Again, I would have given this kennel four stars except for the poor packaging and damaged condition, even though it did arrive speedily. To sum up: this kennel is a good buy for the money; there are heavier duty kennels out there and they cost accordingly. I am happy with it and feel that it is as advertised. If your dogs are trained to accept the crate, and you use it responsibly, I think you will be happy with it. Again, it is not heavy duty and probably would not stand much abuse from unhappy and rambunctious dogs.

Do not buy this dryer if you are looking for a quiet dryer. I purchased this dryer because a couple of reviews on this site said the dryer was very quiet. That is not true. This thing is as noisy as a cheap leaf blower. Anyone that says it is quiet is either working for the manufacturer or have their hearing aid turned off. If you want a very effective and quick dryer, then this is a good buy. I purchased it to dry my husky puppy. He hates the noise (so do I) but after a restraining him and feeding lots of treats, he is slowly learning to tolerate the noise. The dryer does work very well. It drys my husky completely in about 20 minutes. I have no intention of returning the dryer. Knowing how well it works I can tolerate the noise. So if you want a very effective dryer, buy this one but, be warned, it is NOT QUIET.

At first we really like the comfort of the fleece-lined handle. Then 6 months later one of leashes came apart at turnbuckle swivel. The pin broke off. We had another nylon leash 10 years old with a large turnbuckle, so we cut it off and had a shoe shop sew it on the Hemp leash with a leather belt strap. Problem fixed. Then a few weeks ago we were walking our dogs (One is a Whippet and the other an IG) on a sidewalk next to a busy street and the other leashes turnbuckle broke exactly the same as the other. This time we came very close to losing a very expensive sight hound. I went to the company web site and wrote a detailed message to them teling them of the defective turnbuckle swivels weeks ago and so far no reply. These are small and medium dogs and I was using their wide leash for large dogs. This is a serious problem and it should be addressed immediately by the company. These are great leashes but the turnbuckle swivels are defective.It is now September, and still no reply from the company. I would not even think of purchasing this product again unless the supplier gives notice that they have addressed the issue with a better quality turnbuckle.

I had high hopes when looking at the adds and certain reviews for this deshedding treatment. My Turkish Angora cat sheds a lot, and I was excited the first time I used the product set--the amount of fur that was removed during the shampooing and treatment was impressive, as was the additional hair removed with the brush when she was dry. I could have easily created one of those pictures that the company offers, with the groomed pet surrounded by huge amounts of removed fur.However, it did nothing to curb shedding afterwards. She still sheds as much as ever, and I found the smell from the conditioner to be very strong. Perhaps if I keep using the treatment it will make more of a difference, but I was initially disappointed.

Length:: 1:34 MinsI bought these because they are low calorie, so I can stuff a bunch into Poodle's treat puzzles without feeling guilty. He LOVES the cheese flavor (the only one I have tried so far). He stays quiet when being groomed if given liberal amounts of them. Great amount in the bag for the price too. According to their page on FaceBook, they are only 3 calories per treat. In the video you can see Poodle getting treats out of a bottle, it is a mix of kibble, someCostless Pet Treats Duck Breast Fillets, 32-Ounceand Charlee Bear Cheese and Egg treats. You can see that the treats fit whole into the opening of the bottle, so they are not all that big. This is a fun way to get him some mental exercise and I watch him so he doesn't chew up the bottle.

I love how much bubbles it makes and how effective it is! It's pretty easy to use. The only downside is that, when you accidentally pull it out of the gravel, it's kinda hard to bury it down again unless you soak your hands inside the aquarium. Digging through the gravel just to bury this (again, especially when you just barely did a partial water change) sometimes makes the water so cloudy. But all in all, it's a great aerating disk! It doesn't bother my fish at all.

Sorry I can't give this stuff a screaming good review. Maybe catnip is a sort of personal thing as our cat Tasha has shown great interest in catnip filled mice in the past but this catnip she's ambivalent to. Hence why I can only give the product a neutral three stars. I stuffed a catnip mouse with this product and she checked the freshly filled mouse out but showed a nearby older catnip laced mouse more interest. I placed a small amount next to her on the back patio and yes, after two sessions, she ate it all but other than laying there, she seemed not to be affected by the catnip. I fed some catnip to her a second time and she ate a bit but in the end, blew the rest of the catnip off. In the morning while my wife and I are on the patio for coffee, Tasha's more animated in her morning play without then with.In summary, I can't say it's not good catnip, I can only say that Tasha didn't show a whole lot of interest in this product. I guess like beer, everybody has their product preferences and for her, this doesn't seem to be knocking her socks off. I'm currently looking at other catnip products, including sprays and extract oils. FWIW, if we wanted, we can get this same product at our local pet store for a bit less then here; including California sales tax, $5.50. When one takes into consideration the price of gas coupled to the time it takes to shop for a product of this kind, this is a reasonably priced product. I'll keep trying to interest Tasha in this product as I'm not going throw the catnip away. And if she shows more than a passing interest, I'll stop by, change my star rating and amend what I've written here. Until then, hope my above helps with your shopping decision.

So I am 68 and my knee has begun giving out on me! It feels stiff and I did not injure it. It just began this stabbing pain if I turned it a certain way sometime after Christmas. I read the reviews on this and forgot about the word, "tablets." These things are so BIG , so HARD and , although I am able to swallow them , pills make me feel sort of nauseated. Not small ones; just horse pills like these. I will have to throw these out and will buy CAPSULES instead.I have taken 6 of these, one pill twice a day for 3 days and today my knee feels SO MUCH BETTER. I will still stop taking them since last night I got the Doctors' Best CAPSULES. But I admit to being thrilled with the overnight , dramatic improvement (so far) with this knee. I attribute it to these horse pills and am hoping the capsules work as well.

I have been using this product for over a year. My dog has dysplasia and was in quite a bit of pain. This product has helped her enormously, so much so that I am using it on my other two dogs as well.
This is a good product. It has helped stop the barking. You need to be fairly close for it to work. The dogs don't like it, but do not seem injured in any way.
Have purchased from others---no comparison! Medi-Vet is cost competitive, good ship time and cost, and my product arrives in sealed reliable condition! Thanks Medi-Vet!
This gate is not a sturdy one. Would not recommend this gate to anyone. Had to buy a sturdier one.
I got this for my brothers dogs, but his wife loved it so much she won't let them touch it.
Best deshedding tool I've tried. On the first use, removed a huge amount of fur. Now there is much less fur around the house!

When I first gave this to my mice, I noticed they seemed to be struggling to get water from it. Thinking it was either defective or they had to learn how to adapt to a new bottle, I gave them some time and added a water dish to supplement the water bottle. I don't know if the bottle ever worked properly, because about a week and a half later I came home to find that the bottle had leaked all over the cage. I tried to refill it a few times and it continued to leak. I even followed the BS troubleshooting instructions on Super Pet's website, instructing you to "fill it all the way to provide the best suction" and that didn't work either.I got scammed!

One of my dogs is a heavy and constant chewer. She loves these toys. They hold up pretty well. She has worn the first one down so that it's no longer the shape it started in, but it hasn't cracked and has held up to her crazy amount of chewing. We've since purchased a second toy and now she alternates between her old favorite and her new favorite. I would highly recommend these for anyone with a dog who LOVES to chew!
Works great.I was charged shipping, despite the "ships for FREE with Super Saver Shipping" subtitle.

I prefer Chlorahexidine based shampoos and conditioners for dermatitis issue skin but Hydrocortizone is often more readily availableand for basically healty skin with minor itchy allergy problems its a good product. It did not help any of my severe allergy dogs sores,hot spots, bumpy backs, etc and I've had allergy dogs for 20 years so have tried MANY different products. I would use this whensevere problems are under control as more a maintenace conditioner.
Ordering these refills in the 5 pack is definitely the way to go. Shipping was very quick, so kitty is happy.
The pills worked great and they were sent to me faster then I expected. Price was super and cat is doing great.

i bought this a while back and its taken me a bit to review but they did a great job processing and shipping out my product, great condition and great speed, was 1 day earlier than on time so good stuff all around thanks again !!

I have an INSANE German Shepherd that paces, 'air snaps', whines and howls non-stop. Its beyond irratating. We will be flying him on a 14hr flight and I bought these pills to keep him from ripping his kennel to shreds and roaming the cargo bay of the plane. He ALWAYS tears out of his kennel and hurts himself severly...even with zip ties. Needless to say, at 2 pills nothing...still paces & bites the kids when they move. 3 pills he lays down occasionally when NOTHING in the house moves...but as soon as the kids move an inch he is up scratching, grunting and being annoying. I'm worried to increase the dose more. He is only 65lbs. But I'm thinking for the flight we will give him 5 pills. *shakes head*

I have used the LitterMaid for many years, and, until recently, it was fine. Now, instead of 3 br, 2 bath house, with a garage or laundry room where I could put my noisy Littermaid, I live in a small 1 br, 1 bath apartment. The only place I could find to put my Littermaid was in my small bathroom. It takes up almost the entire wall between the door and the tub. And my bathroom is located in my bedroom area next to the walk-in closet. So, needless to say, my main complaint is THE NOISE of the unit. It's so loud, it sounds like it is next to my bed. Also, I've had to replace my Littermaid every 2-3 yrs. This time I bought the Elite Mega, hoping the ion air cleaner would help with the smell. Nope, doesn't work. Especially with Poop. In fact, sometimes I wonder if isn't blowing the smell out, because numerous times it has smelled like my cats have pooped somewhere else.Other complaints:1: My cats, I have 3, btw, all seem to like to dig to the very bottom. So, most of the time, I have to manually rake the litter off the tray, because the unit will hit the wet litter that wasn't able to clump, and there will be a loud clicking noise over and over again as the unit tries to rake up the mess. Then the rake stops and returns to the back of the unit and starts all over again. If I'm nearby, I have to run in, hit the on/off button to stop it, then rake up the litter. Not only that, but sometimes my cats will urinate on the litter and the rake, so the unit doesn't even work. At least 3 to 4 times a day I have to use the scoop to clean the litter from around the rake, then hit the on/off button. Of course, then there are little clumps left behind. I finally had to hunt down a special sifter scoop to get rid of these little clumps the rake doesn't pick up.2. As the receptacle fills up, it tends to separate from the unit, so there is space open to the floor below. At least once a week, I have to vacuum up at least 1 to 2 cups of litter that has fallen through the crack. And, with 3 cats, I have to empty the receptacle every 2 to 3 days. It's too expensive to replace the receptacle every 3 days, so I put a recyclable grocery bag in the receptacle, and it works fine. Still doesn't reduce the amount of litter underneath too much, but it's better. I just close the bag and discard it.3. The sleep timer doesn't work. It doesn't seem to be able to differentiate between am and pm. Twice I thought the unit was broken, the blue light and the power light kept blinking. Turns out the sleep timer had activated, but you can't turn it off. I had to wait almost 24 hours for the unit to start working again.4. I still have to dust buster my bathroom floor every day because litter still gets tracked and thrown all over, esp. if I try filling the box to the recommended level with litter. And, there isn't a litter brand out there that doesn't track. Trust me. I've tried them all. Oh, and the privacy tent lasted about 1 week before I tossed it. First, it tore at the metal bracing while I was trying to attach it to the unit. Then it covered the back of the unit where the on/off button and rake are, which became a pain when I had to remove it every time I needed to remove the rake to clean it.So, this leads me to the RAKE! YAY! It's removable. That's the only good thing about this unit. Otherwise, the rake sucks. The tongs are too far apart, so you have no choice but to use the very flimsy scoop that comes with. I tried. I still had the scoops from my older unit, and attempted to use them. Nope, they won't fit. The scoop that comes with this unit, has a tooth bent in the wrong direction now, and if I try to move it to the correct position, it will break off.So, there you have it. Don't waste your money. If you must have a Littermaid, buy one the older models. This one isn't worth the money. Or the aggravation.
It does work, but if forget to put on your bed, sofa, chair, etc, they I'll jump right back up. But it is deter even I it's not turned on.

We've been giving our two cats 2 capsules sprinkled on their food at each feeding time and have noticed a difference in the energy levels of both of them. They do play more and seem to be more active. Our senior cat doesn't seem to mind jumping up and down from the bed as much now, too.
My dog usually tears the cheap plastic frisbees apart in five minutes, but this lasted about a month. So, it's definately not indestructible, but it lasts longer than most frisbees.
This works with my fish tank filter and only need to be changed once a month if you do good up keep.

Ok, I gave this 4 stars and I will tell you why. Yes, this is cruel for fish. However, sea monkeys can live so comfortably in it. So don't use this for fish who will only freak out and die because of lack of movement. For Sea monkies and microscopic protozoa, it's great. And better yet, It makes one hell of an ant farm and worm farm. And why not put it in your wall to breed maggots or bloodsuckers? I mean you might as well breed termites too. Watch them as they go from pupae to larvae to termite. Once they mature, they can eat through your walls making room for the new generation.This isn't what you had in mind? Why not use this as a septic tank in your wall. Everytime you flush, you can watch your chocolate corncobs and other 'boom-boom' you make float around and disipate into flavorful and colorful particles. Its like your own organic confetti. This aquarium is amazing for these types of things. I highly recommend it to any ignorant yupnut out there. For more info...do a search on Jennicartoon on google and see more ideas for this tank.I love you,

I picked up a similar toy for my black lab from Target. She loved it like any dog would. As we're playing, the handly moved. What was underneath the handle? A melange of industrial glue and tape, and rather than being woven together like normal ring toys, it's held together with a large staple.

My cats have been on Hill's Science Diet since they came home as kittens. This food is great and keeps them very healthy, it's what the vet has always recommended and I've stuck with for my cats. I get the big bag because it's easier to store it in a large air-tight container near their food and not have to worry about buying food every other week or so. So glad to see this on Amazon Prime now, I used to have to go out of my way to speciality pet stores just to get it as places like PetCo out here don't always carry it.EDIT/UPDATE: My oldest cat is turning 6 this year and my younger one will be 4 later this year. Both are still very healthy, active, and not overweight.

My dog is half Lab and half GSP and has a Labrador's coat. This tool is very effective and my dog seems to like it. It is a bit messy as the teeth are unable to capture all the fur (it produces a lot of fur!). Also it has a static charge and afterward my dog gives me tiny shocks when I pet him. But he doesn't seem to notice and it is only immediately afterward. I have never used any other deshedding tool so I don't know how it compares but it is far better than just brushing and I am happy with my purchase.

i have not used long enough to know if it is helping, but i suspect it is. after receiving it i researched and found out it was an antibiotic. i do not like the idea of using an antibiotic without a doctors approval so will probably not use again. in any event, you have to use so much it would be way more expensive to continue than dealing with a few tear stains as it is strictly cosmetic and my dog is a pet, not a show dog.

The wattage on this is a bit weak for my frog habitat; however, my bulb holder specifies a 40w max and I could not find any of that wattage. This bulb is a long tube-shaped bulb, not the bulb pictured. If your habitat is a foot or more tall, this lamp may not provide enough power; otherwise, it is a good bulb.

NO DEAD FISH! That's always the first good thing when adding something new to an aquarium.I have been having horrible problems with ammonia in my 55 gallon tank. I have tried multiple solutions with little to no success ranging from partial water changes to chemicals. The HBH Aqua Pure Ammonia filter pad has done an excellent job. I still have slight traces of ammonia, but ammonia at .25 to .5 ppm of ammonia is a lot better than 4.0+ ppm.Just to fill you in, I have had this tank operating just fine for about 2 years. It was very well cycled. I do not use an RO system to filter the water, but I do filter the water to remove chloramines and other contaminants. The ammonia level in the filtered water is typically .5 ppm. Not great, but manageable. I typically do partial water changes of 10 to 15 gallons just to get rid of excess waste. But, recently and for some unknown reason, the ammonia started to spike. Same fish, so nothing has changed. I tested the water and it's the same. So, I don't have an explanation for the spike in ammonia.Other ammonia removers with partial water changes just were not doing the trick. This has been by far the best and easiest solution.Best of all the fish are healthy, eat well, and don't appear to have any problems.At some point I will probably invest in a good RO system to help with the elimination of ammonia completely.
This is the one container that none of the pests could get into. Even the mice or rats could not chew through the walls to get to the food.

I was really excited about receiving this because I figured that since the litter box was such good quality, this would be much better than the mats you can buy for MUCH less money to attempt to keep litter from getting everywhere...This is very big and a gaudy color, so I went out on a limb and bought it even though I hated the appearance because my cat throws so much litter everywhere, it drives me nuts. Not only does it not slow him down at all (he literally gets that crap everywhere), because it's the crystal kind, t hurts really bad walking through the kitchen with bare feet and the litter is more noticeable. I have to sweep or use the hand vac all the time just to get the litter our of the floor so it doesn't look messy. I'm not thrilled with this product.

have used both frontline and advantix use advantix now. just pulled a giant tic off my dogs head leaving a huge sore. will have to take to vet tommorrow. will send the rest of my advantix back to maufacture with a letter telling them where to put it. does not stop tics from biting. dog gets walked at park not deep woods will buy frontline from now on.

The concept of this carrier is fantastic - it has a base, like a child's car seat, that you strap into the car and then put the carrier into. I really like how stable this makes the carrier in the car, much better than sitting it on the seat or trying to buckle it in with the seatbelt directly. We've enjoyed snapping the carrier in and out of the car so easily, and sometimes just leave the base in for days or weeks when we will be moving our cats around a lot.But as with any innovative product, it takes a few iterations to get it all worked out. We've found three significant issues with the carrier: the door doesn't always stay latched, the round porthole up top is just inviting a cat to pop out, and the bottom of the carrier has several holes hidden under the included pad. The first two are manageable - check the door twice before taking the carrier outside (we've had a couple of surprises), and I saw at least one other person has duct-taped the porthole. I don't really think the carrier needs that porthole. The holes in the bottom were a much more horrible surprise. One of our cats relieved herself on the way back from the vet, and it went straight out of the carrier, though the base, and all over our upholstery. The carrier was nearly dry, while we had to pull out the car's back seat entirely and sop up urine underneath it. Disgusting, it took a while to get the smell of urine out of the seat and the car itself. I wouldn't expect any carrier to fully contain a big accident, but I also didn't expect the carrier to have several holes in the bottom to let it drain out! Pets have accidents, especially in stressful situation. We're looking into ways to plug up those holes to prevent any future issues.

We were having problems with our male dog making big yellow spots in the grass with his urine. So I tried these tablets and they work so good. We do not have a problem anymore. I highly recommend this product.

My pup loves this item.But I was disappointed. The advertising is deceptive. The picture for the product shows two of the kneecaps and it is not shown in the packaging. It says that the items are 3-4 inches each. Farther down the page, it says that the item is 8 oz. It never says how many there are. The advertising implies that there are 2 kneecaps that are 3-4 inches each. Wrong! You get one kneecap for $6.00. Finally, the ad says that it weighs 8 oz, the package says 2.5 oz and the actual weight is 6 oz.I will not buy another Jones product for my animal and will be very cautious when purchasing anything from NYC Pet Supply and fulfilled by Amazon.You can buy Ranch Reward 5 pack for $9.99 ($1.99 ea) here at Amazon. That will be my next purchase.
This place NEVER credited me when I sent it back because of size. What is the deal with this company??!!
THIS TOY ONLY LIVED FOR 5 MINUTES AND MY ROTTWEILER PUP SAM ATE IT. SO I DON"T RECOMMEND THIS TOY FOR ANY DOG THAT CHEWS AND OR IS ROUGH WITH THEIR TOYS. THE STUFFING COMES RIGHT OUT.

I got this thinking it would make lots of noises, but it really only makes one type of noise. You really have to shake the ball hard in order for it to make noise, so it's a toy you can shake to get your dog excited, but then when you set it down for them to play with it, it goes silent. I have 2 50-lb terrier mix doggies with lots of long wirey hair. No, it's not the best brush for removing hair (it does remove some) but the main reason I bought it was the claim of freshening your pet. And I find that it does a GREAT job of that. After I brush the dogs they smell fresh and clean. I recently bought a Furminator deshedding tool and that works GREAT to remove the excess hair. I highly recommend it. So after using the Furminator, I brush them with the ionic brush and they look and smell great. It does emit a very high-pitched tone that I couldn't hear until I held it right up to my ear. One dog didn't mind it in the least, the other ran away at first. So we brushed him awhile with it turned off, and while he was enjoying being brushed we were able to turn it on without scaring him away. We just brushed him lower on his back and not by his ears until he got used to the sound. After that, no problems at all. If this brush conks out I will DEFINITELY buy another one. It just does a wonderful job of making them smell fresh and clean.

I bought this for my 13lb Boston Terrier. She can pull with the best and instantly becomes a sled dog when fitted with a regular harness. I researched no-pull harnesses for days and decided on this one based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews. Now I have used the harness regularly for over a week, I cannot give it more than 3 stars - here's why:(1) Annoying to fit. I knew this before I bought it, but seriously, I spent a good hour trying to fit it just perfectly.(2) The straps get loose after you use it one to two times, so you have to refit the harness often.(3) The harness decreases pulling but does not make my dog walk like an angel by any means. (side note: we are going to puppy classes which has helped somewhat.) The first times she lunged at a couple other dogs, she fell on her face, flipped over, and kept tripping on the leash. While I suppose that could deter her from lunging, it was an unpleasant experience. The other dog owners were questioning why I was letting her be so destructive to herself, but I really had no control over it. She was in the zone where no amount of food or instruction would help. She does not pull to this extreme anymore, but she knows just how much she can pull without getting into that sort of trouble.(4) Probably the most disappointing of it all - CHAFFING. It was my fault that I continued to use the harness after I thought I noticed it was making her belly/armpits lose hair, but I honestly wasn't sure. She didn't seem to hurt or be bothered by the harness and she has pretty short, thin hair on her chest/armpits/belly. Then yesterday evening, after a number of long walks and going to puppy training class, I noticed she had quarter-sized raw areas under her armpits! I was horrified! This apparently is a common problem with this harness.I like that this harness did discourage lunging and pulling hard, as compared to my other traditional harness which seemed to encourage pulling... But the chaffing issue is still a problem. I'm toying with the idea of sewing sherpa or felt around the chest and armpit area to see if it helps, but I'm not betting on it.

My dog goes balistic every time she sees a squirrel so I got her this for Christmas. She just looked at it like it was stupid and went on. It was not enough squirrel like for her I guess. The sound that it makes though entertained my 3 year old cousin though for hours.

We really like the design and the use of a harder plastic material for this covered litter box. (And the two halves are fully engaged when this happens). YMMV

When testing to see how low the water has to be before loosing suction I found out that if the 60 oz container goes below 30 oz it stops pumping and the water pump cavitated and made noise. The water pump is to high above the water level and will do damage to that pump if you do not keep it full.

i didn't even notice much of a difference, but i was using mrs. allen's shed stop, a deshedding shampoo, a deshedding brush, AND this spray- so i'm not sure which worked or maybe ALL worked, but the shedding is DEFINITELY improved.

when I underwent surgery on my vocal cords (two days ago) rendering my unable to talk for a week, my husband bought me the hartz nature collection "beaver". sure, most people get a dignified bell to ring, but i use my beaver to "SQUEAK" to my family that i need something. now, when my family starts to walk away from me, i just grab the handy-dandy beaver and let out a couple of "SQUEAK"s. my dog always, always pops his head up. very attentive, that one. sometimes more than my family. i am somewhat concerned that the family may just think the dog is playing with his new toy (he got some sort of new lamb type toy that has a squeak in every leg) as it makes more sound than the beave (as i like to call it). however, 48 hours into this non-talking journey has proven my beave to be very useful in grabbing the attention of others. i may even take it shopping with me later: if i encounter a shopper who is blocking the aisle, i can "SQUEAK" 'em. i think forever more, my family may think i am communicating to them when they hear a dog-toy "SQUEAK".now i must caution any other husband compelled to purchase a "beaver" for his wife when she is unable to talk. one must be very assured of the relationship to buy a "beaver" for his wife. i however, am a very self-assured woman, who also has two white boards, a text to voice app for my phone and convincing gesticulations to communicate my feelings to my husband. in other words, i have other words.

I bought this crate pad because of the good reviews it received. Now it has arrived and it does seem like a nice cushion for the price. However, It is made in China. I want to buy American as much as possible, so I'm sending it back.

This is the best car seat for our little dog. She can see out the window and does not get car sick any more! She enjoys car rides now. The seat is soft and attaches to the car seat belt with a strap that you hook up to the collar or harness on your dog.

It appears that to be effective, the user of this devise must be just a few feet from the animal. Personally, I don't care to get "thisclose" to a biting dog. I think carrying a big stick or golf club would work much better.

Unfortunately the sleep sack did not come with a hook to attach it to the cage, causing our ferrets to drag it down to their litter box the first night. Fleas are a tough bug to beat. I wont say this is a horrible product as it has worked in my parents home. I will say, however, that you need to choose your product wisely or you will be spending a fortune. In my 1,000 sq ft apt with 12 ft ceilings and wood floors, three cans did not work or seem to make a dent. If I had 6 cans, maybe it would have gone better. But I was not going to spend that much.I wouldn't recommend this product for an infestation or a home with high ceilings. I'm actually not sure what I would recommend this product for.

It came fresh and about a week later. I will order from there again.

Forget this one. Unlike the Panic Mouse, (TONS more fun), this one just goes round and round in a circle- and it's hard to adjust the speed. Sounded like a great time, but seriously, the cats were bored in a minute. A real yawn.

Purchased a couple of these to try out. Were vacuum packed in plastic individually and terribly hard to open. They were very small in size for the price and the dogs ate them within a minute. Usually a regular 8"-10" lasts them for 10-15 mins. Would not buy again for that price.

This thing is far from 'quite'. Not sure how loud the other reviewers pump was, but this thing makes a racket in my opinion. And no, it doesn't seem broken at all. This is probably how all of them sound.Not only does it emit a very low frequency 'buzz' that resonates all throughout my apartment (much louder than my fridge), but there is a high pitch buzzing noise as well. This thing is driving me crazy, I am probably going to have to buy/make some kind of sound dampening box or something to put this in because it's buzzing is one of the most annoying sounds I have ever heard in my life.Using my SPL meter, this thing is running at about 70dB.Aside from that it seems to run fine, gets a little warm though.

"The rating is toward the product I purchased, the item arrived on time and we did not experience any difficulty with the seller of the item. We have had the bed for less than 1 month and it has fallen apart. The bed is simply a piece of shaped foam with a cover on it. Not exactly the description I read. When my dog tries to get comfortable on the bed, the cover slips off. The foam began chunking off w/in 1 week. It had an awful smell when it arrived that took at least 2 weeks to air out. I do not recommend this product as it is a waste of money."

One of the few things I have bought that the ole hound seems to like the taste of...now thats a switch. The jury is still out and after a few days there is no problem having my best bud take em. Time will tell and will update accordingly. From all the natural things I have seen..garlic and for some reason that is no surprize.. I mean really.. who likes smelling garlic.. you really can't blame the bugs.. nobody I know likes to stay in a small area with a garlic eating thing...so that may be the whole point..apart from that..on the yeast deal I have noticed my dog seems to like beer a lot more...now when she hears a top pop she queues up for a swaller....friend or foe.***UPDATE*** 7/7/2012 After using this product for several weeks (after a good bath with Halo mixed with DeFlea) haven't seen more than one flea in a week.Prior to using this fleas have been a large problem to the point of distraction and even daily baths only held then off to the next day. Using this product has shown a marked improvement in control to the point of daily combing with a flea comb just to check and see has left me with the thought that this thing really works. My dog is rather small and only use 1 tablet daily broken in half at a time and to be honest I was astonished at the results. It seems that taken internally the tab exudes a scent that fleas would rather not be a part of with no noticeable odor on the dogs part to my human nose. All and all I highly reccomend this and as dogs have different metabolisms and what not it may not be a cure all for all dogs but it sure does work on my best pal.

My hamster lived in this cage pretty comfortably for two years. She seemed content with it, and I liked its expandability and flexibility. She was very excited moving from her tank to a big, spacious wire cage. I purchased some add-ons as well, which she loved. A cage with a lot of of interchangeable parts made it possible to switch up her environment from time to time and keep her entertained.But let me warn you: Cleaning this thing is a nightmare. You basically have to disassemble the entire thing just to dump the base. It never wants to come off smoothly or easily, because there are four different pieces of wall sliding in every direction. And putting it back together is no fun either. Every time you get something to lock into place, something ELSE slips. It is an endless cycle of frustration. Many foul words were uttered in the general direction of this cage.On top of all that, the roof of the cage doesn't really stay on-- it just sits kind of sits there awkwardly. I was afraid this was going to be an escape problem, but it never was... I'd be cautious, regardless, if you have a particularly ambitious hamster. My cage may have been manufactured incorrectly but the higher door on the cage wasn't actually accessible because the roof sits down in front of where it's supposed to open.The plastic is... iffy. I really wished they had used a softer, more flexible plastic instead of this brittle stuff. I broke a lot of little pieces off of the cage just trying to get things to come apart. There's really no way to pull off tubes without exerting HULK-SMASH amounts of force, so you end up Hulk-breaking-little-chips-off every once in a while. Most of the damage I did to the cage was superficial, but the latch and hinge on the top compartment gave up and broke. I had to order another one from SuperPet (which arrived in a very timely fashion) and duct tape the thing shut in the meantime, since I still needed it in place to keep the cage completely closed.All of my complaining aside, as I mentioned, my hamster really liked this cage. It's reasonably escape-proof (the hamster never got out on her own except through human error) without being owner-proof, it's roomy, it's kind of goofy and colorful, and the expandability and flexibility is really neat. Getting replacement parts for it is a cinch and super affordable. The base is deep enough that we didn't really have any trouble with bedding flying everywhere, and the rounded corners make it both easy to clean and more comfortable for the hamster to sleep in.It's a good cage, but it's not user-friendly.

Persisent dogs can easily scratch behind the cover even if you use the velcro fasteners -- she just scratched them off (and they took paint off the door). It could work for some dogs, but its no guarantee.

These are nothing like the one's used in a vet office. As a prior vet asst, these clippers seemed the same as the more expensive one used in clinics (besides the color difference). But when I tried to clip my german shepards nails it was a struggle and when I finally got through the nail, no matter which way I held the clippers, they'd lock up. So hear me when I say, stick to the orange handle clippers.

When we ordered two of these window perches, we were not sure if our cat would like them, but figured it was worth a try. The perches came two days after we ordered them (fast shipping!) and each took about 4 minutes to install. We didn't ahve to cut any holes int he sill or drill anything to the wall, it was so easy. :-)Within minutes of the first perch's assembly, our cat spotted it connected to the kitchen window. He didnt know if he should jump up on it or not since it was only a few feet away fomr the table and we always freak out when he goes in the table, so my fiance picked him up and placed him on the perch. he immediately started to kneed the perch and purr loudly. He tried rolling over on it, but it isn't big enough for him to roll completely over on.Now, almost every evening when my fiance and I come home from work, we walk in to find our kitty fast alseep on his perch. We installed the second perch in our computer room, but only allow our cat to go in there when either my fiance or I am with him because the fish tank is in there. When one of us is in the computer room working, our cat hops right on that perch and settles down for a nice long nap.

I replaced my old, broken LitterMaid with a new Scoop Free Self-Cleaning Litter Box 2 months ago, and I've been really impressed with how well it works - it really is pretty much maintenance-free (aside from stiring around the crystals periodically). I think the motor is a little bit quieter than the LitterMaid, and it doesn't seem to get stuck the way the LitterMaid often did. The litter tray replacement cartridges are expensive and so far I have not seen them in any local stores so I order from Amazon (free shipping). Also, I change the litter tray more frequently than it says you have to. I think it says for one cat you can let it go a month - no way! I change mine about every 10-14 days.Surprisingly, my older cat adapted to the crystal litter right away, however my younger cat won't have anything to do with the new box. I tried all of the tips in the Scoop Free instruction book to entice her to try out the new box (mixing clumping sand litter in with the crystals, letting her regular litter box get really dirty so she's forced to try out the new (clean) box, etc.), but she's still not interested. I think she doesn't like the "crunchy" noise the crystals make when she steps into the box. Oh well - my older cat, who is very picky about having a clean litter box, loves it, so I'm happy with my purchase.
I received the item quickly, and was extremely pleased. The item is as good as anything you would pay more for at a chain pet store. Wouldn't hesitate to purchase from this seller again.
Thought this would be perfect for my dog. He is 12 pounds and it was much too small for him to fit comfortably. Quality seemed good but size was inadequate.

It is my fault for not double checking the info after the cables arrived. I ordered two cables for our boxer mixes to use during a camping trip in the campground.Both cables did not have the spring loaded strain relief on them. Unfortunately it was past time to return them.

At this time in 2008 our yards were a haven for over 12 hummers so it off to the Amazon hummer store. We bought 2 new ones including the Pet 221. My first reaction was this will be just perfect for them because they can sit while eating and even thought the construction is somewhat shoddy it would work well for the birds. The little area to collect ants is well placed.So now comes spring and hummers we were excited to watch them and their new eating holes. We made no changes to the formula or any other item except the feeder itself. No hummers. Well, almost no hummers. A ruby red buzzed us several times at each location but would not feed. One day while putting one of last years feeders one actually sat on the feeder while I was emptying it into the plants. He fed and told me he did not like the new ones. Well, not really. But why would one hummer feed from the old and not from the new. Right now it is time to retire the new feeders and revert to the old. It is possible that the new has an odor in the plastic that the hummers do not like. I do not know. For now this has been a waste of money.

My dogs love these treats, and I do buy them occasionally because they are cheap and perched at the check-out counter of our local garden/feed store. But check out the ingredient list-- I don't think anyone can feel good about feeding their dog high-fructose corn syrup! Just not the healthiest option-- when so many of our dogs are overweight, it seems better to feed them a real liver treat, versus this product which is "made with liver".My dogs absolutely lovePro-Treat Beef Liver, Freeze Dried 14 Ounce(the larger size packages are more economical). I just feel a lot better about feeding real freeze-dried liver that doesn't have all the extra junk in Bil-Jac liver treats.Specifically, these treats have chicken "by-products"-- that means liquid slaughterhouse run-off and other non-human grade leftovers from the slaughterhouse. UGH! Bil-Jac also includes three preservatives, glycerin (?!), and the corn syrup.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Here's the ingredient list for Bil-Jac liver treats, so you can make your own decision:Liver, Chicken By-Products, Chicken By-Product Meal, Corn, Chicken Fat, Glycerin, High Fructose Corn Syrup, Propylene Glycol, Wheat Flour, Phosphoric Acid, Salt, Sodium Propionate and Potassium Sorbate and BHA and Citric Acid (Preservatives), Iron Oxide.

{THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE LARGE DUDE) My aussie mix and mom's visiting fox terrier love to compete to chase the squirrel dude down, but his bouncy action (which is cool, because even ace dogs can't predict where it's going and have more fun from the challenge)-- but it's heavy and means sometimes the little FT gets beaned pretty hard. Even our tough-girl aussie has been cruelly hit by this purple meanie. I took a star off for that, only one because I think buying a smaller size squirrel than you think you need could solve the problem. The other star off is for the lack of interest both dogs have in getting treats out of the SD even though I've cut off one of the treat-holders. Other reviewers had good ideas about that I will try. All that said, the humans in the house are very amused by this toy because he's so funny looking (and it's fun to yell "GET YOUR SQUIRREL DUDE!!") I'm going to buy the small size and bet that will be a five-star dog toy.

Our dog likes to play with this toy, but its tail came off within five minutes. The dog did not chew it off or anything, it fell off while tossing it around the house for her to go fetch. Overall, its fun but not durable.

We thought it was the answer to our prayers for the first few days, but then a stench started to brew!I thought the idea of having a conveyor lift the waste out of the box and into a receptacle was genius! But, it breaks apart the clumped urine, spreading little clumps of urine throughout. The conveyor is also waaaaaaaay to slow. It lifts the poop out just fine, but that looooong and slow journey from the bottom of the conveyor to the receptacle is a stink! Having the poop exposed while it traveled upward just made the area unbearable!Also, the conveyor leaves a minimal area for the cat to do it's business. Our cat pooped on the edge so many times. It was a stinky mess! We returned it.
what does size 22 mean? there is no sizing guide. I am very interested by have no idea what size to buy my dog.thanks

Some background info about my pup: She tugs and pulls everywhere we go. It's like she doesn't even recognize me at the other end of the leash while at home she listens to everything I say. Sometimes she likes to make my life harder when she hops 4-5 ft instead of walking. She is a 45 lb labrador/hunting hound mix. When she sees squirrels, she gets into hunting position with her body low against the ground and walks like a lion about to catch its prey. She goes from an angle where the squirrel cannot see her. When she is 5 ft from the squirrel she will make such a prounce that it feels like my arm has been almost ripped out if I'm not careful. I still love her though.About the Product: This leash has done the job for casual walks. I will NEVER EVER EVER use any kind of retractable leash if I know we will be in an area where I want her to be close, controlled and safe next to me. I just don't trust my pup too far away on a thin leash like this (even if it is all belted) with her hyperactivity and strength. Any moving object will make her go crazy and she can EASILY snap a leash like this especially if she is 16 ft out since I have less control the farther she is. I use it only on night walks when I know there are not many squirrels or distracting things outside. She has her freedom to walk a little bit more on the grass and go to the bathroom. Other than that, for her exercise I will take her to a dog park, baseball field or by the waterfront near me on a sturdy 6 ft leash where I run along with her.I would recommend retractable leashes for small dogs (yorkies, chihuahuas, malteses, etc.) I would not recommend retractable leashes for hyper dogs (of any size really other than toy size) or large dogs especially if it's somewhere risky or not safe. This leash is great for casual walks where you want your dog to have some bit of freedom.

I tried this product but as a gel it is very difficult to administer as an oral care for my pet dog. It requires that it be refrigerated which makes the gel version a lot thicker. It may be better to use the oral liquid version which can be easily administered as a spray.The ads and the description indicate that within a month the plaque on my pets teeth will start to disappear. Although I have had the gel version for about two weeks now is too soon to say in terms of results. The gel, when applied, does not adhere to the teeth and either gets dispelled by my pet or he "licks it up" and swallows which prevents a direct application.I'm still optimistic that this is a better alternative than traditional veterinary methods of teeth cleaning which require, and at great safety risk, to have the pet anesthetized. There is always a risk that the pet may not survive this method which is why I chose the gel application.John, NYC

I purchased this in late 2011 because my 1 cat will only drink from the faucet. I figured this would be the fresh water effect I needed. I took completely apart at least 1x a week but rinsed it out every day. I scrubbed it and rinsed the filter as well. In May 2012 I noticed some brown fleks floating in the water. The filter was brand new...only used it for about 2 weeks. I pulled it out and it was completely covered in a brown sludge! I was disgusted!! Took it apart and even used a bottle brush to get into whatever areas I could. Again the fleks showed up...again washed it thoroughly. This happened several times. I noticed there is a narrow area that is very slim that nothing can fit in. Apparently it builds up a mold or something. I am so frustrated since I took it thoroughly apart every week and let it dry for almost 24 hrs before putting it back together again. I refuse to use it because now I am afraid my cats will get a bacteria from it. This is the 2nd one I purchased. The first one which I THOUGHT was great...except about a month after purchasing started noticing my floor was getting wet. I am so glad I didnt put it directly on the rug..but on a rubber mat underneath. The entire thing was leaking!! I would NOT recommend this.

My puppy chewed through the red plastic handle and after that started on the "rope", which is many thin threads braided together. She was able to break the threads with no problem. If your dog likes to tug and doesn't chew, it should be fine, but for aggressive chewers -- it isn't indestructible.

I already have a EHEIM 2217 (purchased here as well)and I purchased this EHEIM 2215 for a smaller tank. These filters work great, but the packaging is non-existent (for both filters, it was ONE sheet of curled brown paper, unbelievable). There is no packaging between the filter box and the shipping box except the sheet of paper, and no padding inside the filter box whatsoever. The first one had a clump broken upon arrival; it was not crucial, so I fixed it with glue. This second one had the bottom plastic connector completely broken into pieces, and I had to return it. So the three stars are 5 for the filter, zero for the stupidity of whoever is choosing the packaging. Rounded up because I like to think I am a nice person.

I hope this hooks my dog up so that he can live a long healthy life. I mix it into his food, and he eats it without complaint. I got a ton of vitamins from these folks for not a lot of money, and I think that it will add years to my dog's life. It's worth it - buy it. your dog will love you more. You'll feel better.
If you have a dog that loves food or is strong willed then skip this toy my yellow lab had gotten that done with in 30 min

For basically mini trash bags, it's a little pricey although this was the best price I could find around. Our first bag had a cut in it but we were able to turn it so it was out of the way. The next couple seem to be without defect.We previously used detergant/bleach to clean out the kitty litter for years without using a liner. Therefore it was more of a hassle doing that weekly. I finally switched to liners because of the hassle although I still think they are a little pricey for what they are. Although, they do save time and hassle which makes it worth it.
This works wonderfully on my cats. It removes a lot of fur and I don't have to kill my fingers trying to remove the discarded fur from the deshedder.

We bought the gentle leader based on favorable reviews from others who have used it. The head collar works great, but it has a couple flaws.First, there is little to secure the neck collar from getting loosened or reset. The only thing to secure the sizing of the neck collar is the latch itself, which can easily loosen or reset when the collar is not being worn. We find ourselves refitting the collar every other time we put it on.When the collar is worn, the excess portion of the collar will dangle with no place to secure it. We knotted it a couple times to reduce the length, otherwise it would disturb the pup. Most quality collars will use two points to secure the collar and secure the excess, but not the gentle leader.Second, the nose loop wears down bald spots on our dog's snout, just under his eyes. This is supposedly remedied with a deluxe version using felt, but Amazon does not appear to carry it.

I use this as a supplement because I home cook for my dogs ... but I have a foster sheltie and my parents Sheltie visits and both of them got horrible loose stools (even bloody) when trying to use this. On my own dogs which are around 30 and 40 pounds, I give them about 1/3 the required supplement or they also get loose stools ... There is good nutrition in this stuff, but something definitely upsets the dogs stomachs, especially at the recommended dosage!

My dog has very long, thick hair and I was able to shave him to a quarter of an inch long, maybe shorter, with ease and completely painless. Yes, it took awhile, maybe an hour to an hour and a half, but it never burnt out on me. I'm quite pleased with this product and so is my dog!

These are really stinky. Not a problem as far as the dog is concerned; most dogs would be hard pressed to decide if they wanted to eat or roll in four day old road kill, after all. I, however, am thanking my lucky stars I have an airproof tin tub to store these treats in. The strips are also irregularly sized and shaped. Again, the dog doesn't seem to mind, but, given the smell, I would prefer not to have to poke thru the bag looking for a large piece when I want to keep the dog occupied for a while. I assume the dog would give these a five star rating; I give them only a three.

For some strange reason, my Betta didn't like this food. It was difficult for it to at least try it, but spitted out immediately!I feed him with Bloodworms (by Tetra), and he loves it. My guess is that my betta is so very custom to worms that he doesn't wanna try anything else. So I guess it would unfair to actually rate this product. That's why I give 3 stars, no bad nor good...!

If you are a dog or cat owner trying to find a bulb that puts out enough heat to keep a small box warm, this isn't it.
